story:
FLOATING CINEMA ‘EXTRA-ORDINARY’

A Public Art project that will animate the canals and rivers of East London, United Kingdom.

The FLOATING CINEMA ‘EXTRA-ORDINARY’ will bring outdoor film screenings, performative tours and live events to London’s canals;  re-animating the waterways and breathing new life into the East End of London.

Produced by UP Projects with Somewhere and Duggan Morris Architects and commissioned by The Legacy List.

 

WHAT IS THE FLOATING CINEMA ‘EXTRA-ORDINARY’?

There is something magical about the words Floating and Cinema that really captures people’s imaginations. UP Projects came up with the concept in 2011 and created a very successful pilot project that navigated the canals and rivers of East London temporarily using a converted narrow boat to host on-board and outdoor film screenings to bank side audiences as well as taking people on creative, quirkily hosted tours of the fascinating network of East London’s waterways.

Following the project’s huge success and public demand, we are building a brand new FLOATING CINEMA ‘EXTRA-ORDINARY’, designed by award-winning practice Duggan Morris Architects, which will become a permanent fixture on London’s waterways.

We plan to launch the FLOATING CINEMA ‘EXTRA-ORDINARY’ in June 2013 with a screening and events programme devised by artists Nina Pope and Karen Guthrie (Somewhere).  The FLOATING CINEMA ‘EXTRA-ORDINARY’ will be commissioning new films and performances as well as showcasing new work that would never be seen in mainstream cinemas.

Audiences will be treated to intimate on board screenings  for 15 people, bespoke tours by performers, comedians, writers and cultural commentators, as well as large scale outdoor screenings hosting up to 500 people.  Each tour and event will also be streamed live to an international online audience.

The FLOATING CINEMA ‘EXTRA-ORDINARY’ will visit Islington and Shoreditch, the new Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park as well as the wilds of the Lea Valley and beyond.  It is supported by the Legacy List, a charity established to support the long term cultural, social and physical regeneration of London's Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park and aims to breathe new life into the dilapidated canals and backwaters, and add to the cultural life of London’s East End.

 

WHO ARE UP PROJECTS?

UP Projects is a creative non-profit organisation that believes in challenging perceptions of what public art can be, and we are celebrating our tenth anniversary this year.  Operating as a gallery without walls, we are inspired by the complexities of the public realm to create a programme of artists' commissions, projects, strategies and multidisciplinary events for the broadest possible public audience. Our projects always aim to encourage people who may not ordinarily visit museums, galleries or theatres to engage and participate in high quality cultural activity.

We also provide unique opportunities for artists to develop new work in public contexts.

FLOATING CINEMA ‘EXTRA-ORDINARY’ is part of our ongoing ‘Portavilion’ strand of projects, an ambitious programme of artist-led installations for London’s parks, open spaces and more recently the waterways. The project is as much a celebration of the city's most treasured open spaces as it is a cultural event.

 

HOW DID THE CONCEPT FOR THE FLOATING CINEMA COME ABOUT?

The canals are the arteries of East London, and have remained a constant in the rapidly changing landscape of an area undergoing significant regeneration. They are the best kept secret of our industrial history and in recent years have been neglected and overlooked. We have been thinking about  how the canals could become an important part of London’s cultural life, and how to bring public attention back to these overlooked, yet enchanting public spaces and use them for a variety of cultural events and activities….thus the Floating Cinema concept was born.

 

HOW DO WE KNOW THE IDEA WILL “FLOAT”?

We learned a lot from last year’s pilot project. Not least the level of enthusiasm and demand for such a venture.  Each out door screening gathered audiences of over 300 people, and every on board event could have been booked out ten times over and our website had over 100,000 visitors!  We got really great feedback...

“A surreal but truly unique and fun evening”

“It was great to be able to experience Canary Wharf from the water”

“A really unique and lovely experience!”

“A quirky and unforgettable moment in my holiday”

“Something completely different – opportunity to meet new people and experience something different”

“Well conceived, beautifully cared for, the art was wonderful, engaging and provoking and the setting for the work was perfect!”

 

HOW DOES IT FIT INTO THE OLYMPIC LEGACY?

FLOATING CINEMA ‘EXTRA-ORDINARY’ will form an important part of the cultural participation programme following the 2012 Olympic and Paralympic Games.  This is being led by the London Legacy Development Corporation (LLDC) and supported by The Legacy List, an independent charity raising funds to make creative connections between people and the park.  The Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park will reopen in phases, with the first phase which includes the North Park opening to the public on 27 July 2013. We plan to present outdoor screenings and bespoke tours on the site as part of the opening festival.

“Post games projects like this will encourage people to think that the Olympic Park is for all of us and that we are going to be here after the games”
Sarah Weir OBE, Chief Executive, The Legacy List

 

WHO IS DESIGNING THE NEW FLOATING CINEMA?

We ran an international architecture competition earlier this year and together with a formidable panel of judges (including Lady Patty Hopkins, representatives from the London Legacy Development Coroporation, the Legacy List and the Architecture Foundation) we selected the winning design by Duggan Morris Architects. We felt their proposal for “A Strange Cargo of Extra-Ordinary Objects” presented a robust and practical, as well as highly inventive and imaginative, response to the brief.

 

Duggan Morris Architects have been established for 8 years, during which time they have received several RIBA Awards and the prestigious Manser Medal. 2012 represents a transitional phase for the practice, moving into a number of new sectors including higher education, public and arts based projects, conservation and renovation as well as continuing successful work in private housing, public housing and regeneration and commercial sector projects.

 

WHAT WILL THE FLOATING CINEMA ‘EXTRA-ORDINARY’ BE LIKE?

Duggan Morris Architects’ designs incorporate an auditorium/cabin that will seat up to 15 people. This intimate scale is perfect for group tour or screening, while also still nimble enough for us to navigate the intricacies of the UK canal network, and squeeze under the smallest bridge or through the narrowest lock.

It will also boast a café/ticket office, an outdoor “public square” / foyer and accommodation for our skipper.  The new design also features a periscopic projector that will be able to project a moving image onto the water, the inside of tunnels or adjacent buildings, and will incorporate a web cam, GPS tracking system and a clever piece of kit that will enable us stream all our events live to an on line audience. So wherever you are, you’ll be able to get involved with the FLOATING CINEMA ‘EXTRA-ORDINARY’ experience!

All events will be open to the public.

 

WHERE WILL IT MOORED AND HOW LONG WILL IT STAY THERE?

We are planning to moor the cinema near to the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, but we will be moving all over the waterways during the summer, and hope to remain a highly visible feature for many years to come.

 

HOW WILL WE USE THE MONEY?

This is our ballpark project breakdown:

  • Boat hull - $USD 24,300 / £GBP 15,000
  • Cinema auditorium - $USD 40,700 / £GBP 25,200
  • Skipper’s quarters - $USD 20,600 / £ 12,800
  • Technical equipment - $USD 27,400 / £GBP 17,000
  • Boat kit - $USD 5,000 / £GBP 3,000

TOTAL - $USD 118,000 / £GBP 73,000

 

WHO IS ALREADY ON BOARD WITH FUNDING?

Floating Cinema 2013 has been majority funded by the Legacy List through its corporate partnerships with Bloomberg LP and the Canal and River Trust.  $USD 100,000 or 85% of total required funds have been secured to date, but we need an extra 15% or $USD 18,000 to make the project happen.

 

WHAT DO YOU GET IN RETURN FOR YOUR OWN SUPPORT?

Not only will you become a vital part of the Floating Cinema and receive regular updates on where we are and what we are doing, we have also developed a special range of gifts for you to suit your own unique taste. These include limited edition T-shirts and tote bags designed by the Floating Cinema creative team, tickets to the opening night and a one-of-a-kind opportunity to get your name etched onto one of the Floating Cinema auditorium seats designed by Duggan Morris Architects! No matter which one you go for, we hope that your gift will be a reminder of how much your donations and support mean to us! Please check the right hand side of this page for more details.

 

HOW DO YOU CHECK ON YOUR PERKS?

After the campaign, we will be sending you updates with expected timelines for you perk delivery. Our objective is to get all perks delivered within 10 months of finishing the campaign and we will try to accommodate your individual wishes as much as we possibly can.

For more information, check out http://support.indiegogo.com/entries/20500923-how-to-check-on-your-perks

 

HOW CAN YOU CONTRIBUTE?

You may contribute by clicking on the “Contribute Now” button in the top right hand side of this page. You’ll be able to enter how much you want to contribute, claim your perk, and choose how you want to pay. We accept Visa, MasterCard, and American Express credit or debit cards, or you can choose to pay via PayPal. All transactions take place in $USD. Don’t worry if your account is in £GBP or any other currency, the transaction will be automatically converted and equivalent amount will be applied. If your contribution is successful, an automatic confirmation email will be sent to the email address you provided during the contribution process.

Please note that your credit card or PayPal account will be charged the contribution amount immediately if your transaction is successful, not at the end of the campaign. If you pay via PayPal, you will receive another confirmation email from PayPal, in addition to the confirmation email you'll receive from Indiegogo. However, if we do not reach our target at the end of the campaign, the money will be fully refunded to you.

For a step-by-step easy contribution process, please refer to this http://support.indiegogo.com/entries/20494567-how-to-contribute-to-a-campaign

If you have any other questions, feel free to get in touch at press@upprojects.com

 

 

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR ALL YOUR ‘EXTRA-ORDINARY’ LOVE AND SUPPORT!

story:
Sky Light

Hi - I'm Chrispy!

Sky Light is my first piece of LED art - it has been a tremendous journey to get to where we are right now. A lot of work has already been done.

With the help of a ton of really amazing volunteers, we built the first version of Sky Light and displayed it at Soak, the Oregon regional burn, earlier this year. Now it's time to push forward and finish the piece - make it weather proof, and make it interactive.

I'm really excited to see this piece continue to evolve - thank you so much for your help!

 

So what are you working on exactly?

Sky Light is an LED art piece.

Right now it consists of 61 acrylic boxes that contain about 1000 LEDs. And it's not yet interactive.

We want to add another 42 boxes, finish the geometric shape of the piece, and add another 1500 LEDs. This is going to require a retrofit of the wiring of the piece, more power supplies, more LEDs, and a lot of work.

story:
The Project

My name is Ava Porter and I am an MFA candidate in Visual Arts at UCSD.  One year ago my partner, Farhad Akhmetov, and I set out to make a sculpture, The Wrestlers, generated entirely from real-time motion.  The idea was to use contemporary cinematic technologies such as 3D scanning and motion capture to digitally acquire the movement of two Brazilian Jiu Jitsu wrestlers as they sparred. Once acquired, this movement could be "crystallized" into a single form (or frame as in the motion blur captured by a photograph) and carved into real space by a CNC machine.  This frozen motion would then be cast in translucent polyurethane-based resin, to produce a life-size sculpture reminiscent of the 20th century Cubist and Futurist attempts to convey the passage of time within a single object, yet no longer representational and instead wholly objective.

This work, in addition to a series of videos and photographs, will constitute my thesis at UCSD.  The exhibition will be free and open to the public, with a closing party on June 12, 2015.  


What We Need 

We have made huge progress with the implementation of this highly innovative project due to generous in-kind support.  xxArray has produced the 3D scans and Xsens 3D Motion Capture Company has performed the motion capture.  UCSD has provided studio space and production equipment and will also provide the CNC milling machine when the time comes to carve.  Rey Diogo Brazilian Jiu Jitsu has provided practice and production space.  UCSD and UCIRA have provided a number of small grants for preliminary costs.  The values of these services and equipment total over $50,000. 


However, we still need an additional $8,000 in cash for the cost of materials and labor in the project's final stages.

BUDGET BREAKDOWN:
$1,500 for the cost of high-density foam (to be carved).
$2,000 for the cost of polyurethane resin.
$1,000 for the cost of mold-making materials.
$2,000 for a rigger/Maya specialist.
$1,000 for a sculpture fabricator.
$500 for installation costs and miscellaneous expendables.

The Impact

Visually complex, and full of contradictions, Brazilian Jiu Jitsu’s aesthetics reflect what is below the surface of the sport and of society itself, making it rich subject matter for a work of art.  When 176-pound Royce Gracie defeated 216-pound kick boxing champion Gerard Gordeau in under two minutes in the very first Ultimate Fighting Championship, he proved Brazilian Jiu Jitsu to be the most effective and destructive combat sport in the world.  However, Brazilian Jiu Jitsu often looks more like a tender embrace than an explosive attack.  Positions typically considered submissive or female in mainstream society become the most powerful positions in a Jiu Jitsu ring.  For example, “full guard,” Brazilian Jiu Jitsu’s primary position, entails a fighter wrapping his legs around the waist of his opponent to pull him close.  Although this is a move to gain control of an opponent, this move can be seen, not only an expression of violence, but also as one of intimacy.  


Sports have been used as an outlet for societal aggression for millennia.  From Ancient Sumerian wrestling to the gladiatorial fights of the Roman Empire to contemporary American Football, the theater of male athletics has provided a simulation of unchecked testosterone – virile, stoic, and unapologetic – that feeds our collective hunger for violence without forcing us to reflect or act on that hunger. I am interested, not only in the sublimation of the violence itself – in my mind this is a given – but also in what this sublimation makes way for, a type of intimacy among men that is perhaps otherwise taboo in mainstream Western society.

Whether among opponents in a competition or teammates in practice, a sparring match is a consensual act.  The athletes consent to fight within limitations – codes of sportsmanship are adhered to, a point system is enforced, and certain moves are restricted.  The goal of the fight is submission through technique, not death or injury by way of brute force.  This enables fighters of different genders, ages or weight categories to safely practice and compete with one another (which I know from experience as I, myself, began training over 6 months ago, am one of only two women at the school, and weigh substantially less than the other students).  

By fighting according to these protocols, fighters are in a constant state of identification with their opponent.  They construct their opponent not as the “other,” but as their partner, facilitating the development of trust and therefor intimacy among fighters.   



In The Wrestlers, through a carefully crafted sculpture and film piece, I will present wrestling, not as the ego-driven sport of mainstream cinema, but as an allegory for these social implications of violence and intimacy.  Contemporary films like Rocky and Raging Bull, while important works, tend to present the fighter as a self-interested, hostile, and ultimately dangerous man, when wrestlers have in past centuries been used to allegorize strength, commitment, religion, and power.  Wrestling as a genre enjoys substantial precedents throughout the history of art.  With wrestling forms in nearly every culture and artistic examples as diverse as Paleolithic cave paintings, Classical Greek sculpture, Renaissance frescoes and early photographic studies, wrestling can easily be placed within the canon of traditional subject matter for artwork.

According to Jorge Luis Borges: “four are the stories. During the time left to us we will continue telling them, transformed.”  These stories – a love story between two people, a love story between three people, the struggle for power, and the voyage – can also be applied to visual art.  If wrestling (the struggle for power) is one of these stories, as a contemporary artist it is my goal to update its representation. 


This project is made possible by

In-kind Support:
Rey Diogo Brazilian Jiu Jitsu
UCSD Visual Arts Department
UCSD Media Teaching Lab
Xsens Motion Capture
xxArray

Financial Support:
UCIRA Mini Grant
UCSD Russel Grant
UCSD Visual Arts Fellowship

Special Thanks:
Rey Diogo
Adriene Hughes
Tad Linfesty

opponent.  They construct their opponent
not as the “other,” but as their partner, facilitating the development of trust and therefor intimacy among fighters.   

In The Wrestlers, through a carefully crafted sculpture and film piece, I will
present wrestling, not as the ego-driven sport of mainstream cinema, but as an
allegory for these social implications of violence and intimacy.  Contemporary films like Rocky and Raging Bull,
while important works, tend to present the fighter as a self-interested,
hostile, and ultimately dangerous man, when wrestlers have in past centuries
been used to allegorize strength, commitment, religion, and power.  Wrestling
as a genre enjoys substantial precedents throughout the history of art.  With wrestling forms in nearly every culture
and artistic examples as diverse as Paleolithic cave paintings, Classical Greek
sculpture, Renaissance frescoes and early photographic studies, wrestling can
easily be placed within the canon of traditional subject matter for artwork.



According
to Jorge Luis Borges: “four are the
stories. During the time left to us we will continue telling them, transformed.”  These stories – a love story between two
people, a love story between three people, the struggle for power, and the
voyage – can also be applied to visual art.  If wrestling (the struggle for power) is one
of these stories, as a contemporary artist it is my goal to update its
representation. 

This project is made possible by

In-kind Support:Rey Diogo Brazilian Jiu JitsuUCSD Visual Arts DepartmentUCSD Media Teaching LabXsens Motion CapturexxArray
Financial Support:UCIRA Mini GrantUCSD Russel GrantUCSD Visual Arts Fellowship
Special Thanks:Rey DiogoAdriene HughesTad Linfesty

story:
Campaign Update -– July 29th, 2013

 

Since we are fully funded for our campaign, but still have 20 days left on our Indiegogo campaign, we decided that we'd really like to up our fundraising another $1,250 in order to buy a full-size letterpress for SAFTA. We were going to do a campaign this winter, but we're only $925 away from that goal now!

All original deals still apply, and there are lots of animals that still need names and great SAFTA and Sundress perks! Remember, all gifts of $200 and up come with a free SAFTA membership.

 

Please consider giving to help us on this endeavor!

 

 

 

Short Summary

 

The brainchild of Sundress Publications, a registered non-profit, The Sundress Academy for the Arts (SAFTA) was founded in February 2013 at Firefly Farms in Karns, Tennessee. Nestled in an old-fashioned "holler" just twenty minutes from downtown Knoxville, this picturesque 29-acre farm is the perfect artists' getaway; visitors can hone their creative crafts as they escape the routine of modern life. Whether you're hiking, camping, foraging, or hunting, you will reconnect with nature and be inspired by a part of the Appalachia landscape that is often forgotten. SAFTA attendees can also expect to learn a host of new skills from the staff to enrich their work.

 

In order to help fund this enormous project, we plan to host livestock, including self-pastured horses, a small herd of goats and sheep to "mow" the pastures and control wild growth, and chickens to produce eggs for egg dishes galore! To get started, we must finish mending the fences along the property, buy and install gates, build shelter for the horses, and acquire the animals themselves.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $1,500, which will cover eco-friendly solar fencing (approximately $200 for the solar charger and another $150 for the actual fencing), five gates of varying sizes (approximately $100 apiece), wood for the construction of horse shelters (approximately $400), plus five sheep, five goats (both animals $50-$100 apiece), and ten to twelve chickens ($8 apiece). All animals will be cage-free and pasture-grazed in an idyllic country environment!

 

By giving to this campaign, you will not only support small farming in the United States, but also make a huge investment in SAFTA’s future. Donors who contribute at least $10 will receive awesome Sundress Publications swag, and all donors who give over $100 will qualify for discounts on SAFTA workshops and residencies, as well as other fun and creative perks.  

 

Donors who give $200-$499 will receive a one-year Urania level membership for SAFTA & Sundress Publications, which includes one free SAFTA day workshop plus 33% off all other workshops during that year, 33% off all Sundress titles, free entry into one Sundress Publications contest, and a free broadside of your choice.  Donors who give $500 and over will receive a Terpsichore level membership, which will give you seven free SAFTA day workshops per year, 50% off all Sundress titles, free entry into any Sundress Publications contest, and a SAFTA t-shirt and shot glass.

 

All donors will receive a link to our ATV tour of Firefly Farms taken at perilously unsafe speeds!  (It's a thrilling three minutes.)

 

Should we manage to raise money above and beyond our goal, we will direct funds toward other projects, such as reconstructing barns, building a stage for our Theater in the Woods, and erecting residency cabins at the top of the hill. 

 

The Impact

We have been stunned by the investment of physical labor and determination by the Knoxville literary and arts community since our founding in February. In just four short months, we have gutted the farmhouse and nearly completed an extensive rewiring of the entire building. We have put new floors in two of the rooms and dug a drainage trench to divert rainwater and runoff. We have also cleared nearly three acres of pastureland for this project, all of which was deeply wooded with five-to-seven years’ worth of young-growth trees and brush.

 

This would not have been possible without the support of Knoxville's writers and artists, whose faith in this project, not to mention their willingness to donate precious time and energy, has demonstrated the clear desire for a space such as this. Still, we need your help, too. By giving to SAFTA, you will help us continue to move rapidly forward and achieve our goal of opening for artist residencies in Fall 2013.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't give to this particular project, there are other ways that you can help!

 

- You can donate your time and labor as a volunteer at Firefly Farms.  

- If you live in the Knoxville area, you can donate furniture, appliances, and other miscellaneous housewares by contacting Erin Elizabeth Smith at erin@sundresspublications.com.  

- You can donate books to our library by mailing them to Sundress Academy for the Arts, c/o Erin Elizabeth Smith, 195 Tobby Hollow Lane, Karns, TN 37830.

story:
Short Summary

Fantasmata was conceived in 2015 as a collaboration between flautist Klio Blonz, actress and director Amanda Douge and poet and filmmaker Pye Ciardha. All three artists work at a high level in their artistic disciplines.  Following a successful workshop performance at The Peckham Festival the team has also been joined by sculptor Laurence Louisfert.  We now need to raise initial productions funds to make our first season possible. The vision for Fantasmata is that return seasons are performed twice yearly in London.  At its heart this project is an evocation to a transformed and more connected world. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to raise £3000 for Asylum space rental, screen and projector hire, and PA system
  • We have perks from social media credits, opening night tix, CD recordings through to associate producer credits available
  • If we do not reach our funding goal the funds will still go towards the production. 

The Impact

  • Feedback from the workshop performance: "This is a very beautiful multimedia performance.I was privileged to attend a "work in progress" performance of it last year and found it really magical", "Packs quite a punch", "Wonderous, haunting, sublime and disorientating", "The poetry is beautiful and astounding." 

Risks & Challenges

  • We will continue to seek sources of assistance until we can get the first season up. 
  • The largest risk is that the April season will have to be changed to a later date to allow for further fund raising. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please help spread the word by social media and with your face to face networks
  • When the ticket line is up and running, Book! Booking tickets helps us too! 
  • If you like the trailer please share widely on social media and comment on our fb page.
  • Please spread the word so that this wonderful vision can be made real.

story:
About The Fest

SHEER QUEER Fest seeks to reclaim space in music to promote and center the voices of angry queers, furious trans folks, and other rowdy gayz.

Last year we raised over $1,200 for Youth on Fire, a youth drop in center that works with queer youth without homes, assisting in their ability to remain open during the winter. (They have since over turned some of the budget cuts from the state and are no longer at risk of closing!) This year we are working with SWOP-Boston (Sex Worker Outreach Program) to do our part to support people in our community who have been dealing with the fallout of the passing of SESTA/FOSTA.

The dates for the fest are set for September 21st, 22nd, and 23rd. Friday and Saturday will be at Hardcore Stadium (55 Bishop Allen Rd Cambridge, MA). Sunday will be at Once Somerville (156 Highland Ave. Somerville, MA) In addition to the bands and performers we've confirmed with, The Boston League of Wicked Wrestlers (BLOWW) will be bringing the pain for our half time beatdown of live wrestling matches on Saturday!

Sheer Queer Fest stands in solidarity with all marginalized communities and aims to combat racism, sexism, homo/transphobia, and other harmful behaviors present in radical spaces. Oppressive behavior will not be tolerated at the fest. BROS, FASCISTS, AND NAZIS FUCK OFF!
 

What The Funds Go Towards

All the funds raised from this campaign will go directly to helping the bands travel to Boston for the fest and cover any space rental fee's for the venues. We have been doing a bunch of benefits leading up to the fest but there are still expenses that need to be covered. Due to the size of the fest, we had few options for spaces and they have much higher room fees than we originally anticipated. This is your opportunity to ensure that the fest is able to accommodate everyone and go off without issue!
 

This Year's Perks

Last year we only had a shirt. This year we've got way more in the works so be sure to check out all of them as well as our combo deals for all the merch!


SHEER QUEER Fest 2017 T-shirt
We still have a few of the shirts from last year's fest in limited sizes which we are offering at a discounted rate. There are 9 larges, 9 xl, and 5 2xl left so act quickly if you want to snag last year's shirt! Artwork by Jamezie.

  
SHEER QUEER Fest 2018 T-shirt
Artwork by Manny Raposo

 


The SHEER QUEER Fest 2018 Compilation Tape
Artwork also by Manny Raposo

 


The SHEER QUEER Fest 2018 Poster
Artwork by Liz Bolduc
(finalized version with actual lineup coming soon!)

 


Button Packs
Your selection of two button packs that weren't necessarily printed for SHEER QUEER but they are queer as hell and are all about bashing nazis so why not?

 

The SHEER QUEER TAG TEAM CHAMPIONSHIP
A combo only bested by burning cop cars and the skulls of white supremacists, this perk includes: The SHEER QUEER Fest 2018 T-shirt and Fest Compilation Tape

 

THE SHEER QUEER UNIVERSAL CHAMPIONSHIP

Achieve super fan status with this combo pack which includes: The SHEER QUEER Fest 2018 T-shirt, The SHEER QUEER Fest 2018 Compilation Tape, a Button Pack of yer choosing, and a SHEER QUEER Fest Final Line Up Poster signed by the folks of BLOWW!

 

Confirmed Bands

Returning bands:
Solarized/ Corvus B./ Gudsforladt / WIMP/ Goolagoon

New bands:
Salt Circles/ Primitive Rage/ Mar/ uncertain/ Tossed Aside/ Causa/ Sap (OH)/ Nightspace/ Crystal Methodist/ Space Camp/ Great Weights/ Argument?/ Hagazussa/ Videodome/ Kind Crew/ Dicksucker/ Perennial/ Sap (MA)/ Brandi Blaze/ The Breathing Light/ B/\gg/\ge / Creamer/Secret Miracle/ Isabella Amarga/ Medino Green/ Kilamanzego

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone has cash to spare, and that's no problem! You can still help by telling your friends about this campaign and the fest. Or if you are in the Boston area and can host a band or would like to help out the day of the fest please contact us at sheerqueerfest (at) gmail.com

And don't forget to check out the fest to see all of the amazing acts we've booked this time around on Sept. 21st-23rd!

story:
Community Letterpress Printing

Olio Artists & Workers Cooperative is a non-profit artist run centre looking to expand their community screenprinting shop to include 3 letterpress printing presses in an effort to make the medium accessible to artists, designers, crafters, makers, do-ers and anyone in between for inarguably affordable rates.

 

What's it do?

Letterpress machines are versatile and beautiful things, capable of producing unmistakable prints, embossing, die cutting, perforating, folding, custom packaging, including vinyl & CD sleeves, custom boxes & just about anything you can think of. But they are heavy. And expensive. And hard to use.

The workhorse of the shop will be a 3/4 tonne Chandler & Price printing press capable of printing up to 10x15", embossing, perforating, scoring, die cutting and foil stamping.

The main press will be flanked by two smaller presses, a bank of lead type, custom wood block cutting & plate making facilities, stock dies for vinyl sleeves, business cards & custom packaging.


Publicly Accessible & Affordable

The letterpress printing facilities will be available to the public for rates that artists, designers, printers, crafters and makers can afford. $30 annual membership (includes access to cooperative studio including screenprinting facilities) and $5/hr studio time.

Inks, consumables, stocks, plates & dies will be offered with Olio's current non-profit rates.


L/E Print by Luke Ramsey



"Dismantle War Machines"

7 colour screenprint
Limited edition • signed & numbered

Luke Ramsey's art is as informative as it is gorgeous. This piece focuses on reinventing the machinery of war and industry in the image of something more ethical and human.

Support a good cause & get an incredible print for your efforts.

Hand pulled 7 colour screenprint on 230 gsm archival cotton stock.




For more information ro to stay in touch through the mailing list, head to:
www.oliocooperative.ca

story:
About Skipping Stones Theatre

We are an independent theatre collective, formed by artists who started in the same place, but began hopping to new ones to learn and explore. We're based in the Greater Toronto Area, but have an international perspective, acquired through study in North America, Europe, and Asia.

Art commonly offers insight to someone else's experience, but in rare moments, art will allow us to better understand ourselves. We could all use a bit of help with understanding who we are - the most important step towards becoming the best version of ourselves. 

Skipping Stones Theatre focuses on plays or interpretations of plays through the lens of mental health.

https://www.skippingstonestheatre.com/

The Impact

This project is ambitious and our budget is based on a profit-share model. By contributing to the physical costs of the production you will allow us to financially support our independent artists. We make a concerted effort to keep our production costs low through the classic tactic of "Reduce Reuse Recycle" to maximize the pay out to our artists.

Why $700?

As a company, we have two goals:

1) To tell our stories with integrity.

2) To PAY our artists.

Our Indiegogo campaign will contribute to sets, costumes, props, administrative costs and marketing. The more of these physical costs we can cover before ticket sales, the more able we are to provide our artists with a respectable salary. Our goal for our crowdfunding campaign is only looking to cover the base physical costs of the production. We have been hustling with other fundraising avenues to cover the rest. Below is a more specified breakdown of where our crowdfunding campaign will be going:

Props: $100

Costumes: $150

Set: $100

Promotional materials: $100

Photographer/Multimedia: $150

Technician: $100

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that there are always numerous projects looking for assistance, so anything you can do to support this project is HIGHLY appreciated. We will do everything we can artistically to earn your support, but as we are not above bribery, check out our YUMMY PERKS 'cause they're wicked awesome.

Want to further help us out? Spread the word:  Either by word of mouth and/or social media. You can share our crowdfunding page via Facebook, Instagram and Twitter. We'll love you for it!

Thanks, and Thanks, and Ever Thanks.

We thank you greatly in advance and look forward to bringing you Hamlet(s) this November 15, 16, 17, 22, 23, 24 at the b current studio theatre, 601 Christie St #251, Toronto!

Much love,

Kate McArthur, Breanna Maloney, Sean O'Brien

Skipping Stones Theatre

story:
What we are

SackReligious is an evolving family endeavor that reflects our love of differences and diversity. A way to elevate subcultures and maybe be a little snarky in the process. Because the truth is, we're a little stressed. A lot. And we don't just want to survive, we want to make a difference. It matters to us. A lot matters to us. A lot. Our worldview is that of inclusion, respect, support, and compassion. We celebrate differences and realize we all want the same things. Love, tolerance, acceptance, freedom. In our family unit we represent a few subcultures and feel strongly that even so we come from a place of privilege and want to use that for the advancement of human kindness and connection.

There's no better way to spread that message than with art, and even better art you carry with you. And so SackReligious is born! Counterculture art you wear and use. Specifically, well, sacks! Bags! For carrying stuff and making a statement.

Making a big debut!

May 31st - June 3rd is HearseCon 2018, we have a table reserved for their Morbid Curiosities Expo on June 2nd and this will be SackReligious first physical debut and we need your help to make it a success.

Our $750 goal is enough money to get us the 2 big pieces of equipment we need to get or little bag making enterprise underway! We need a vinyl cutter and a heat press to make our bags a reality. 5% of all our raised funds will be donated to Ditch the Label, more on them in a minute. Beyond that the rest of the funds will cover IndieGoGo's 5% platform fee, materials for making the bags and offset travel costs to HearseCon.

What it means to us

It's a family dream to run our own business that makes a difference in the world. SackReligious is the culmination of years of just thinking about it, and we're here to make it real. We are but a few punk, goth, geek, nerd, hippie, rebels, our reach is small but our hopes are ENORMOUS. So when we set out to make this happen we wanted to find a charity who's views matched our own. Enter Ditch the Label, whose aesthetic and underlying beliefs perfectly mirror our own. So when you contribute to this project you won't only be helping a family realize one of their dreams, you'll also be supporting a worthy cause.

The goods!

What's in it for you? A really cool bag of your choice! We have thirteen designs to choose from, with more on the way if we get enough support. There are 2 bag styles you can choose from, a mid-size grocery tote or a drawstring backpack, both are 100% cotton high-quality bags. And only for our IndieGoGo backers, you have the choice of 5 different colors, when we sell these bags in the future designs will come in specific colors! There are 2 tiers for each bag, just the bag or the bag plus a pair of one of our earring designs! If you want more than one bag you can make one contribution for a bag then come back and make a second (or third!) contribution to get a different design. All the designs and options are detailed below.

Risks & Challenges

Truthfully we've never made bags with designs on them before, but that shouldn't scare you! We are a family of artists with a combined 10 years experience in manufacturing and product fulfillment. We're a bunch of smart cookies, we're capable of anything we set our minds to. So our biggest challenge is simply getting the right tools for the job, and that's why you're here!

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our campaign, tell your friends, follow us on Facebook and Instagram to keep up to date on what we're doing next!
You can also buy some of our already available products on our SackReligious Etsy store or our sister store Mermaid Adjacent.

story:
Breve Resumen

 

¿Quiénes somos? 

Para realizar el proyecto Cabo Manglares -una posibilidad de encuentro, hemos conformado un equipo de trabajo de tres artistas y aventureros colombianos apasionados por la naturaleza: 

Juan Camilo Franco: artista visual con amplia experiencia en realización de proyectos audiovisuales, multimedia e interactivos.

León Felipe Jiménez: artista plástico, audiovisual y biólogo en formación con experiencia en proyectos de arte y naturaleza.

Juan Sebastián Ulloa: ingeniero de sonido y doctor en ecología. Estudia la diversidad acústica del bosque tropical a través de paisajes sonoros.

 

¿Qué esperamos con su apoyo?

Creemos que esta campaña logrará llamar su atención ya que el proyecto artístico que planteamos es único en el marco de la Primera Expedición Científica al Pacífico Colombiano que se realizará a finales de noviembre en Cabo Manglares al sur occidente de Colombia en el departamento de Nariño. Si se identifica con los proyectos artísticos , colaborativos, interdisciplinares y enfocados en la naturaleza y los viajes de aventura, queremos que haga parte de este proceso. 

¡Lo invitamos a que apoye nuestra campaña! 

Estamos buscando su apoyo para las fases de pre y post-producción de este proyecto que consiste en la realización de una publicación digital (ePUB) a partir del material registrado en la expedición. La fase de producción, que consiste en registrar en fotografía, video y audio, se llevará a cabo en medio de la expedición, para lo cual contaremos con todo el apoyo de la Comisión Colombiana del Océano, la Armada Nacional de Colombia, la Dirección General Marítima (entre otras importantes instituciones),  quienes estarán a cargo de todo el tema de organización general, logístico y de seguridad (http://www.cco.gov.co/expedicion-cientifica-al-pacifico.html). Nuestro proyecto fue seleccionado por convocatoria.

En este momento estamos en la etapa de pre-producción, en donde buscamos apoyo para poder viajar a Tumaco (Departamento de Nariño), ciudad desde la que zarpará el buque de la expedición. El apoyo también va encaminado a la fase de post-producción, en la que luego de la expedición estaremos haciendo una curaduría del material registrado para luego desarrollar la publicación digital. Para nosotros es una gran oportunidad poder estar en esta expedición compartiendo conocimiento con la comunidad científica y  crear un contenido con una mirada estética de Cabo Manglares en el marco de la Primera Expedición Científica al Pacífico Colombiano. 

 

¿Qué necesitamos y qué recibirá a cambio por su apoyo?

Queremos recaudar 2.000 USD. Estos recursos serán destinados como explicamos a continuación:

  1.  Etapa de pre-producción: recursos para tiquetes aéreos ida y vuelta  desde nuestro lugar de origen hasta Tumaco en el departamento de Nariño, al sur occidente de Colombia. También  viáticos, que incluyen alimentación y hospedaje para 2 días en Tumaco.  
  2. Etapa de post-producción: recursos para parte de los  honorarios por labores de diagramación, diseño interactivo y finalización de la publicación digital. Esto se realizará durante los tres meses siguientes a la expedición. La publicación estará disponible para descarga gratuita a finales de marzo de 2019.

Hemos creado una serie de recompensas relacionadas con los temas de la expedición para que ustedes se sientan parte de este proyecto al decidir apoyarnos. Entre las recompensas tenemos: 

  • Piezas exclusivas en cerámica, diseñadas por Misspex Ceramics, artista bogotana. Estas tendrán motivos de animales autóctonos de esta zona de manglares en el océano pacífico.
  • Fotografías exclusivas tomadas por nosotros en Cabo Manglares, impresas a full resolución, ampliadas a 60 x 40 cm y montadas en retablo.
  • Nuestros servicios de producción audiovisual para la realización de videos de 2 minutos de duración cada uno,  sobre el tema que usted elija (incluyendo grabación, edición y post-producción).

Esperamos alcanzar a recaudar la totalidad del dinero, si no es así lo que se alcance a recaudar será destinado igualmente al proyecto. Nos aseguraremos de que las recompensas lo dejen complacido.

 

El impacto

Es un orgullo para nosotros hacer parte de la Primera Expedición Científica al Pacífico Colombiano, iniciativa de la Comisión Colombiana del Océano, en articulación con la Armada Nacional de la República de Colombia, la Dirección General Marítima, Colciencias, Parques Nacionales Naturales, WWF, el Instituto de Investigaciones Marinas y Costeras, el Instituto de Investigaciones Ambientales del Pacífico, entre otros. Nuestro proyecto, elegido por convocatoria, se ha ganado un lugar entre varios proyectos científicos, y será un documento importante que contraste y potencie la investigación científica producto de esta expedición. El contenido de esta publicación digital podrá ser apreciado por un publico amplio en rangos de edades y niveles educativos. 

Con este contenido  queremos darle mayor visibilidad a la zona de Cabo Manglares,  una zona geoestratégica representada por la desembocadura del río Mira en el océano pacífico. Su ubicación en el departamento de Nariño lo coloca en una zona que  históricamente ha sido de difícil acceso por la situación política y social del país.  Estamos hablando también de que gracias a estar inmersa en la eco-región Chocó-Darién Cabo Manglares hace parte de un hotspot muy importante para la conservación a nivel mundial. Por estas razones apostamos por que nuestro proyecto genere el interés de diferentes públicos, no solo el público científico y académico al que convoca esta expedición, sino también a un público más amplio y diverso que tenga la posibilidad de apreciar desde otra mirada este maravilloso territorio megadiverso.

 

Riesgos y retos

Las condiciones de orden público y geográficas de esta zona implican una serie de retos técnicos y logísticos al momento de lograr las mejores tomas de Cabo Manglares. Con el apoyo de todas las instituciones involucradas y con nuestra experiencia de trabajo en campo confiamos en que consolidaremos un excelente material audiovisual y fotográfico.

 

Otras maneras en las que puede ayudarnos

Comparte esta campaña con tus contactos y si conoces algún potencial patrocinador, empresa o particular, que quiera aportar al desarrollo de esta publicación digital, escríbenos a felipe1878@gmail.com y a  juanfranco.cultural@gmail.com

story:
Thank You All!! We Funded!!

 

Short Summary

Help me create an awesome Creature from the Black Lagoon handcrafted high fire ceramic coffee mug version 2.0. It'll have the hand sculpted nameplate, bigger handle and better Creature transition to the mug. I'm thinking it'll look like he's busting through the mug.

[This hand sculpted Creature nameplate will be on the back (drinking side) of the mug.]

  • My name is Mike Fleming Jr - I'm 31 years old and I'm an independent artist from Colorado. I sculpted, molded, cast, painted, fired and glazed everything here and will for each perk.
  • This campaign is important to me because it helps me create cool art for people to enjoy that they can actually use every day! That's very cool. It will also allow me build trust with you! If you decide to support my art I want you to be confident knowing that I will deliver on this project and on future projects. That's of paramount importance to me.
  • You will be helping me create really cool sculpted, ultra detailed coffee mugs and expand on ideas I want to implement in future ceramic and artistic works.

What I Need & What You Get

  • I'm asking for one thousand dollars to help me create these mugs. This will help pay for the materials I need to create them. If the goal amount is raised it will also help me get an art table at a local convention in the fall. I would like to attend more conventions and this campaign will hopefully help me do that.
  • I have some very neat perks for you all. I have stickers, DIY resin Creature heads as well as soap! There's hand painted resin heads and of course the coffee mug itself! Maybe even a few more surprises.
  • If I don't make the goal the money raised will go to just getting the materials to fulfill the campaign orders and pay the fees.

The Impact

  • I'd like the impact to be about coming together to create cool art and support an artist that creates the art that I hope you will value for life.  
  • I have helped out several friends on their successful fundraising attempts using my artwork to help fund their campaigns. Mostly with my mini figurines. 
  • The truth is that I need your help to keep me creating art. I want you to be able to trust me and join the team. 

Risks & Challenges

  • I have developed several versions of my ceramic mugs each featuring a different head sculpture of mine. In creating these mugs I have discovered how to retain the detail of my sculpts despite the undercut and complexity of some of the heads. I've also figured out some of the best ways to apply the glazes and get complex glaze color options to look really nice when they are fired.
  • I started creating these coffee mugs to help navigate the complex field of ceramics and forge a path that I could find confidence in while keeping my goals on each piece intact. I know what I can now accomplish on these mugs and now I want to expand on that knowledge and push the quality and speed forward.
  • You can be assured that you will receive whatever perk you help fund at. Nothing digital here. You will get something physical in the mail from me and it will happen soon. I have full confidence in saying that. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If money isn't something you're ready or able to give right now please consider sharing this campaign online with your friends and loved ones. That goes such a long way to helping campaigns like this find success. 
  • Indiegogo has share tools that make it easy! Please share the campaign with whoever you can even if you did contribute. I need help getting the word out and you can help with that for free! I would really appreciate it.

If money isn't something you're ready or able to give right now please consider sharing this campaign online with your friends and loved ones. That goes such a long way to helping campaigns like this find success. 
Indiegogo has share tools that make it easy! Please share the campaign with whoever you can even if you did contribute. I need help getting the word out and you can help with that for free! I would really appreciate it.

story:
What is The Nautilus and the Ammonite? 
 

The nautilus and the ammonite
        Were launched in friendly strife,
Each sent to float in its tiny boat
       On the wide, wide sea of life.

The Nautilus and the Ammonite is my latest book project. It features an anonymous poem that I simply fell in love with. The poem dates back to the 1800’s, an era when the science of paleontology was still taking its first steps. Its narrative follows two ancient mollusks, friends who together witness the last days of the Cretaceous, and one - the Ammonite - who is lost in the same event that took the dinosaurs.

This book is unique in that it juxtaposes old fashioned poetic language with contemporary visual art. The result is a volume that explores scientific questions about our world while contemplating philosophical implications in a way that is as emotionally responsive as it is brainy. 

I began the artwork for this book while completing an artist residency at Sunny Point on Lake Keuka in the fall of 2015. Work continued in my Philadelphia studio and was finally completed last May during another artist residency at Soaring Gardens Artist Retreat. With this project, I aimed to do something new and expand beyond just woodcut prints. In addition to woodblock prints, the imagery includes linocut, collograph, and screenprints, as well as painting, drawing, and collage. Readers are meant to imaginatively experience a bygone world that we can never fully know because our understanding is based only on collected fossils and fragments. I’ve chosen to depict both the Nautilus and Ammonite in ways that humanize them and hopefully make them more accessible to readers of all ages. 

What I Need

This campaign seeks to raise $4,000 to cover printing and binding of a first edition of 500 books. By printing a sizable first edition (opposed to doing print-on-demand) I can keep the retail prices of my books competitive with most commercial publishing houses and affordable for a broader audience. To put it another way, I can produce a high quality book that sells for $20, opposed to $40. and thereby get this small treasure into more peoples' hands and hearts. 


What You Get

First and foremost, all who pre-order books through this campaign will receive signed copies and a personal thank you card from me before the books go on sale to a general audience. The books will be 32 pages, hardcover with full-color off-set printing. I'm going with Signature Book Printing - the same company that printed my last book "Owl and Cat In Love" - because they do a top-notch job. 

For those who want to go above and beyond supporting this campaign, I'm offering some awesome extras:

  • Limited edition wood engravings, 5" x 7.5" of Nautilus and Ammonite. Oil-based black ink printed on fawn-colored Stonehenge paper 
  • Hand-pulled, 15" x 22" woodblock prints of the Tyrannosaurus Rex from the book, printed in red ink on fawn-colored Stonehenge paper
  • Hand-pulled, 22" x 15" woodblock prints of the Stegosaurus from the book, printed in green ink on fawn-colored Stonehenge paper
  • Hand-pulled, 22" x 15"  woodblock prints of the Plesiosaur from the book, printed in ultramarine ink on pale blue Stonehenge paper
  • Hand-pulled, 22" x 15"  woodblock prints of the Plesiosaur Fossil from the book, printed in ultramarine ink on pale blue Stonehenge paper

Check out the images in the gallery above to view all the artwork. 

The Impact

Part of the inspiration for this book was a course I took on mass extinctions through the Wagner Free Institute for Science where I work as a teaching artist-in-residence. The K-T event that ended the dinosaurs' rule on earth was only one of 5 major extinctions. Today, many scientists are sounding the alarm that we are in the midst of a sixth mass extinction caused by human activities. Life and its surrounding conditions on earth have always been in flux. We are wise to learn as much as we can and care about both the history and present nature of these changes. Facts and figures are essential to our understanding, but we must also be emotionally engaged. Children and adults alike know and care about dinosaurs because they are inherently fascinating creatures in their size and appearance. Ammonites are far more modest in their appeal. Millions of years ago, they, like dinosaurs, were abundant, and now they are gone. It is my hope that this poem and artwork spark curiosity in its readers about the more downplayed mysteries, tragedies, and wonders to be found in the story of life on earth. 

Risks & Challenges

I am no stranger to crowdfunding. Three years ago I founded Words On Woodcuts Press with an Indiegogo fundraising campaign that raised nearly $4,000 (198% of its original goal.) In less than a year I collected the seed funds to publish my first two books (each in editions of 500) through successful pre-sale campaigns and crowd-sourced small business loans (loans now paid back in full - woo hoo!) Last year I ran two successful pre-sale campaigns, creating an edition of 100 handmade "Wise Old Owl" books as well as a "12 Owls" calendar and coloring book. I know fundraising is a lot of work, but also a lot of fun.

I'm so grateful to all the family, friends, colleagues, and collectors of my work who have supported all my past endeavors and given me the confidence to not only maintain my studio practice, but also get my work out to a broader audience. Thank you, all!

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe a picture book about a nautilus and ammonite during the Cretaceous isn't something you want to buy, but you still want to support Words On Woodcuts Press and my art studio. In that case: 

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools.
  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign however else you can.

Thanks!
story_txt:
What is The Nautilus and the Ammonite?  
The nautilus and the ammonite        Were launched in friendly strife,Each sent to float in its tiny boat       On the wide, wide sea of life.
The Nautilus and the Ammonite is my latest book project. It features an anonymous poem that I simply fell in love with. The poem dates back to the 1800’s, an era when the science of paleontology was still taking its first steps. Its narrative follows two ancient mollusks, friends who together witness the last days of the Cretaceous, and one - the Ammonite - who is lost in the same event that took the dinosaurs.This book is unique in that it juxtaposes old fashioned poetic language with contemporary visual art. The result is a volume that explores scientific questions about our world while contemplating philosophical implications in a way that is as emotionally responsive as it is brainy. I began the artwork for this book while completing an artist residency at Sunny Point on Lake Keuka in the fall of 2015. Work continued in my Philadelphia studio and was finally completed last May during another artist residency at Soaring Gardens Artist Retreat. With this project, I aimed to do something new and expand beyond just woodcut prints. In addition to woodblock prints, the imagery includes linocut, collograph, and screenprints, as well as painting, drawing, and collage. Readers are meant to imaginatively experience a bygone world that we can never fully know because our understanding is based only on collected fossils and fragments. I’ve chosen to depict both the Nautilus and Ammonite in ways that humanize them and hopefully make them more accessible to readers of all ages. 
What I Need
This campaign seeks to raise $4,000 to cover printing and binding of a first edition of 500 books. By printing a sizable first edition (opposed to doing print-on-demand) I can keep the retail prices of my books competitive with most commercial publishing houses and affordable for a broader audience. To put it another way, I can produce a high quality book that sells for $20, opposed to $40. and thereby get this small treasure into more peoples' hands and hearts. 


What You Get
First and foremost, all who pre-order books through this campaign will receive signed copies and a personal thank you card from me before the books go on sale to a general audience. Limited edition wood engravings, 5" x 7.5" of Nautilus and Ammonite. Oil-based black ink printed on fawn-colored Stonehenge paper 
Hand-pulled, 15" x 22" woodblock prints of the Tyrannosaurus Rex from the book, printed in red ink on fawn-colored Stonehenge paper
Hand-pulled, 22" x 15" woodblock prints of the Stegosaurus from the book, printed in green ink on fawn-colored Stonehenge paper
Hand-pulled, 22" x 15"  woodblock prints of the Plesiosaur from the book, printed in ultramarine ink on pale blue Stonehenge paper
Hand-pulled, 22" x 15"  woodblock prints of the Plesiosaur Fossil from the book, printed in ultramarine ink on pale blue Stonehenge paper

Check out the images in the gallery above to view all the artwork. 

The Impact

The K-T event that ended the dinosaurs' rule on earth was only one of 5 major extinctions. Today, many scientists are sounding the alarm that we are in the midst of a sixth mass extinction caused by human activities. Life and its surrounding conditions on earth have always been in flux. We are wise to learn as much as we can and care about both the history and present nature of these changes. Facts and figures are essential to our understanding, but we must also be emotionally engaged. Children and adults alike know and care about dinosaurs because they are inherently fascinating creatures in their size and appearance. Ammonites are far more modest in their appeal. Millions of years ago, they, like dinosaurs, were abundant, and now they are gone. It is my hope that this poem and artwork spark curiosity in its readers about the more downplayed mysteries, tragedies, and wonders to be found in the story of life on earth. 

Risks & Challenges
I am no stranger to crowdfunding. Three years ago I founded Words On Woodcuts Press with an Indiegogo fundraising campaign that raised nearly $4,000 (198% of its original goal.) In less than a year I collected the seed funds to publish my first two books (each in editions of 500) through successful pre-sale campaigns and crowd-sourced small business loans (loans now paid back in full - woo hoo!) Last year I ran two successful pre-sale campaigns, creating an edition of 100 handmade "Wise Old Owl" books as well as a "12 Owls" calendar and coloring book. I know fundraising is a lot of work, but also a lot of fun.
I'm so grateful to all the family, friends, colleagues, and collectors of my work who have supported all my past endeavors and given me the confidence to not only maintain my studio practice, but also get my work out to a broader audience. Thank you, all!

Use the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
The presentation of the project may seem long, it happens to be  in two languages. 

 

         

La presentación del proyecto puede parecer larga, debido a que está en dos lenguas,

Sepan que "perks" son las recompensas  a cambio de su donación.

 

 

 

 

 

THE PROJECT  ·  EL PROYECTO

 

                                                    HANNA YETSALI   ·  INFANCY / INFANCIA

 

   

Witnesses is a non-profit, itinerant photographic project consisting of 11 portraits of inhabitants of San Pablito Pahuatlán (Puebla, Mexico). Each portrait represents a stage of the human life cycle: from childhood to old age. It is accompanied by a second exhibition called San Pablito with 56 pictures documenting the life of this community that produces amate paper.

The goal is to create, on the one hand, a tribute to indigenous people in general wherever they are and to encourage awareness of the ecological, social and cultural challenges most communities like San Pablito confront.  And, on the other, for the exhibit to travel the world; so far, the show has been confirmed in two museums.

 

Testigos es un proyecto fotográfico itinerante sin fines de lucro que consiste en 11 retratos de habitantes de San Pablito Pahuatlán (Puebla, México). Cada retrato representa una etapa del ciclo de la vida humana: desde la infancia hasta la vejez. Se acompaña de una segunda exposición llamada San Pablito con 56 fotografías que plasman la vida de esta comunidad que produce papel amate.

El objetivo es crear, por un lado, un homenaje a los pueblos indígenas en general dondequiera que se encuentren y fomentar la conciencia de los desafíos ecológicos, sociales y culturales que enfrentan la mayoría de las comunidades como San Pablito. Y, por otro, para que la exposición recorra el mundo; hasta ahora, la muestra ha sido confirmada en dos museos.

 

 

              

DOÑA MARIA PAULA  ·  OLD AGE / ANCIANIDAD

 

___________________________________

 

 

WHY NOW ?        ¿ POR QUÉ AHORA ?

 

SAN PABLITO

 

Within the framework of the UN’s observance of 2019 as the International Year of Indigenous Languages and that 2021 will commemorate 500 years of the “conquest” of Latin America, this campaign comprises the production of a project with two exhibits: Witnesses and San Pablito.

All production steps will be described at the end of this presentation. Though this is an important project for us (Don Genaro and me), it is equally important for all the San Pablito people and their survival as artisans of the amate paper for which they are known worldwide.

Dentro del marco de la ONU, la celebración de 2019 como Año Internacional de las Lenguas Indígenas y de que en 2021 se conmemorarán los 500 años de la "conquista" de América Latina, esta campaña comprende la producción de un proyecto con dos exposiciones: Testigos y San Pablito. 

Todos los pasos de producción se describirán al final de esta presentación . Si bien éste es un proyecto importante para nosotros (Don Genaro y yo), es igualmente importante para todo el pueblo de San Pablito y su supervivencia como artesanos del papel amate por el que son conocidos en todo el mundo.

 

___________________________________

 

DON GENARO  

 

 

Without Don Genaro, this project could not have been born. I like to call him the guardian of the amate paper for his dedication in keeping the ancient knowledge on how to produce it. 

Sin  Don Genaro, este proyecto no podría haber sido posible. Me gusta llamarlo el guardián del papel amate por su dedicación en mantener el antiguo conocimiento de cómo producirlo.

 

___________________________________

 

GAAL

 

                   

 

A visual story teller, I was born in France and raised in a camera shop; I was self-taught in Belgium, grew up in Israel and New York City, studied traditional Chinese medicine in Canada and China. I have been living in Mexico for the past 25 years. I orient people in the field of thanatology as well.

My best friend has always been the camera I always keep within my eye’s  reach. Sofia, my wife has been my faithful guide for the last 34 years so that projects do not go haywire.

gaalcohen.com

 

Un narrador visual, nací en Francia y me crié en una tienda de cámaras; fui autodidacta en Bélgica, crecí en Israel y Nueva York, estudié medicina tradicional china en Canadá y China. He vivido en México durante los últimos 25 años. Oriento a la gente también en el campo de la tanatología.

Mi mejor amiga siempre ha sido la cámara que siempre mantengo al alcance de mis ojos. Sofía, mi esposa ha sido mi fiel guía durante los últimos 34 años para que mis proyectos no se desquicien.

gaalcohen.com

 

___________________________________

 

 

ECOLOGICAL, SOCIAL & CULTURAL AWARENESS

FOR EXHIBITION VISITORS

 

CONCIENTIZACIÓN ECOLÓGICA, SOCIAL Y CULTURAL

PARA LOS VISITANTES DE LAS EXPOSICIONES

 

 

                

Urgent need of reforestation for the survival of the village.

             

 Necesidad urgente de reforestación para la sobrevivencia del pueblo.

 

DON CALIXTO

 

             

Essential social aid for so many needy communities.

             

Ayuda social indispensable a tantas comunidades necesitadas.

 

 
 

      

Cultural need of not losing the Otomi language. Don Bonifacio only wanted to give us his blessing after the photo-shoot.

La necesidad cultural de no perder la lengua otomí. Don Bonifacio que solo quería darnos su bendición después de la sesión de fotos.

 

 

 

___________________________________

 

 

HOW ABOUT THE EXHIBITS  IN A MUSEUM NEAR YOU ?

 

¿ QUÉ TAL, LAS EXPOSICIONES  EN UN MUSEO CERCA DE TI ?

 

 

By supporting this project, you will contribute to the touring of the two exhibitions, Witnesses and San Pablito, from museum to museum, and to awareness of the ecological, social and cultural challenges native people have to deal with on a daily base.

At this time, the project has been scheduled by the Latin American Art Museum (Museo de las Americas) in Denver, Colorado, in 2020 and the Museo de Arte Popular (MAP) in Mexico City.

If you know of a museum in your area interested in hosting the exhibit, please let us know.

Al apoyar este proyecto, contribuirás a la gira de las dos exposiciones, Testigos y San Pablito, de museo en museo, y a la toma de conciencia de los retos ecológicos, sociales y culturales que los pueblos indígenas tienen que enfrentar a diario.

En este momento, el proyecto ha sido programado por el Museo de las Américas en Denver, Colorado, en 2020 y el Museo de Arte Popular (MAP) en la Ciudad de México.

Si sabes de algún museo en tu área que esté interesado en presentar la exposición, por favor háznoslo saber.

 

MUSEO DE ARTE POPULAR

 

___________________________________

 

 

LETTER OF INVITATION  ·  CARTA DE INVITACIÓN  ·  MUSEO DE LAS AMÉRICAS

DENVER  ·  COLORADO  ·  USA

 

___________________________________

LETTER OF INVITATION  ·  CARTA DE INVITACIÓN   ·  MUSEO DE ARTE POPULAR

CIUDAD DE MEXICO  ·   MEXICO

 

 

 

                                  MUSEO DE ARTE POPULAR  ·  MEXICO CITY

 

___________________________________

 

THREE COMPLEMENTARY ACTIVITIES FOR MUSEUMS

TRES ACTIVIDADES COMPLEMENTARIAS PARA MUSEOS
 

 

1 

AMATE PAPER WORKSHOP   ·  TALLER DE PAPEL AMATE

DON GENARO

 

 

2

WORKSHOP:  IF THERE IS LIFE, THERE IS HOPE  ·  11 STAGES OF LIFE

TALLER:  SI HAY VIDA HAY ESPERANZA  ·  11 ETAPAS DE VIDA

GAAL D. COHEN

 

3

 

LECTURE:  THE TRUE AMATE PAPER TREE

CONFERENCIA: EL ARBOL VERDADERO DEL PAPEL AMATE

OCTAVIO FUENTES SANTOS

 

 

___________________________________

 

 

ABOUT PERKS

 

A good friend suggested a perk at US$ 1  (20 MXN pesos)   why not?   We liked the idea.

All perks are pictures taken in San Pablito.

More details in the section select a perks, at the beginning of the presentation.

​

ACERCA DE LAS RECOMPENSAS

 

Un buen amigo propuso una recompensa de 1 dólar (20 MXN pesos)​   ¿por qué no?   Nos gustó la idea.

Todos las recompensas son fotografías tomadas en San Pablito.

Hay más detalles en la sección select a perk, al empezar de la presentación.

 

1

DIGITAL PERKS   ·   RECOMPENSAS DIGITALES   ·   US$   1  ·  5  ·  10

 

These three perks are sent digitally, and all have a special story you will be told about when receiving your perk.

Estas tres recompensas serán enviadas digitalmente, y cada una tiene una historia especial que te contaremos al recibir tu recompensa.

 

 

2

A SPECIAL PERK    ·   UNA RECOMPENSA  ESPECIAL   ·   US$   5

 

A guided tour of the Exhibit: Witnesses with  Don Genaro and Gaal.
Una visita guiáda de la exposición: Testigos con Don Genaro y Gaal.

 

 

 

3

PHYSICAL PERK   ·   RECOMPENSA  FÍSICA   ·  US$  20  ·  1  Macro postcard  ·  1  Macro postal

 

 

4

PHYSICAL PERK · RECOMPENSA FÍSICA  ·  US$   30 ·  2  Macro postcards · 2  Macro postales

 

 

5

PHYSICAL PERK   ·   RECOMPENSA FÍSICA  ·   US$  40 

3  Macro postcards   ·   Reforestation collection  ·  Limited edition: 1,000

3  Macro postales  ·    Colección Reforestación  ·  Edición limitada: 1,000

 

 

6

PHYSICAL PERK   ·   RECOMPENSA FÍSICA  ·   US$  75   

Giclée Fine Art Print  - Limited edition: 125 for each of the 5 pictures available.

Giclée Fine Art Print​  - Edición limitada: 125 por cada una de las 5 fotos disponibles.

 

 

7

PHYSICAL PERK   ·   RECOMPENSA FÍSICA   ·   US$  375   

Giclée Fine Art Print  -  Collection of 5 pictures + 6th one at no extra cost.

Giclée Fine Art Print​  - Colección de 5 fotografías + una 6ta de cortesia.

 

 

___________________________________

 

ALL ABOUT SHIPPING

 

  • We guarantee your perk will reach you as we will use registered mail for all shipping
  • We can guarantee the quality of shipping as well. 
  • We cannot guarantee the exact date of arrival. We do depend on others so production and shipping may take between 40 and 60 days.

.

​

ACERCA DE LOS  ENVIOS

 

  • Aseguramos que tu recompensa te llegará porque utilizaremos correo certificado para todos los envíos.
  • Garantizamos la calidad del envío también.
  • No podemos asegurar la fecha exacta de llegada. Dependemos de otros, por lo que la producción y el envío pueden tardar entre 40 y 60 días.

 

 

 

___________________________________

 


GOAL     (  =    +   -  ) 

 

The amount we need for the full production is US$ 151,925  (=)

If we do not reach the entire goal (-) we will produce all amounts received in the order of the 13 production steps mentioned at the end of our presentation.

If we get more support than the original goal (+) we shall buy amate paper and distribute it to artisans of San Pablito and surrounding villages. Our newsletter will provide all the information (to register to the newsletter go to end of presentation).

META    ( =    +   -​  )

 

La cantidad que necesitamos para la producción total es de $151,925 dólares (=)

Si no alcanzamos la meta completa ( - )  produciremos todas las cantidades recibidas en el orden de los 13 pasos de producción mencionados al final de nuestra presentación.

Si conseguimos más apoyo que el objetivo original (+) compraremos papel amate y lo distribuiremos a los artesanos de San Pablito y de pueblos cercanos. Nuestro boletín proporcionará toda la información (para registrarte al boletín, ir al final de la presentación).

 

 

___________________________________

 

 

TWO STEPS OF THE PROJECT ALREADY ACCOMPLISHED

DOS PASOS DEL PROYECTO YA REALIZADOS

 

1

Thanks to the donation of US$ 3,000 of the Museo de las Americas, travel to San Pablito Pahuatlán was possible, to take all the pictures needed for both exhibits as well as for the perks offered in this project.

Gracias al donativo de US$ 3,000 del Museo de las Américas, se pudo viajar a San Pablito Pahuatlán y tomar todas las fotografías necesarias para ambas exposiciones, así como para los perks que ofrecemos en este proyecto.

 

 

 

 

2

The exhibit texts for the Museo de las Américas in Denver and the Museo de Arte Popular in Mexico City were generously composed by archaeologist Eduardo Matos Moctezuma and the general director of the Museo de Arte Popular in Mexico City, Walther Boelsterly.

Los textos de sala del Museo de las Américas de Denver y del Museo de Arte Popular de la Ciudad de México fueron generosamente redactados por el arqueólogo Eduardo Matos Moctezuma  y el director general del Museo de Arte Popular de la Ciudad de México, Walther Boelsterly.

 

                           

 

___________________________________

 

   

T H A N K   Y O U   T O   A L L   O U R    D O N O R S

 

G R A C I A S   A   T O D O S   N U E S T R O S   D O N A N T E S

 

 

SPECIAL THANKS

 

We want to specially thank:

  • The Museo de las Americas and the Museo de Arte Popular for believing in this project.
  • Eduardo Matos Moctezuma and Walther Boelsterly for the beautiful texts they donated to the exhibit.
  • Sofia Iglesias, José Alejandro Robert, Yvette Raby, Santiago Alvarez Vega, Lorenza Dipp,  Patricia Urzua, Gabriela González, Lourdes Cisneros, Cecy Suarez, Roberto Peréz, Octavio Fuentes Santos, Patricia Diaz Romo, Cecilia Diaz Romo, Alejandra Munguía, Carlos Loera and Rosi Beltrán for their unconditional support.
  • The people of San Pablito Pahuatlán for welcoming me into their community and letting us take all the necessary pictures for this project.
  • Joao Rodriguez, curator.
  • We also thank our team: Florencia and Pilar from Mäzen Gestión de Artistas, Mario at Crater on Fire, Juan Pablo Hernández, Andres Villaseñor at SOSA Laboratorio de Diseño and Milo Medina.

AGRADECIMIENTOS

 

Queremos agradecer especialmente a:

  • El Museo de las Américas  y el Museo de Arte Popular por creer en este proyecto.
  • Eduardo Matos Moctezuma y Walther Boelsterly por los hermosos textos que donaron a la exposición.
  • Sofia Iglesias, José Alejandro Robert, Yvette Raby, Santiago Álvarez Vega, Lorenza Dipp, Patricia Urzua, Gabriela González, Lourdes Cisneros, Cecy Suarez, Roberto Peréz, Octavio Fuentes Santos, Patricia Diaz Romo, Cecilia Diaz Romo, Alejandra Munguía, Carlos Loera y Rosi Beltrán por su apoyo incondicional.
  • La gente de San Pablito Pahuatlán por darme la bienvenida a su comunidad y dejarnos tomar todas las fotos necesarias para este proyecto.
  • Joao Rodriguez, curador.
  • También agradecemos a nuestro equipo: Florencia y Pilar de Mäzen Gestión de Artistas, Mario de Crater on Fire, Juan Pablo Hernández, Andrés Villaseñor de SOSA Laboratorio de Diseño y Milo Medina.


 

http://gaalcohen.com/index.php

 

 

 

 
 
 

AND FINALLY  ·  Y FINALMENTE

 
 

YOUR SUPPORT MATTERS

                                             

 HAVE A LOOK AT AN EARLIER PRODUCED PROJECT (2015)

The Museo Cabañas is a UNESCO World Heritage site. It has more than 200 years of history and stands 222 steps from the largest covered Latin American market called San Juan de Dios. When the museum was an orphanage, many youngsters went to work at the market, and the market always helped the hospice as it was called. Once it became a museum, both entities grew apart. And with the idea of a group of ITESO University students, in 2015, together we joined them once again.

 

TU APOYO IMPORTA

 

MUESTRA DE  UN PROYECTO REALIZADO EN 2015

El Museo Cabañas es Patrimonio de la Humanidad de la UNESCO. Tiene más de 200 años de historia y se encuentra a 222 pasos del mayor mercado techado de América Latina llamado San Juan de Dios. Cuando el museo era un orfanato, muchos jóvenes trabajaban en el mercado, y el mercado siempre ayudaba al hospicio, como se le llamaba. Una vez que se convirtió en museo, ambas entidades se distanciaron. Y con la idea de un grupo de estudiantes de la Universidad ITESO, en 2015, unimos estas entidades una vez más.

 

 

                                                                          

 

___________________________________

 

 

 

13 STEPS OF PRODUCTION

 

Description of each one of them in chronological order and with information about our suppliers.

 

13 PASOS DE PRODUCCIÓN

 

Descripción de cada uno de ellos en orden cronológico y con información sobre nuestros proveedores.

                                       

                                 

JORDY

 

1:

US$ 4,432

Acquisition of 30 canvases of amate paper (47x95 in). Production  takes about 25 to 35 days, travel expenses for Don Genaro  from San Pablito to Guadalajara. Flattening of the canvases that were rolled up for travel.

Supplier: Don Genaro Fuentes and his team

Adquisición de 30 lienzos de papel amate (120x240 cm). La producción toma de 25 a 35 días, los gastos de viaje de Don Genaro de San Pablito a Guadalajara. Aplanado de los lienzos que se enrollaron para el viaje.

Proveedor: Don Genaro Fuentes y su equipo

 

 

2:

US$ 6,199

Printing of the 22 pictures on the canvases.

Supplier: Stampa Impresiones

Impresión de las 22 imágenes en los lienzos.

Proveedor: Stampa Impresiones

 

DANIEL

Your participation is greatly appreciated. Whether you are able to support the project or not, sharing it with others is priceless to reach our goal. Sharing our project on social media and letting people know about our newsletter would be of great help.

By the way, would you like to have the exhibit in a museum near you?  Do you know of a museum that could be interested in exhibiting it?  Please let us know!

OTRAS MANERAS DE AYUDAR

Compartir nuestro proyecto en los medios sociales y dar a conocer nuestro boletín sería de gran ayuda. Por cierto, ¿te gustaría tener la exposición en un museo cerca de ti?  ¿Conoces algún museo que pueda estar interesado en exponer la muestra?  Por favor, ¡házanoslo saber!

 

DON JUAN

WHY INDIEGOGO ? 

 

Indiegogo is a very user-friendly international platform. Its team was very helpful in guiding us, especially since this is our first crowd funding experience. We were able to share the project in two languages so it can reach more people in the world. Indiegogo is also very flexible in raising funds.

 ¿ POR QUÉ INDIEGOGO ?

 

Indiegogo es una plataforma internacional muy fácil de usar. Su equipo fue de gran ayuda para asesorarnos, especialmente porque esta es nuestra primera experiencia con el crowd funding. Se puede compartir el proyecto en dos idiomas para que llegue a más gente en el mundo. Indiegogo también es muy flexible en la recaudación de fondos.
