story_txt:
The presentation of the project may seem long, it happens to be  in two languages. 
 
         
La presentación del proyecto puede parecer larga, debido a que está en dos lenguas,
Sepan que "perks" son las recompensas  a cambio de su donación.
 
 
 
 
 
THE PROJECT  ·  EL PROYECTO
 

                                                    HANNA YETSALI   ·  INFANCY / INFANCIA
 
   
Witnesses is a non-profit, itinerant photographic project consisting of 11 portraits of inhabitants of San Pablito Pahuatlán (Puebla, Mexico). Each portrait represents a stage of the human life cycle: from childhood to old age. It is accompanied by a second exhibition called San Pablito with 56 pictures documenting the life of this community that produces amate paper. 
The goal is to create, on the one hand, a tribute to indigenous people in general wherever they are and to encourage awareness of the ecological, social and cultural challenges most communities like San Pablito confront.  And, on the other, for the exhibit to travel the world; so far, the show has been confirmed in two museums.
 
Testigos es un proyecto fotográfico itinerante sin fines de lucro que consiste en 11 retratos de habitantes de San Pablito Pahuatlán (Puebla, México). Cada retrato representa una etapa del ciclo de la vida humana: desde la infancia hasta la vejez. Se acompaña de una segunda exposición llamada San Pablito con 56 fotografías que plasman la vida de esta comunidad que produce papel amate. 
El objetivo es crear, por un lado, un homenaje a los pueblos indígenas en general dondequiera que se encuentren y fomentar la conciencia de los desafíos ecológicos, sociales y culturales que enfrentan la mayoría de las comunidades como San Pablito. Y, por otro, para que la exposición recorra el mundo; hasta ahora, la muestra ha sido confirmada en dos museos.
 
 
              
DOÑA MARIA PAULA  ·  OLD AGE / ANCIANIDAD
 
___________________________________
 
 
WHY NOW ?        ¿ POR QUÉ AHORA ?
 

SAN PABLITO
 

Within the framework of the UN’s observance of 2019 as the International Year of Indigenous Languages and that 2021 will commemorate 500 years of the “conquest” of Latin America, this campaign comprises the production of a project with two exhibits: Witnesses and San Pablito.
All production steps will be described at the end of this presentation. Though this is an important project for us (Don Genaro and me), it is equally important for all the San Pablito people and their survival as artisans of the amate paper for which they are known worldwide.

Dentro del marco de la ONU, la celebración de 2019 como Año Internacional de las Lenguas Indígenas y de que en 2021 se conmemorarán los 500 años de la "conquista" de América Latina, esta campaña comprende la producción de un proyecto con dos exposiciones: Testigos y San Pablito. 
Todos los pasos de producción se describirán al final de esta presentación . Si bien éste es un proyecto importante para nosotros (Don Genaro y yo), es igualmente importante para todo el pueblo de San Pablito y su supervivencia como artesanos del papel amate por el que son conocidos en todo el mundo.
 
___________________________________
 
DON GENARO  
 

 

Without Don Genaro, this project could not have been born. I like to call him the guardian of the amate paper for his dedication in keeping the ancient knowledge on how to produce it. 

Sin  Don Genaro, este proyecto no podría haber sido posible. Me gusta llamarlo el guardián del papel amate por su dedicación en mantener el antiguo conocimiento de cómo producirlo.
 
___________________________________
 
GAAL
 
                   
 

A visual story teller, I was born in France and raised in a camera shop; I was self-taught in Belgium, grew up in Israel and New York City, studied traditional Chinese medicine in Canada and China. I have been living in Mexico for the past 25 years. I orient people in the field of thanatology as well.
My best friend has always been the camera I always keep within my eye’s  reach. Sofia, my wife has been my faithful guide for the last 34 years so that projects do not go haywire.
gaalcohen.com
 

Un narrador visual, nací en Francia y me crié en una tienda de cámaras; fui autodidacta en Bélgica, crecí en Israel y Nueva York, estudié medicina tradicional china en Canadá y China. He vivido en México durante los últimos 25 años. Oriento a la gente también en el campo de la tanatología. 
Mi mejor amiga siempre ha sido la cámara que siempre mantengo al alcance de mis ojos. Sofía, mi esposa ha sido mi fiel guía durante los últimos 34 años para que mis proyectos no se desquicien.
gaalcohen.com
 
___________________________________
 
 
ECOLOGICAL, SOCIAL & CULTURAL AWARENESS
FOR EXHIBITION VISITORS
 
CONCIENTIZACIÓN ECOLÓGICA, SOCIAL Y CULTURAL 
PARA LOS VISITANTES DE LAS EXPOSICIONES
 
 
                
Urgent need of reforestation for the survival of the village.
             
 Necesidad urgente de reforestación para la sobrevivencia del pueblo.
 

DON CALIXTO
 
             
Essential social aid for so many needy communities.
             
Ayuda social indispensable a tantas comunidades necesitadas.
 

 
 
      
Cultural need of not losing the Otomi language. Don Bonifacio only wanted to give us his blessing after the photo-shoot.

La necesidad cultural de no perder la lengua otomí. Don Bonifacio que solo quería darnos su bendición después de la sesión de fotos.
 

 
 
___________________________________
 
 
HOW ABOUT THE EXHIBITS  IN A MUSEUM NEAR YOU ? 
 
¿ QUÉ TAL, LAS EXPOSICIONES  EN UN MUSEO CERCA DE TI ?
 

 

By supporting this project, you will contribute to the touring of the two exhibitions, Witnesses and San Pablito, from museum to museum, and to awareness of the ecological, social and cultural challenges native people have to deal with on a daily base.
At this time, the project has been scheduled by the Latin American Art Museum (Museo de las Americas) in Denver, Colorado, in 2020 and the Museo de Arte Popular (MAP) in Mexico City.
If you know of a museum in your area interested in hosting the exhibit, please let us know.

Al apoyar este proyecto, contribuirás a la gira de las dos exposiciones, Testigos y San Pablito, de museo en museo, y a la toma de conciencia de los retos ecológicos, sociales y culturales que los pueblos indígenas tienen que enfrentar a diario. 
En este momento, el proyecto ha sido programado por el Museo de las Américas en Denver, Colorado, en 2020 y el Museo de Arte Popular (MAP) en la Ciudad de México. 
Si sabes de algún museo en tu área que esté interesado en presentar la exposición, por favor háznoslo saber.

It has more than 200 years of history and stands 222 steps from the largest covered Latin American market called San Juan de Dios. When the museum was an orphanage, many youngsters went to work at the market, and the market always helped the hospice as it was called. Once it became a museum, both entities grew apart. And with the idea of a group of ITESO University students, in 2015, together we joined them once again. TU APOYO IMPORTA MUESTRA DE  UN PROYECTO REALIZADO EN 2015El Museo Cabañas es Patrimonio de la Humanidad de la UNESCO. Tiene más de 200 años de historia y se encuentra a 222 pasos del mayor mercado techado de América Latina llamado San Juan de Dios. Dos de ellos acompañarán a Testigos, y ocho de ellos se mostrarán en tabletas en la exposición San Pablito.Proveedor: Fernando Poire FERNANDO6: US$ 17,781Production of the wooden boxes/containers used for shipping in between each exhibit that is to travel from museum to museum. Includes fumigation and paperwork to be able to cross border between Mexico and the USA. For the exhibition Testigos.Provider: Felipe ManzanoFabricación de las cajas/contenedores de madera que se utilizan para el traslado de un museo a otro. Incluye fumigación y trámites para poder cruzar la frontera entre México y los Estados Unidos. Para la exposición Testigos.Proveedor: Felipe Manzano  7: US$ 12,059Register each of the framed pictures. Curatorship of the pictures. Gifts, personnel to prepare perks for shipping. Passport and US visa for Don Genaro with all related travel expenses and costs. Curatorial text of the San Pablito exhibition.Suppliers: SeveralRegistro de cada una de las fotografías enmarcadas. Curaduría de los cuadros. Regalos, personal para preparar los perks para su envío. Pasaporte y visa de EE.UU. para Don Genaro con todos los gastos de viaje relacionados. Texto curatorial de la exposición de San Pablito.Proveedores: Varios MILO 8: US$ 13,625The project includes printing 500 books with the pictures of the 11 diptychs, so that people may acquire a souvenir of the exhibit. It will also allow the museum to cover some of the cost of hosting the exhibit, including shipping and insurance.Supplier: Equilatero ImprentaEl proyecto incluye la impresión de 500 libros con las imágenes de los 11 dípticos, para que la gente pueda adquirir un recuerdo de la exposición. También permitirá que el museo cubra parte del costo de la exposición, incluyendo el transporte y el seguro.Proveedor: Equilatero Imprenta  9: US$ 7,875The project includes the production of 500 boxes with 22 exhibit pictures in postcard size so that children may play with them to discover the different steps of people’s lives. It will also cover some of the cost of maintaining the artwork, keeping the shipping boxes in good shape to continue travelling from museum to museum.Supplier: Equilatero ImprentaEl proyecto incluye la fabricación de 500 cajas con 22 imágenes de la muestra en tamaño postal para que los niños jueguen con ellas y descubran las diferentes etapas de la vida de las personas. También cubrirá parte de los gastos de mantenimiento de la obra de arte, conservando las cajas de envío en buen estado para seguir viajando de museo en museo.Proveedor: Equilatero Imprenta  10: US$ 8,875Printing of 56 pictures (23.5x23.5 in) giclée fine art print, organized in eight different series of seven pictures. Each series is accompanied by a video mentioned in step 5.Supplier: Pigmento Fine Art PrintImpresión de 56 imágenes (60x60 cm) giclée fine art print, organizadas en ocho series diferentes de siete imágenes. Cada serie va acompañada de un vídeo mencionado en el paso 5.Proveedor: Pigmento Fine Art Print​ EL CHILITO 11: US$ 24,715Production of 56 custom frames for the San Pablito exhibit.Supplier: El Viejo MarquistaFabricación de 56 marcos a medida para la exposición San Pablito.Proveedor: El Viejo Marquista ANA12: US$ 1,872Production of boxes for the San Pablito exhibit used for shipping between each exhibit, that is to travel from museum to museum. Includes the fumigation and paperwork to be able to cross border between Mexico and the USA.Supplier: Felipe ManzanoFabricación de las cajas de la exposición San Pablito, utilizadas para el traslado entre cada una de las exposiciones. Incluye la fumigación y los trámites para cruzar la frontera entre México y los Estados Unidos.Proveedor: Felipe Manzano  13: AMOUNT TO BE DETERMINED    ·    MONTO POR DEFINIRShipping and insurance from Guadalajara to Denver has not been included because art cannot be assessed until it has been produced. El envío y el seguro de Guadalajara a Denver no han sido incluidos porque el arte no puede ser valuado hasta que haya sido creado.    OTHE​R WAYS TO HELP Your participation is greatly appreciated. Whether you are able to support the project or not, sharing it with others is priceless to reach our goal. Sharing our project on social media and letting people know about our newsletter would be of great help.By the way, would you like to have the exhibit in a museum near you?  Do you know of a museum that could be interested in exhibiting it?  Please let us know!OTRAS MANERAS DE AYUDAR Agradecemos mucho tu participación. Ya sea que puedas o no apoyar el proyecto, compartirlo con otros es muy valioso para alcanzar nuestra meta. Compartir nuestro proyecto en los medios sociales y dar a conocer nuestro boletín sería de gran ayuda. Por cierto, ¿te gustaría tener la exposición en un museo cerca de ti?  ¿Conoces algún museo que pueda estar interesado en exponer la muestra?  Por favor, ¡házanoslo saber! DON JUAN___________________________________
 

WHY INDIEGOGO ? 
 
Indiegogo is a very user-friendly international platform. Its team was very helpful in guiding us, especially since this is our first crowd funding experience. We were able to share the project in two languages so it can reach more people in the world. Indiegogo is also very flexible in raising funds. ¿ POR QUÉ INDIEGOGO ? Indiegogo es una plataforma internacional muy fácil de usar. Su equipo fue de gran ayuda para asesorarnos, especialmente porque esta es nuestra primera experiencia con el crowd funding. Se puede compartir el proyecto en dos idiomas para que llegue a más gente en el mundo. Indiegogo también es muy flexible en la recaudación de fondos.  P L E A S E       P O R  F A V OR  R E A D   ·   S H A R E   &   S U P P O R T  L E E    ·   C O M P A R T E   Y   A P O Y A      Please do register for our newsletter, so you can be informed of the evolution of the project as well as your perk.Le pedimos registrarse a nuestro boletín para seguir informado de la evolución del proyecto y de su recompensa también.    Go to Gaal's web page  and register (only your name & email) at the bottom of the page .   Entra en la pagina web de Gaal y registrate (solo tu nombre y tu correo) al final de la pagina .                      http://gaalcohen.com/index.php___________________________________

story:
MERCI 5000 FOIS! 

Comme nous avons atteint notre objectif, ce projet est maintenant passé en mode "In Demand" ce qui permet à cette page de rester active.

Parfait pour commander Spunkt Art Now!

 

Spunkt Art Now sera une œuvre hybride, à la fois littéraire et graphique, une publication surdimensionnée où dessins, photographies et textes s’inspirent de l’esthétique punk et réfléchissent à son influence sur les pratiques artistiques actuelles.

Spunkt Art Now est le pendant imprimé des performances qui auront lieu à l'automne 2019 à la galerie Howl! Arts à New York, puis des expositions collectives qui auront lieu à la Galerie de l'Université de Sherbrooke en janvier-février 2020 et à la Maison de la culture Janine-Sutto (Frontenac) en mai-juin 2020.

Courtoisie de Meky Ottawa

 

Spunkt Art Now regroupera ces artistes et ces auteurs ...

Chloé Surprenant - Meky Ottawa - Kateri Lemmens - Oli Sorenson - B.L.U.S.H. - Mathieu Arsenault - Jessica Bebenek - Anouk Pennel - Ève Dorais - Sébastien Pesot - Paryse Martin - Alexandra Madoyan - David G. Torres - Gloria Guirao Soro - Greil Markus - Graham Gillmore - Marie Arleth Skov - Brett De Palma

D'autres artistes et auteurs s'ajouteront une fois le financement confirmé

 

Ce dont nous avons besoin

Nous avons besoin d'un minimum de 5000$ pour terminer le financement soit:

3000$ pour compléter les coûts l'impression (1500 copies).

1500$ pour la correction et la traduction des textes.

500$ pour distribuer et poster les publications aux journalistes.


Courtoisie de Chloé Surprenant

 

Ce que vous obtenez en contrepartie (perk) d'un don

Tous les donateurs seront mentionnés à la dernière page de la publication  (vous pouvez aussi rester anonyme).

La plupart des contreparties contiennent des contreparties précédentes (vous n'êtes pas obligé de choisir une contrepartie comme vous pouvez sélectionner plus d'une catégorie)

Cliquez sur la contrepartie pour obtenir plus de détails sur celle-ci.

Pour les publications signées par les artistes, il faudra attendre 2020 pour avoir votre copie, puisqu'il faut courir faire signer les copies! Vous pourrez patienter en feuilleutant votre seconde copie - celle-là non-signée - dès octobre 2019.

Une photo d'une copie signée de Post-Punk Art Now

 

Rêvons un peu

Avec plus de 5000$, nous pourrions...

Imprimer plus de copies et mieux diffuser cette formidable publication.

Si nous n'atteignons pas notre objectif, nous imprimerons quand même la publication, mais avec moins de pages et en moins de copies.

 

Quand?

Récupérer votre affiche numérotée dès le 30 mai lors du vernissage au Studio FEED

Récupérer votre publication dès octobre 2019

À Brooklyn, lors des soirées de performances à la galerie Howl! Art (octobre 2019)

À Sherbrooke, lors de l'exposition collective à la Galerie de l'Université de Sherbrooke (janvier-février 2020)

À Montréal, lors du vernissage de l'exposition collective à la Maison de la culture Janine-Sutto (mai-juin 2020)

Vous ne pouvez pas vous rendre sur place? Contactez : info [at] pesot.ca pour un arrangement postal. Des coûts supplémentaires pourront vous être facturés.

 

Vous n'avez pas beaucoup d'argent ces temps-ci, mais vous aimeriez contribuer?

Passez le mot! Le monde doit entendre parler de cette campagne.

Aimez! Commentez! Et partagez la nouvelle sur les réseaux sociaux.

Merci de votre aide et de votre support !

+ +  +   +    +     +      +       +          +            +           

Comme lors de Post-Punk Art Now lors des expositions, Spunkt Art Now prendra la place qui lui revient au milieu des œuvres exposées : la publication contiendra l’exposition en même temps qu’elle en fera partie – fusion et fission d’une matière esthétique instable.

Nous accordons une très grande importance à cette publication, pensée comme un geste artistique pouvant jeter les bases d’un questionnement théorique sur l’influence résiduelle ou actuelle de ce mouvement marquant du 20e siècle.  

https://spunkt.art

story:
What is the BPAI - WHY PUBLIC ART 

  • The Berwyn Public Art Initiative (BPAI) is a non-profit that connects local, national and international artists with businesses, building owners and the larger community by engaging all in the transformative power of public art.
  • This public art effort is fueled by our community through a desire to help spur the economic vitality of the Berwyn Depot District.  With a rich blend of public art from acclaimed local and international artists we aim to make the Berwyn Depot District a vibrant cultural destination and source of immense community pride.  
What We Need & What You Get
  • It is the height of summer and prime time to ensure that initial mural installations in the depot district proceed before the hint of cold weather.  Your contribution will help pay for insurance, artist commissions,  and supplies allowing the Berwyn Depot District to jump into big art in a big way.    
  • All funds raised will be used to support public art in the depot, including these summer installations, and will help produce upcoming public art events during the fall and winter months to spur further cultural recognition. 

A BIG thank you already

Business owners from Lavergnes, O'Briens and Real Art Collectibles have already contributed a significant amount to secure the upcoming murals.  We couldn't have even started this as a community wide event without them.  

Thanks also to Vertical Gallery in Chicago. Each international artist has had a reason to come because of Vertical Gallery. This by far has allowed us to manage costs for our community and our business owners.  

Risks & Challenges

  • We can only be successful as a community if this is truly a community driven effort.  Your support will help create lasting change, transforming an entire neighborhood. 
  • The ability to create and manage fun family opportunities to engage in art rests in your trust in BPAI.  We hope you do trust that we have big plans for the coming year. 

Other Ways You Can Help

This is a community effort, maybe you can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't be part of this big art endeavor:

  • Take a minute and share the Indiegogo with our community.  Indiegogo makes this easy - check out the tools they have to share this wide and far. 
  • Join a BPAI committee or donate some volunteers hours to help market, fundraise and coordinate onsite mural installations.  Email info@berwynpublicartinitiative.org.

story:
Hi Everyone! 

I'm Meadow *curtsey*. I am a Face Painting Faerie & it has been my dream to attend the Face and Body Art International Convention for the past 4 years. 

I have been Face Painting for about 5 years now & love the joy that this art form brings to all that it touches *smile*. 

The smile that spreads across children's (and the young at heart *wink*) faces when they see themselves in the mirror after they havetheir face painted is like 'real' magic; seing a person truly admire their own unique reflection feels so wonderdul. *smile* The world needs more of that.


A few years ago I decided that I wanted to help other people who wanted to learn how to face paint. Classes are expensive and out-of-reach to many, so I decided that I would make a Youtube channel. This way I could help anyone from a Professional Face Painter - to - a Parents Group who needed to paint faces for a charity event. 

Since 2011 I have made dozens and dozens of Free Face Painting tutorials to help and inspire those who also love sharing this art form. 

I feel so flattered that some of these videos have over 25,000 views *blush*. The warm response that I have received from many of my fans has been so touching. I have a huge passion for teaching & love being able to reach and help so many.

Many of these viewers, my family and friends have been encouraging me to try crowdfunding so that I can afford to visit the Face and Body Art International Convention this year. 

This is a huge educational event that happens in a land far-far-away from the Kingdom of California where I can learn all kinds of new artistic styles,techniques and skills that will make me a stronger painter & even better face painting teacher.

The thorn is, it is expensive (worth every penny, but I don't have those pennies *laugh*). 

Here are some of the costs that I am looking at... 

  1. Class Regestration: $415
  2. Convention Site Hotel Cost: $605
  3. Intensive Workshops $100
  4. Flight $600-$700
  5. Supply Costs $100

The classes, flight and safe place to rest my wings all add up to a number I cannot save up at this point in my life. As a working mother of 3, there are always at least 3 people who's needs come before mine. So that is why I have landed here.

If you like my work, if you have watched one of my tutorials, if I have painted your face, your children's faces, taught you to paint, or if you just want to help real-life Faerie take some much needed art classes, I would be incredibly grateful if you would share a few dollars with me here. 

Thank you for taking the time to follow me down this wordy-journey *laugh*. Your support, even just your kind words mean the world to me.

If you would like to see more of my work, you can peek at it here: https://www.facebook.com/FaerieMeadow

story:
ONLY ONE WEEK UNTIL - First Professional Artist Publication!

Hi! My name is Kayla and I am an emerging Contemporary Abstract Artist. I am excited to find out that I have been accepted for publication in the next issue of Studio Visit Magazine, sister to New American Paintings. This campaign is to assist in the fees involved with publication, so I can accept this great opportunity to further my artist career!

  • Graduate of the Savannah College of Art and Design with a B.F.A. in painting. 
  • I relocated to Los Angeles, CA, where I have begun to develop my career as a professional artist.
  • This opportunity will allow my work to be seen by galleries, collectors, dealers and curators across the country!
  • Your contribution will help make it possible for me to be a part of this prestigious publication.

What We Need & What You Get

  • The money raised, will be used entirely toward paying for the two-page spread in the next issue of Studio Visit Magazine.
  • Studio Visit is a series of juried artist books. Since 2008 they have offered artists a new and effective venue through which to introduce work to a serious national audience of art world professionals. www.studiovisitmagazine.com

Risks & Challenges

Since my acceptance into the magazine is already solid, there are little to no risks involved with project donation.


Other Ways You Can Help

Don't stop here! Spread the word about this project. I only have one week before the paperwork is due for the publication!

  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!
Thanks for all your support!

Check out my website to find out what my work is all about: www.kaylalcloonan.com

story:
Why Heroes of the Middle East/North Africa?

We've had it up to here with low-brow stereotypes—we're bored with simplistic representations of Arabs/Muslims in the media, film and television. We believe it's time to elevate the public conversation. From Morocco to Afghanistan our cultures are diverse, our history is rich, and we have many stories to tell. 

WHY US? We've taken on this project because we are the founders of the first cultural arts center devoted to the Middle East and North Africa in Southern California—the Levantine Cultural Center.

Fact is, southern California is home to more Arabs, Iranians, Armenians, Turks, Israelis, Middle Eastern Jews, Kurds and others from North Africa, the Levant and the Middle East than anywhere else in the country.

We launched the Levantine Cultural Center during the summer of 2001 and for the past 12 years, we have relentlessly, ambitiously and sometimes audaciously presented Arab/Muslim and Middle Eastern cultures without apology, as we work to bring our cultures into the American mainstream—to combat negative stereotypes about us in film, television, news media and the arts world.

  • By helping to fund our HEROES OF THE MIDDLE EAST mural, you can combat demeaning and ultimately simplistic stereotypes and thereby advance human progress.
  • Our mural will be 53 by 19 feet, and will be the only mural of its kind in the greater Los Angeles region.
  • It will raise consciousness about the historic and contemporary contributions of women and men from the Middle East and North Africa.

Gracing the mural will be be 99 larger than life portraits, including Rumi, Fairuz, Khalil Gibran, Oum Khoulthoum, Edmond Jabès, Omar Khayyam, Mahmoud Darwish, Forugh Farrokhzad, Edmond Amran El Maleh, Nizar Qabbani, Mohamad Abdul Wahab, Samir Naqqash, Nazem Al Ghazali, Leila Mourad, Orhan Pamuk, Naguib Mahfouz and many more.

WHO are YOUR heroes and icons of the Middle East/North Africa, from Morocco to Afghanistan?

What We Need & What You Get

  • We  need $10,000 to pay for paint, artist fees, scaffolding, educational brochures, permits, insurance and marketing materials.
  • You get your name as a supporter printed in the 99 Heroes brochure, plus other perks!
  • Whatever we don't raise with Indiegogo we'll raise with individual hands-on fundraising.
  • If we raise more than $10,000, we'll apply those funds to the next mural!

The Impact

The mural is smack dab in a mixed neighborhood of Indians, Ethiopians, Jews, African Americans and a smorgasbord of other cultures, none of them Middle Eastern or North African.

  • The Heroes mural makes the world a bigger, more interconnected place.
  • We have successfully presented public programs like this for 12 years.
  • People look to the Levantine Cultural Center for leadership on the Arab world and the Middle East, from Morocco to Afghanistan. The mural will strengthen all our communities!

Other Ways You Can Help

You can be a great ally to this project even if you can't make a contribution today:

  • Help us to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Use our Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you for being a cultural ambassador and friend of peace!
story_txt:
Why Heroes of the Middle East/North Africa?
We've had it up to here with low-brow stereotypes—we're bored with simplistic representations of Arabs/Muslims in the media, film and television. We believe it's time to elevate the public conversation. From Morocco to Afghanistan our cultures are diverse, our history is rich, and we have many stories to tell. 
WHY US? We've taken on this project because we are the founders of the first cultural arts center devoted to the Middle East and North Africa in Southern California—the Levantine Cultural Center.
Fact is, southern California is home to more Arabs, Iranians, Armenians, Turks, Israelis, Middle Eastern Jews, Kurds and others from North Africa, the Levant and the Middle East than anywhere else in the country.
We launched the Levantine Cultural Center during the summer of 2001 and for the past 12 years, we have relentlessly, ambitiously and sometimes audaciously presented Arab/Muslim and Middle Eastern cultures without apology, as we work to bring our cultures into the American mainstream—to combat negative stereotypes about us in film, television, news media and the arts world.

By helping to fund our HEROES OF THE MIDDLE EAST mural, you can combat demeaning and ultimately simplistic stereotypes and thereby advance human progress.
Our mural will be 53 by 19 feet, and will be the only mural of its kind in the greater Los Angeles region.
It will raise consciousness about the historic and contemporary contributions of women and men from the Middle East and North Africa.

Gracing the mural will be be 99 larger than life portraits, including Rumi, Fairuz, Khalil Gibran, Oum Khoulthoum, Edmond Jabès, Omar Khayyam, Mahmoud Darwish, Forugh Farrokhzad, Edmond Amran El Maleh, Nizar Qabbani, Mohamad Abdul Wahab, Samir Naqqash, Nazem Al Ghazali, Leila Mourad, Orhan Pamuk, Naguib Mahfouz and many more.
WHO are YOUR heroes and icons of the Middle East/North Africa, from Morocco to Afghanistan?


What We Need & What You Get

We  need $10,000 to pay for paint, artist fees, scaffolding, educational brochures, permits, insurance and marketing materials.
You get your name as a supporter printed in the 99 Heroes brochure, plus other perks!
Whatever we don't raise with Indiegogo we'll raise with individual hands-on fundraising.
If we raise more than $10,000, we'll apply those funds to the next mural!



The Impact
The mural is smack dab in a mixed neighborhood of Indians, Ethiopians, Jews, African Americans and a smorgasbord of other cultures, none of them Middle Eastern or North African.

The Heroes mural makes the world a bigger, more interconnected place.
We have successfully presented public programs like this for 12 years.
People look to the Levantine Cultural Center for leadership on the Arab world and the Middle East, from Morocco to Afghanistan. The mural will strengthen all our communities!



Other Ways You Can Help
You can be a great ally to this project even if you can't make a contribution today:

Help us to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
Use our Indiegogo share tools!


Thank you for being a cultural ambassador and friend of peace!

story:
[ITA]

GRAZIE A TUTTI!

La campagna di raccolta fondi per il progetto Borgo Vecchio Factory si è conclusa sabato 8 novembre con un enorme successo: oltre al traguardo iniziale che ci eravamo posti abbiamo superato anche il secondo goal che ci permetterà di organizzare altri due workshop con due streetartist e la mostra finale per le strade di Borgo Vecchio.

A tutti voi che avete donato va il nostro più profondo ringraziamento: il successo della campagna dipende da voi!

[ENG]

THANK YOU!


The crowd-funding campaign for Borgo Vecchio Factory ended Saturday, November 8 and it was a success: in addition to the initial goal we set, we also reached the second one that will allow us to organize two more workshops with two streetartist and a final exhibition along the streets of Borgo Vecchio.

We want to say thank you to all of you: the success of the campaign depends on you!

[ITA]

MESSAGGIO IMPORTANTE!

Grazie al supporto dei primi benefattori in meno di due settimane BORGO VECCHIO FACTORY ha già raggiunto l'obiettivo di 5000 euro che si era prefissato. Con la somma raccolta, PUSH, PER ESEMPIO e EMA JONS si impegnano quindi a garantire l’organizzazione di un ciclo semestrale di workshop di pittura creativa per i bambini di Borgo Vecchio e la relativa realizzazione di opere di street art sui muri del quartiere.

Adesso però vogliamo fare di più: ci piacerebbe arricchire il progetto invitando altri due streetartist a tenere due ulteriori cicli di workshop della durata di un mese ciascuno, per far confrontare i bambini con nuovi stili, nuove voci e nuove storie. Da questa esperienza trarremo poi una mostra fotografica che sarà installata per le strade di Borgo Vecchio, cornice unica e ideale per raccontare questa storia.

Per il nostro sogno in grande abbiamo stabilito quindi un nuovo obiettivo di 3000 euro, con cui copriremo le spese degli spostamenti e di soggiorno dei due artisti, l'acquisto dei materiali per i nuovi laboratori e l'installazione della mostra. Chi ancora non conoscesse il progetto Borgo Vecchio Factory può farlo continuando a leggere in basso.


[ENG]

IMPORTANT MESSAGE!

Thanks to the support of the first benefactors BORGO VECCHIO FACTORY reached its goal of 5,000 Euros. With the raised money PUSH, PER ESEMPIO and EMA JONS

will guarantee the organization of a six-months creative painting workshop for the kids of Borgo Vecchio and the making of the street art with Ema Jons on the walls of the neighborhood.

Now we want to do more: we would like to enrich the project and invite two more artists for two workshops lasting one month each, so that kids will know new styles, new voices and new stories. From this experience we will organize a photographic exhibition on the streets of Borgo Vecchio, the perfect place to tell this story.

For our big dream we are setting a new goal of 3,000 euro, that will cover the costs of travel and subsistence of the two artists, the purchase of materials for the workshops and the installation of the exhibition.

If you haven't heard of Borgo Vecchio Factory before, please keep reading below.


Cos'è BORGO VECCHIO FACTORY
What's BORGO VECCHIO FACTORY


[ITA]
BORGO VECCHIO FACTORY è un progetto di promozione sociale proposto dall'organizzazione no profit PUSH, in collaborazione con lo street artist Ema Jons e Per Esempio Onlus, che prevede la realizzazione di un ciclo semestrale di laboratori di pittura creativa per 20 bambini del quartiere Borgo Vecchio a Palermo, antico rione abitato per la maggior parte da famiglie con gravi difficoltà economiche. Con un tasso di disoccupazione del 40%, un diffuso analfabetismo e un insufficiente livello di scolarizzazione, il quartiere vive un’evidente condizione di esclusione sociale causata dalla mancanza di servizi e un elevato tasso di criminalità.


[ENG]
BORGO VECCHIO FACTORY is a project of social progress promoted by non-profit organization PUSH, together with street artist Ema Jons and Per Esempio Onlus. It aims to realize a six-month cycle of creative painting workshops for 20 children of the Borgo Vecchio neighborhood, in Palermo, historical area where most of the families live in poverty. Unemployment reaches 40% and access to education is extremely low. The neighbourhood is hit by social unrest, due to an absence of public services and high crime rates.


[FRA] [GER] [ESP] click here.

 


[ITA] Il progetto nasce come prosecuzione di “Frequenza 200”, esperienza intrapresa nel 2012 da “Arteca Onlus” e “Per Esempio Onlus”, sempre in collaborazione con Ema Jons, ha coinvolto 20 bambini e ragazzi, tra i 5 e i 15 anni, tra Gennaio e Febbraio 2014, proponendo laboratori artistici doposcuola. I disegni e i dipinti prodotti durante i laboratori sono stati utilizzati poi come bozzetti per dei murales realizzati a più mani sui prospetti delle case del quartiere. L’iniziativa ha stimolato l’intera comunità a riflettere sui propri luoghi e a vederli con occhi nuovi per rivalorizzarli e rivalutarli. La realizzazione di un’opera d’arte “pubblica” ha infatti il merito di mettere tutti nelle condizioni di agire concretamente sul proprio contesto quotidiano, far riacquisire una rinnovata consapevolezza delle proprie capacità e smorzare così la mancanza di fiducia in se stessi. L’obiettivo di BORGO VECCHIO FACTORY è di riproporre il progetto per altri sei mesi, a partire da Novembre 2014, coinvolgendo nuove famiglie e nuovi spazi.


[ENG] The project, started in 2012 by the organisations "Arteca onlus" and "Per Esempio Onlus" always in partnership with Ema Jons, engaged 20 children and teenagers in afterschool creative workshops. The drawings and paintings produced in these workshops were used to decorate buildings in the neighbourhood. This initiative has stimulated the entire community to reflect on their neighbourhood. To see it from a different perspective. To revalue it. And learn to love it. By creating a public art piece like this, people can influence their surroundings, become aware of their own potential, and build their self-esteem. The main goal of BORGO VECCHIO FACTORY is to run the project for another 6 months. Starting in November 2014, engaging new families and new areas in Palermo.


 



Come ti ringraziamo
How we want to thank you


[ITA] Per ringraziarti della donazione, oltre ad aggiungere il tuo nome nella lista dei donatori sul nostro Tumblr e sul catalogo/diario, abbiamo pensato di inviarti anche dei regali. In base all’importo donato puoi scegliere tra cartoline, segnalibri o shopper che raffigurano i disegni e i murales realizzati a Borgo Vecchio.
Per indicare la tua scelta basterà, dopo aver fatto la donazione, inviare una mail a bvfactory@wepush.org, specificando nell’oggetto la parola “CARTOLINE” o “SEGNALIBRI” in base alla tua preferenza. Nel caso delle shopper indicherai invece il nome del relativo disegno (es. CAVÁSINO, PIOVRA, ecc.).
Il catalogo/diario e la stampa numerata di Ema Jons saranno realizzate al termine delle attività. Per il ringraziamento personalizzato su Facebook segui la pagina Borgo Vecchio Factory.


[ENG] For your donation, we’ll add your name to the list of supporters on our Tumblr page and in the catalogue. We’ll also send you a special present. Depending on the amount of your donation, you can choose from various postcards, bookmarks or shoppers with drawings from the project.
To choose your present, send an email to bvfactory@wepush.org, and specify in the object of the email the word “POSTCARDS” or “BOOKMARKS”. If you prefer a shopper, write in the object of the email the title of the artwork you’d like on it (i.e. CAVÁSINO, PIOVRA, etc.).
The catalogue and the limited edition poster of Ema Jons will be produced at the end of the project. For a personal thank you message on Facebook, follow the fan page Borgo Vecchio Factory.


Contribuisci alla rigenerazione di Borgo Vecchio
Contribute to the regeneration in Borgo Vecchio


[ITA] Offrendo il tuo sostegno alla campagna, contribuisci direttamente all’acquisto dei colori, delle bombolette spray e di tutto il materiale di cartoleria necessario, al rimborso delle spese di soggiorno di Ema Jons a Palermo e a quelle di produzione e spedizione delle ricompense che ti invieremo per ringraziarti del supporto. Block Design supporta l’iniziativa sponsorizzando in parte la stampa dei gadget.
A fine lavori sarà allestita per le vie del quartiere anche una mostra dei disegni e sarà stampato un piccolo catalogo/diario contenente le foto dei lavori dei partecipanti, testimonianze della comunità ed in calce i nomi di tutti quelli che hanno contribuito al progetto con le loro donazioni.


[ENG] Support our campaign and you will help us buy spray paint and the necessary materials for the artworks. It will help Ema Jons’ cover his expenses to travel to Palermo. We’ll send you a present to thank you for your support, printed by Block Design who also sponsors the project.
At the end of the project we organise an exhibition of the children’s artworks on the streets in Borgo Vecchio. We’ll also create and print a small catalogue with the pictures of the artworks, testimonials from local people, and a list of names of everyone who has contributed with donations.


  



[ITA] Insieme puntiamo a raggiungere l’obiettivo di 5000 euro ma nell'ipotesi che superassimo la quota prevista ci impegnamo ad impiegare le donazioni extra per coinvolgere altri artisti – italiani e stranieri – e permettere così a più ragazzi di prendere parte alle attività del laboratorio. Nell’ipotesi inversa invece, se non giungessimo alla quota fissata, proporremmo ugualmente l’iniziativa riducendo il numero dei mesi di attività, relativamente alla somma ricavata.
Noi siamo molto ottimisti e tu? Se anche tu tieni e credi alla buona riuscita del progetto, contribuisci attivamente a diffondere l’iniziativa e a supportare la campagna.


[ENG] Our goal is to collect €5,000. If we collect more, we’ll use the money to engage other artists - from Italy and abroad - to enable more children to take part in the workshops. If we collect less than €5,000, we’ll run the workshops anyway, but for a shorter period of time.
We are very optimistic. Will you help us to share and support this initiative?


Chi sono Ema, Per Esempio e PUSH
Who are Ema, Per Esempio and PUSH


[ITA] Ema è un artista muralista, cioè - come ama definirsi lui stesso - “uno che pitta i muri, un graffitaro o graffitista che dir si voglia”. Coinvolto in laboratori artistici per piccoli, ha pensato di utilizzare proprio i disegni dei bambini come ispirazione per co-creare una nutrita serie di grandi dipinti murali sulle case della gente del luogo, felicemente supportato dalla comunità e dai familiari dei ragazzi.

Per Esempio Onlus lavora sull’empowerment dei soggetti e delle categorie a rischio marginalità sociale. La sua mission è attivare processi di sviluppo locale che mirano ad incrementare i livelli di coesione sociale. Per Esempio supporta le azioni che mirano ad uno sviluppo completo della persona e della comunità, privilegiando un approccio all’apprendimento di tipo non formale e metodologie che mirano al dialogo interculturale.

PUSH è un’organizzazione no-profit con sede a Palermo nata con l’obiettivo di spingere le comunità, le pubbliche amministrazioni e gli enti locali a divenire parte attiva del processo di rinnovamento urbano attraverso una nuova progettualità improntata all’innovazione sociale. PUSH abbraccia, sposa, condivide e “cova” progetti e idee di rigenerazione urbana e sociale attraverso un approccio olistico, transcalare, multidisciplinare e crossmediale.


  


[ENG] Ema is a street artist. Or as he would say “somebody who paints walls, a graffiti artist”. When running creative workshops with children, he got the idea of using children’s artworks as a first draft for a series of big murals. With the children, he painted these on houses in Borgo Vecchio. The community and the children’s families have happily supported him.

Per Esempio Onlus is a non-profit organisation that works to empower people that are at risk of being socially marginalised. Their mission is to increase social cohesion. Per Esempio supports activities aiming at the full development of the person and community. They choose an unconventional approach to learning in combination with methodologies to support an intercultural dialogue.

PUSH is a non-profit organisation based in Palermo, with the objective to “push” communities, public administration as well as local organisations to become an active part of urban regeneration through social innovation. PUSH creates, lunches and sustains projects and ideas for urban and social regeneration through a holistic, multidisciplinary and cross-channel approach.

Chi sono Ema, Per Esempio e PUSHWho are Ema, Per Esempio and PUSH

[ITA] Ema è un artista muralista, cioè - come ama definirsi lui stesso - “uno che pitta i muri, un graffitaro o graffitista che dir si voglia”. Coinvolto in laboratori artistici per piccoli, ha pensato di utilizzare proprio i disegni dei bambini come ispirazione per co-creare una nutrita serie di grandi dipinti murali sulle case della gente del luogo, felicemente supportato dalla comunità e dai familiari dei ragazzi.
Per Esempio Onlus lavora sull’empowerment dei soggetti e delle categorie a rischio marginalità sociale. La sua mission è attivare processi di sviluppo locale che mirano ad incrementare i livelli di coesione sociale. Per Esempio supporta le azioni che mirano ad uno sviluppo completo della persona e della comunità, privilegiando un approccio all’apprendimento di tipo non formale e metodologie che mirano al dialogo interculturale.
PUSH è un’organizzazione no-profit con sede a Palermo nata con l’obiettivo di spingere le comunità, le pubbliche amministrazioni e gli enti locali a divenire parte attiva del processo di rinnovamento urbano attraverso una nuova progettualità improntata all’innovazione sociale. PUSH abbraccia, sposa, condivide e “cova” progetti e idee di rigenerazione urbana e sociale attraverso un approccio olistico, transcalare, multidisciplinare e crossmediale.
  

[ENG] Ema is a street artist. Or as he would say “somebody who paints walls, a graffiti artist”. When running creative workshops with children, he got the idea of using children’s artworks as a first draft for a series of big murals. With the children, he painted these on houses in Borgo Vecchio. The community and the children’s families have happily supported him. 

Per Esempio Onlus is a non-profit organisation that works to empower people that are at risk of being socially marginalised. Their mission is to increase social cohesion. Per Esempio supports activities aiming at the full development of the person and community. They choose an unconventional approach to learning in combination with methodologies to support an intercultural dialogue.
PUSH is a non-profit organisation based in Palermo, with the objective to “push” communities, public administration as well as local organisations to become an active part of urban regeneration through social innovation. PUSH creates, lunches and sustains projects and ideas for urban and social regeneration through a holistic, multidisciplinary and cross-channel approach.

story:
Why? 

           My name is Adam Schmidt. I am a student at Northern Kentucky University studying Art. I am earning a Bachelor's of Art degree in Art Education and a Bachelor’s of Fine Art degree in Sculpture. I have signed up to study abroad in Italy so I can experience the incredible artwork that was made by some of the greatest artists to ever live. I will be visiting Florence and Rome while there and seeing the beauty Italy has to offer.  

           As long as I can remember, I have been making art. As I have grown older, my passion for art has tremendously increased. I am always happy when I make my own art, but I become immersed in the work of others. My dream has always been to see Michelangelo and other well-known artists' artwork. 

           The opportunity to travel to Italy is something that I never thought would happen to me. This endeavor will increase my knowledge of art, enhance my ability to teach it to others, and strengthen my talent to make art.

Education:

2011-present Northern Kentucky University 

2007-2011 Covington Catholic High School 

2010 Kentucky Governor's School for the Arts 

Exhibition History:

2014/2013/2012 Behringer-Crawford Museum; freshART, Park Hills, KY 

2013/2012 Music on the Avenue Recital Series, Bellevue, KY   

2012 Artists’ Reaching Classrooms National Exhibition, United States Department               of Education, Washington, D.C.

2012  Northern Kentucky University Freshmen Art Show, Highland Heights, KY  

2011 Carnegie; Diocese of Covington High School Show, Covington, KY

2011 Sigra Gallery, Covington Catholic High School and Notre Dame Academy Art               Show, Newport, KY

Commissions:

2013 Korean War Memorial Renderings - Linden Grove Cemetery Covington, KY

2013 Sponsor Recognition Sculpture - Interfaith Hospitality Network of Greater                     Cincinnati

2011 Sidewalk Chalk Art Olive’s Restaurant Cincinnati, OH

Awards:

2014 Hyde Park Square Art Show Scholarship

2011 Gallenstein Art Scholarship     


What We Need & What You Get

Trip: $2950

This includes airfare, hotel, admission to museums and churches, and breakfasts.

Lunches and Dinners: $175

Misc: $100


The Incentives:

I appreciate everything! If you are willing to help me, here is what you will receive:
A $20 donation means you are a trip supporter.
A $30 donation means you will choose a photograph from my trip. (8x10, unframed)  
A $40 donation means you will choose from a selection of my sketches.
A $100 donation means you will choose from a selection of my drawings and paintings.
A $200 donation means you will choose from a selection of my sculptures.
A $450 donation means I will create a unique piece of art for you. 

The Impact 

I will be seeing some of the most impressive works of art in the world while in Italy. By experiencing the work first hand, I will be able to appreciate the craftsmanship, love and energy that was put into each piece of art. Your contribution will help me become more knowledgeable about art history, strengthen my art-making talent, and prepare me to teach art to students. 


    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't help me financially, you can do the following: 

    Like my Facebook art page:

    www.facebook.com/artbyschmidt

    Follow me on Instagram: 

    www.instagram.com/adams3215

    Share my campaign with family and friends!

story:
Short Summary

* Latest update!! I have reached my IDEAL TARGET of 2,000 USD within only 2 days of my campaign!! And this is THANKS TO YOUR SUPPORT!!! I am INFINITELY GRATEFUL and touched by your generosity and belief in what I do and try to share in the world!!

Dear friends, I want you to know that any additional money that comes in to support my campaign from this point onwards until my deadline on October 14th will be used to improve this project and put aside for my follow-up art-community projects next year. I am researching now on how to take this vision further, and I shall keep you involved and posted on my plans!!

This is a whole new world of possibilities I am stepping into and I am excited, joyful and appreciative to know you have my back! Let's make good things happen!! As I said, I believe in SHARING and SPREADING love, skills and enthusiasm. And I am happy you are sharing my belief. THANKS A LOT *

* Contributions can still be received and are greatly appreciated despite having met my minimum critical target of 500 USD *

*The bigger the budget, the better the project! *

My name is Melanie Gritzka del Villar, a half-Filipina half-German artist based in Bangkok. I am a painter who works on all kinds of surfaces: canvas, card, driftwood, found objects, walls in the street.

Check out some of my work here on my website: www.gritzkadelvillar.com

I am also a part-time lecturer at Chulalongkorn University in Bangkok. Other than that I work on my own art and art projects.

My current aspiration is to do an art workshop with children of the district of Dharavi, Mumbai, India. I have a strong desire to work outside of my usual formal set-up at university and work hands-on with local communities.

I feel it is important to share one's passion and that it is through true passion that one can reach out and inspire others. I would like to work with the community of Dharavi to exchange knowledge, skills and experience, and to encourage the value of creativity and imagination, especially amongst the children. I also want to encourage the idea that one does not need much to create a work of art - the simplest of means can create amazing results!

The 5-day workshop will take place October 19th to 24th 2014, in the slum of Dharavi, using the organization www.urbz.net as platform to reach out to the community.

In supporting my project, I feel you are helping in sharing this enthusiasm and belief I have in art as means of expression. Working with recycled materials is a great way to help excite the value of the means available to us in the present moment, as well as the appreciation of beauty in our everyday lives. I feel it is a project that - albeit humble in scale - can have invaluable effects on the children I will work with. This project is based on my belief in sharing, encouraging and exchanging creativity.

What We Need & What You Get

CRITICAL TARGET: My critical target is a MINIMUM of 500 USD (approx. 20,000THB), which will hopefully cover the following:

- Materials for the workshop: paint, recycled material.

- Assistance for the workshop: translator, local craftsmen to help execute the art works.

IDEAL TARGET: Realistically though, my target would be 2000 USD as that would not only ensure a solid budget for the workshop expenses and ensure a decent number of participants but it would also cover my personal costs: airfare, accommodation, visa, vaccinations, and basic daily needs such as food and transportation.

What you will get in return for your support:

I will send you a personal THANK YOU note.

I will also make a summary document and a video of the workshop and will share it with you.

PLUS: If you are one of the ten first people to contribute 100USD or above, I will make you a unique little cardboard collage of mine and send it to you via post!

In case I do not reach my target budget:

All funds will nevertheless go to the realization of the project. I will try and adjust the workshop to whatever amount of funding I will have at the end of this campaign. I am good at improvisation, so I can guarantee I will make something happen, even if funds are low.

The Impact

I have been working in education for eight years now, and I have lead workshops at St. John's Int'l School Bangkok as well as Chulalongkorn University Bangkok. Each time I work with children I realize the great potential in these creative exchanges, beneficial to both: teacher and students.

I have a deep desire to inspire others. Sometimes this means really going beyond and outside one's comfort zones to explore new possibilities and horizons. I feel that this project is but one step towards sharing more of myself with others. I believe that creativity and imagination are qualities that need to be nurtured, especially in children who, although naturally gifted, often do not get the support or encouragement needed to realize their artistic expression.

By helping me push through with this art workshop, I feel we are together helping to enable children from less privileged communities realize their potential. At the same time we will actively nurture those human qualities that are essential for personal growth and on a larger scale, a healthy society: collaboration, sharing, imagination and creativity.

Risks & Challenges

This is a self-initiated project and I will rely on the help and participation of the local community of Dharavi. However, since I will be working with and through the staff of URBZ, I am confident that together we will be able to solve logistical challenges of finding participants, devising a feasible time-frame for the workshop, as well finding a solution to storage and display of the final art works.

Other Ways You Can Help

I value and truly appreciate any form of support. If you cannot contribute to the funding scheme, I would be very happy if you could help spread the word of my project initiative via email, social media and of course, the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
The goal of this project is to track and photograph the elusive cougar (mountain lion, puma). They are north America's largest wild cat and are very hard to find. The cougar is common where I live, the northern mountains of Colorado. They are also very dangerous and can only be seen from a far distance. In order to photograph the cougar, I'm going to need a large telephoto lens. Specifically the sigma 150-500mm f5-6.3 lens. This lens is $799 but I have found it for $719.99. On my canon eos rebel t5i, I will be able to produce close up, sharp photos of the cougar. By photographing a cougar, I will learn a lot about their  behavior in the wild and get an incredible photo that is very rare and hard to get. By photographing this cat, I will show how human expansion is limiting their habitat and lowering their population.


Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge is finding and photographing a cougar. They are very hard to find but are very common where I live(northern Colorado). I am in their habitat everyday increasing my chances of finding one. I will be getting help by biologists and local government officials for information on resent sightings. This will give me the best chance of finding one and staying safe around it. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If funding isn't an option for you there are many other ways to help. The best way is to share this so it can reach as many people as possable. The more people that help, the greater my chances are of reaching my goal. Also check out my photography facebook page, Brendan Durrum's Photography and like it to updates on this project or any of my others. https://www.facebook.com/brendandurrumphoto. Also check out my flickr page with my largest library of photos that I have taken. https://www.flickr.com/photos/113479414@N02/sets

story:
Now Recruiting Artists, Models, Hair & MAU, Photographers and Event Volunteers for Denim Day Tucson Live Art Event 2015!

For this year's event we are instituting a new system for raising funds. As one of our event volunteers, we ask you to donate $10 toward our printing and event materials budget. 

Our Annual Live Art Event gets bigger and more attention each year. In our first year, we reached over 500 people; in our second and third over 1000. 

It is our hope that our volunteers feel as strongly about our mission as we do and are able to help contribute too! 

Your contribution will also serve as your confirmation of your participation. 

Thanks for your commitment to the cause!!! 

Denim Day History: In 1998, the Italian Supreme Court dismissed charges against a rape suspect because his victim was wearing jeans at the time of the attack. The judgment sparked a worldwide outcry which evolved into an annual, international, day of protest. 

Denim Day Tucson Live Art Event: Our idea is to attract the attention of passersby, engage them in conversation about rape/sexual assault, and give them educational materials dispelling rape myths, discouraging victim blaming, and where to turn for help if one is assaulted. We do this by creating a public display that draws people in and stirs their curiosity. We have our models and artists on 4th avenue and/or downtown. The artists do live art, painting the jeans our models are wearing while volunteers pass out materials to passersby.

story:
Storytelling through Photography

I have always seen the world differently.  Some would call it "different" or unbalanced.  I  wouldn't.  The stories are out there, in every angle, every color, every moment.  Whether it is the glorious ecstasy of a sunset to the melancholy contained in a cracked window....the stories are out there.   I need to find them and tell them.  But I  need your help....my gear is out of date and I need help to step up the quality of the images I am trying to capture.

List Gear 

  • My goal is to raise funds for a Panasonic Lumix GM1 Camera, Lenses, a tripod and a case.  I need the gear to be light and portable so I can be ready at the right moment.  
  • Why a Podcast?  Stories!  Everyone has a story and I want to find them.  I want to hear those stories in a person's own words.
  • What do you get out of it?  Well....you get to share in our stories and tell your own

 

 Risks & Challenges -

  • Several of my planned collections involve locations in retail locations.  I may not gain access to them or have a location fee involved. 
  • One of my projects planned for 2016 is in Cuba...the challenge?  It's Cuba.  But I want to get there before the tourists from the US muck it up. 
  • I have never done a podcast and there will be a technical learning curve.  But I have at three interviews waiting on me.  

Other Ways You Can Help 

  • Check out my portfolio at Balanced Pictures and share it.
  • Follow me on Facebook and Twitter - send me feedback.

story:
THE STORY

Joel Escol is a frustrated artist and 4th Year Architecture student. He didn't finish his last year in college plus some major subjects due to massive poverty. Out of frustration, he got married and gave up his talent in art and thrashed all his painting materials. Instead, he focused on his work as a Journalist and also on his family. He had forgotten his ultimate dream of establishing a mini art school and teach children all about his brand of artistry.

But the internet and YouTube opened doors to him to live up to his passion in painting and cartooning when he saw great artists and read about their lives.

Now, after 10 years, his passion in painting is here again, as he was more inspired by his over 6,000 neighbors who are survivors of Typhoon Sendong that hit his hometown two years ago and claimed the lives of over a thousand people. Their children needs help to recover from trauma and he believes he can become part of their recovery.

Si Joel Escol usa ka frustrated artist nga anaa na sa iyang ikaupat nga tuig sa Arktekto. Wala niya mahuman ang kolehiyo tungod sa kapobrehon. Sayo siya nga naminyo ug gibiyaan ang iyang talento sa pag-drawing ug iyang gipanglabay ang iyang mga gamit sa pag-drawing. Tungod kay naminyo naman siya, iya na lamang gi-concentrate ang iyang kaugalingon sa iyang trabaho isip Jouranlist sa lokal nga newspaper.

Pero ang internet ug Youtube may nakapaabri pag-usab sa iyang kaikag sa pag-drawing sa dihang iya nabasa ang mga kinabuhi sa mga artist sa tibook kalibutan.

Karon pagkahuman sa napulo ka tuig, iya gibuhi pag usab ang iyang talento sa pag-drawing, ilabina nga na-inspired siya sa iyang mga silingan karon nga mga biktima sa Bagyong Sendong, nga mihapak sa Pilipinas niadtong Desyembre 16, 2011, ug mipatay sa liboan ka mga tawo.

Gusto niya nga makatukod sa art center aron matudloan ang mga anak sa nabiktima sa bagyo ug hinayhinay niini nga malimtan ang ilang  masakit nga kasinatian isip survivors sa bagyo.
 
THE PROBLEM

Right now, Joel has no more art materials left to begin working on major artworks that will inspire kids to learn art too. So, this time he turn to the loyal supporters of Indiegogo to ask for help.

Karon wala na siyay materyales sa pag drawing aron sugdan pag usab ang pagmugna sa mga obra maestra nga makadasig sa mga bata.
  


THE PROJECT BENEFICIARIES

These are the genuine children of Typhoon survivors. Many of them have lost their brothers and sisters their, parents and other members of the family - and they are my neighbors. Once the art center is established they are the main beneficiaries of the art center, which will also cater to other children of difficult circumstances.

This is where you come in!

Any donation you make will help me put my dream mini art school a real success! You know, many of the children of typhoon survivors are now school dropouts and they need some sort of temporary refuge, where they are encourage to go back to school in the next school opening. I believed teaching them about art could help alleviate the trauma they have experienced in the past.

Your donations will also received immediate gratifications! You can choose from various perks ranging from paintings, prints and original illustrations, aside from other self portrait perks that will be exclusively made for your family.

WHAT WE NEED?

1. Art Materials
2. 2 Computers
3. Canvasses
4. Tables and Chairs
5. Paints/Acrylics
6. Sketch Pads
7. Center Renovation Funds

ATTRACTIVE PERKS!


A portrait of the donors! This is the first perk that I will offer to my donors. You choose

the photo and I'll do a portrait of you according to my style. These portraits will be a

combination of charcoal, oil and other medium. I'm sure a lot of you guys want a family

portrait hanged in your wall. So, this is your opportune time to have a FAMILY

PORTRAIT at a very affordable price you can really afford.


WE HAVE A SPECIAL PERK

WE HOPE OUR DONORS WILL CONSIDER CHOOSING THIS NEW PERK NOW. AT

THIS EARLY, WE THANK YOU IN ADVANCE FOR SUPPORTING OUR CAMPAIGN. AS

THE KIDS LEARN ART, GET THEIR OWN ART MATERIALS AND FORGET THE

TRAGEDY OF TYPHOON, WE AWE THIS ALL TO YOU OUR SUPPORTERS. WE

KNOW YOU HAVE THE HEART. THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR BEING PART.


SPECIAL MUG PERK

Fund $100 and you can own one of this memorabilia mugs for life. This is one of the best memorabilia items you can get for 2013. (FREE SHIPPING)



So, you can choose your perks now!

AND THANK YOU VERY MUCH FOR SUPPORTING AND BECOMING PART OF MY LIFE! I WILL SURELY TREASURE THIS AS LONG AS I LIVE...


THE WRATH OF TYPHOON SENDONG

REUTERS      DAILY MAIL        FOXNEWS        CNBC NEWS



1.  MAKE A SMALL DONATION

If you feel like sharing your blessings or as your way of thanking the good Lord for all the blessings your family receives this year, then you can donate some amount according to what your heart desires

2.  SPREAD THE WORD!

Share this Indiegogo campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, LinkedIn, StumbleUpon, in email, blogs, phone calls, or with family, friends, colleagues, office mates, sport’s buddies.

3.  GET ONE PERK AND TOUCH LIVES

You can also consider getting one perk. You know we have interesting perks such as the artists themselves going to make a family portrait at very affordable prices you can surely afford.


If you need to contact me for whatever reason, email me at gofundme1791@gmail.com
story_txt:
THE STORYJoel Escol is a frustrated artist and 4th Year Architecture student. He didn't finish his last year in college plus some major subjects due to massive poverty. Out of frustration, he got married and gave up his talent in art and thrashed all his painting materials. Instead, he focused on his work as a Journalist and also on his family. He had forgotten his ultimate dream of establishing a mini art school and teach children all about his brand of artistry.But the internet and YouTube opened doors to him to live up to his passion in painting and cartooning when he saw great artists and read about their lives.Now, after 10 years, his passion in painting is here again, as he was more inspired by his over 6,000 neighbors who are survivors of Typhoon Sendong that hit his hometown two years ago and claimed the lives of over a thousand people. Their children needs help to recover from trauma and he believes he can become part of their recovery.Si Joel Escol usa ka frustrated artist nga anaa na sa iyang ikaupat nga tuig sa Arktekto. story:
Short Summary

An all female mariachi band gives new meaning to traditional music through their gender, diverse racial background and fusions.  Following the personal stories of the founder, Mireya Ramos –vocals and violin, Verónica Medellín –guitarrón- the only Mexican in the band, and Shea Fiol, vocals and vihuela, this documentary takes us to a journey of passion, talent and personal struggles as they open doors to other young musicians.

In the sexist and traditional world of Mexican mariachi music, a young and talented musician, Mireya Ramos, formed an energetic and exciting all female Mariachi band, Flor de Toloache, in New York City.  She is classically trained, has a beautiful voice, and plays the violin. 
Flor de Toloache’s attire is unique as they wear the male pants rather than the traditional mariachi skirts, and they don’t use the hat but a flower instead; they wear high heels and look gorgeous. 
They have been invited to be a part of “Viva el Arte Festival" in Santa Barbara, CA,  January 8-12, 2015. Then we want to them to travel to Mexico and play in the heart of Mariachi tradition, namely at Plaza del Mariachi in Guadalajara Mexico.

What We Need & What You Ge

We need your support to film these two trips and performances to add these scenes to the final documentary feature. Your contribution will help us pay for the trips, photographer, sound person and editor.

MFT has played on the East coast, mainly in NY, in Canada and India. In January they will conquer California and then perform in Mexico. 

Your perks will be a credit, a DVD, entrance to one of their concerts, or be part of a rehearsal session when they visit your city!

The Impact

Like many musicians Flor de Toloache travels to meet new audiences and touch them with their music and unique artistic proposal.  This documentary is important to impact young people, especially girls and Latinos who can see them as role models.  These women are innovators and are taking the world in their own terms.  Help them reach new audiences and impact the world through this documentary.

I am an experienced film maker, committed to my community and to the arts and I believe that music can change the world.  These women from different parts of the world play together and make beautiful music... they connect human beings through their voices and instruments.  Let them make a change and contribute to the understanding of human kind.

Risks & Challenges

To follow these mariachis in California will be a challenge, especially to portray their impact on people while they play, have fun, live and travel continually.  But this is part of their lives so this road trip is one chapter of the documentary that already includes their trip to India, several performances in NYC and later we hope to film them in Mexico, specially performing right at the heart of Mariachi culture, namely at the beautiful Plaza del Mariachi in Guadalajara, where only men play. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, spread the word through this page, and your Facebook page or twitter.  Invite your friends to follow the group and write comments on their page.

Thank you very much for your support!

story:
September is my 20th Anniversary month!

I started working for Sisters Habitat for Humanity in September 1995. I was their first employee, a part time program coordinator. We were finishing our 7th home.

Today I am the Executive Director, we have two successful stores, 12 staff, and we are going to finish our 57th house this fall.

Every day, I feel blessed having this fun and meaningful work. Its the best job EVER!

To celebrate this milestone, I am asking all my friends to make a $20 contribution to Sisters Habitat, so we can keep building houses with people in need.

My goal is to have 100 friends and supporters each donate $20, which will raise $2,000.  (Of course you can give more than $20! Maybe $200?)

    The next two builds are starting this fall in our new Village Meadows subdivision.

    Sisters Habitat took a leap of faith when we bought 17 lots in 2014 in a bank-owned development. We are ready now to start building, and this fall we will break ground on the first two homes. Your contribution will be designated to fund houses for the Broderick and Lantaler families. They will move in next spring.

    Thank You! (And help spread the word!)

    Habitat and I could never have done as much as we have without the help of hundreds of people who volunteer, donate and support us in a myriad of ways.

    Help me make my goal by September 30th. And please help me spread the word about this campaign. Thank you so much!

    LOve.
    Sharlene

story:
Short Summary

My name is Greg, and I am a 6-year Army Paratrooper with two combat tours, to both Afghanistan and Iraq. In August 2012, I was exposed to a 5,000 lbs Vehicle-Borne IED explosion that rendered me unconscious. I suffer from PTSD, multiple Traumatic Brain Injuries, and chronic pain. As I began to seek treatment, I found that art has provided the best escape and relaxation, when compared to the multitude of pharmaceuticals they want to push on you. Since last year, I have become very involved in painting and would like to begin my own nonprofit organization to provide art therapy, and art for pleasure, to local combat Veterans. The funds raised here would allow me to file the paperwork with the State and Federal Government for 501(C)(3) tax-exemption status. In the meantime, I will create a website to offer my art to  the public. All profits will go directly to the mission - 'Purple Heart Art' -'Healing through Art'. I would love to collect art from local artists as well, in the form of in-kind donations to auction off and raise funds for the cause. I also plan to assist other veterans on a weekly (or more) basis to conduct these art therapy sessions. Research shows that art and self-expression are beneficial to the treatment of PTSD and TBI's, that many Soldiers are coming home with today. The nonprofit will provide completely free art sessions with injured Military Service Members and their families at the local V.A. Hospital in Lebanon, PA. Purple Heart Art would also be interested in providing take-home art supplies for these injured Vets.

What We Need & What You Get

I need the funding to file my paperwork to form my nonprofit, 'Purple Heart Art'. I will also use the funds to establish my website and purchase the domain. With the remaining funds I will purchase art supplies, and canvases to build my portfolio of art, before I offer it to the public, as well as, to use these supplies with the Veterans at the local VA Hospital. Art can either be taken home with the Vet, or donated for future sale, rolling money back into the organization. All profits from the artwork sold will go to benefit 'Purple Heart Art'. I will also be purchasing a 'tent' for the local Art Festival in my hometown, which runs a couple hundred dollars. This will give great exposure to a brand new organization with a great purpose, and would allow me to offer individuals the opportunity to generously donate, and/or, collect a piece of artwork from myself, and other local artists. I would also like to print t-shirts for donors, as well as publicly recognize them through social media outlets. 

The Impact

If you have ever been to war, you understand how incredibly changed you return home.  Those moments will never leave you, but they do not always have to be viewed in a negative manner. Through art I have discovered that painting my emotions, feelings, and simply distracting myself by putting paint to a canvas has been the best therapy that can't be duplicated by pharmaceutical poison. By donating, you will allow me to more intensely pursue my passion of art, all while providing other injured service members the same opportunity. Not only will you be providing the foundation for what is certainly a needed service to our Veterans, you will be contributing to a worthy cause, in the making.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate, I understand, believe me. You could certainly help by sharing my campaign, though. I greatly appreciate your willingness to assist and your generosity.

story:
Short Summary

Wet Art organized an exhibition and auction in February 2012. We asked 36 artists to create something out of the wetsuits from 36 well known surfers. We auctioned off the art after a 3 week viewing and gave the proceeds to the Boys and Girls Club, The Santa Cruz Cancer Group and supported an athlete to raise funds for Leukemia research. We would like to have another event to support athletes, artists and local children organizations.

What We Need & What You Get

This is a donation with an existing 501(c) charitable organization. You will receive a tax form for your donation. We would like to raise 30,000 to fund another event and give proceeds back tot he community. A win win.

The Impact

Our project has already been successful in 2012. We have had many requests from our community to create an other event. We would like to take our experience from our first event and raise more, create more and show more than we did in 2012.

Other Ways You Can Help

Volunteers are always required. We had 40 volunteers for our show in 2012. Would you like to be part of a very unique fund raising event.

story:
About the show

The Marty Higgins Memorial Laff-A-Thon is a comedy/variety show framed as a memorial for an imaginary dead kid. If that sounds a little grim, you're a phony and a jackass but we need your money anyway. 

The show will feature people from Marty's life, including his Goat Scouts scoutmaster and a local pro wrestling legend turned restauranteur named Big Beef Tomato. 

In addition to these self-indulgent make-'em-ups, we'll be showcasing stand-up comics, videos by sketch groups, and musicians.

All told, this thing is going to be fucking daffy. The fourth wall will be rubble by the end of the night, and you'll be holding a sledgehammer.

Let's talk dollars okay?

Here's what it is:

  • This is a ridiculously ambitious show that's going to require a bunch of costume changes, some hired talent, and wireless microphones. That's right, wireless. Just like the Bruce Springsteen Band uses. All that stuff costs dollars.
  • Depending on the amount you donate, you'll receive a cool little perk. It's like getting stuff for free, except you pay for it first. Some of these perks, like the poster, are in limited supply. If you donate that much and we aren't able to perk you in the promised way, we'll work with you to figure out something comparable (and honestly, probably way better.)
  • We're hoping our friends and families and escaped-convicts-turned-benefactors (lookin' at you, Magwitch) are able to rally around two kids trying to make good. But we realize that this is Obama's America, and as such, no one has any money. In the event that we don't reach our goal, we'll work with whatever you can give us. But keep in mind: this show will NOT be funny at ALL if we receive even one USD less than what we asked for. And it's GOING to happen either way.

Why are you doing this? Why?

There isn't a lot of comedy in Asbury, and what comedy there IS is pretty much entirely stand-up. Stand-up is great, which is why we want to incorporate it into our show, but it's not the only way to do comedy. Sketch and improv are two other ways. Do you like the TV show Saturday Night Live? That's one example of a show that uses sketches. Do you like lying to your parents? That's improv, baby!

In the event that this show goes well (which it will if you give us money but if you don't it will be bad), we'd like to get it going as a regularly occurring show. Why is this good? Why? There are a lot of sketches and characters that we can't include in this installment of the show due to time and logistical constraints. We want those to see the light of day.

Other ways you can help

Ugh. Fine. Okay. Let's just say that hypothetically you don't have money to donate to a comedy show. Let's just pretend that's even a kind of person that exists. Here's what we'd like from you:

  • Request that Dan or Melissa give you a fat stack of fliers and hand them out in the greater Asbury area
  • Share this page with people who are richer than you
  • Steal
  • Don't steal
  • If you have any relevant skills--maybe you're handy with a mixing board--or you have any relevant equipment--maybe you have a mixing board--we'd love to get you on (mixing) board.

Come on, gang. Let's do it for Marty!


"Love,"
Dan and Melissa
