This is a ridiculously ambitious show that's going to require a bunch of costume changes, some hired talent, and wireless microphones. That's right, wireless. Just like the Bruce Springsteen Band uses. All that stuff costs dollars.
Depending on the amount you donate, you'll receive a cool little perk. It's like getting stuff for free, except you pay for it first. Some of these perks, like the poster, are in limited supply. If you donate that much and we aren't able to perk you in the promised way, we'll work with you to figure out something comparable (and honestly, probably way better.)

We're hoping our friends and families and escaped-convicts-turned-benefactors (lookin' at you, Magwitch) are able to rally around two kids trying to make good. But we realize that this is Obama's America, and as such, no one has any money. In the event that we don't reach our goal, we'll work with whatever you can give us. But keep in mind: this show will NOT be funny at ALL if we receive even one USD less than what we asked for. And it's GOING to happen either way.
Why are you doing this? Why?There isn't a lot of comedy in Asbury, and what comedy there IS is pretty much entirely stand-up. Stand-up is great, which is why we want to incorporate it into our show, but it's not the only way to do comedy. Sketch and improv are two other ways. Do you like the TV show Saturday Night Live? That's one example of a show that uses sketches. Do you like lying to your parents? That's improv, baby!In the event that this show goes well (which it will if you give us money but if you don't it will be bad), we'd like to get it going as a regularly occurring show. Why is this good? Why? There are a lot of sketches and characters that we can't include in this installment of the show due to time and logistical constraints. We want those to see the light of day.Other ways you can helpUgh. Fine. Okay. Let's just say that hypothetically you don't have money to donate to a comedy show. Let's just pretend that's even a kind of person that exists. Here's what we'd like from you:
Request that Dan or Melissa give you a fat stack of fliers and hand them out in the greater Asbury area
Share this page with people who are richer than you
Steal
Don't steal
If you have any relevant skills--maybe you're handy with a mixing board--or you have any relevant equipment--maybe you have a mixing board--we'd love to get you on (mixing) board.
Come on, gang. Let's do it for Marty!"Love,"Dan and Melissa

story:
Kurzbeschreibung

Die phantastische Installation „Metamorphosen“ von Geet Chorley ist ein lebendiges Werk, das stetig weiter entwickelt wird. Sie besteht aus meterhohen handgefertigten Metallobjekten, Licht und Farbe. Das Hauptobjekt, ein kunstvoll gestalteter Kokon in der Mitte, ist umgeben von vier riesenhaften graziösen Blumen, die in ihrer Unterschiedlichkeit die Artenvielfalt in der Natur widerspiegeln. Die romantisch-surrealistische Installation greift sowohl kunsthistorische (Romantik, Jugendstil) wie auch aktuelle Themen unserer Zeit (Ohnmacht gegen die Ausbeutung der Natur) auf und führt uns ein Schauspiel der Kräfte zwischen Mensch und Natur vor Augen, bei dem es keine Gewinner gibt.

Mit Hilfe moderner LED-Lampen wird bei der diesjährigen Luminale das Farbspektrum des Lichts erstmals in allen Zwischentönen sichtbar. Für die jeweilige Lightshow programmiert der Künstler eine jeweils neue Abfolge von Lichtsequenzen, die der Installation Leben einhauchen.

Metal, Magic, Lightshow vor der Verwandlung

Die phantastische Installation „Metamorphosen“ von Geet Robert Chorley soll zur Luminale mit LED-Lampen leuchten 

Licht ist die Quelle allen Lebens. Es bestimmt unsere Jahreszeiten, unsere Tageszeiten und hat gleichzeitig großen Anteil an unseren Stimmungen. Dennoch lässt sich das Licht als solches schwer fassen. Es ist sogar für uns Menschen unsichtbar. Nur durch Reflexion können wir einen Lichtstrahl wahrnehmen, aber eigentlich ist Licht gar nicht weiß, sondern setzt sich aus sechs Spektralfarben zusammen. Aller physikalischen Lehren zum Trotz bleibt aber die Natur des Lichts für uns Menschen zauberhaft.  

Diese zauberhafte Natur des Lichts versucht der in England geborene Metall- und Lichtkünstler Robert Geet Chorley in seiner Metall-Licht-Farb-Installation „Metamorphosen“ – Metal, Magic, Lightshow“ zu veranschaulichen und ihr auf künstlerische Weise näherzukommen. 


Die Installation und Ihr Nutzen:

Die Installation ist wie der Titel „Metamorphosen“ schon andeutet ein lebendiges Werk, das in jahrelanger künstlerischer Arbeit entstanden ist und stetig weiter entwickelt wird. Es ist eine Komposition aus übergroßen Metallobjekten und sechs gefärbten Scheinwerfern, die in je einer Spektralfarbe leuchten. Sie stellt eine Art Naturphantasie dar, die den Betrachtern das Wunder der Natur vor Augen führt. Für die jeweilige Lightshow programmiert der Künstler eine jeweils neue Abfolge von Lichtsequenzen, die der Installation Leben einhauchen. Die Lichtsequenzen können auch durch begleitende Musik rhythmisch ausgelöst werden.  

Der nächste Entwicklungsschritt des Werkes ist die Ausstattung der Installation mit sechs modernen energiebewussten LED-Lampen, die der Künstler nun anschaffen und in die Installation integrieren muss. Diese Weiterentwicklung bringt nicht allein künstlerisch neue und interessante Effekte, so sind nun die Spektralfarben alle zusammen in einer Lampe enthalten, was eine wesentlich spektakulärere Lichtschau ermöglicht. Die moderne LED-Technologie trägt auch dem Nachhaltigkeitsgedanken Rechnung, da sie sehr stromsparend arbeitet und stützt den gesamten natursymbolischen Gehalt der Installation.   

Für die Weiterentwicklung dieses phantastischen Kunstwerks, das Unternehmen und Institutionen als außergewöhnliches Highlight für jedes wichtige Event nutzen können, ist der Metallkünstler Robert Geet Chorley auf Unterstützung durch Sponsoren angewiesen. Überzeugen Sie sich im Videoclip von der phantastischen Wirkung der Installation „Metamorphosen“ und ihrer magischen Ausstrahlung, die eine Ihrer nächsten Veranstaltungen zu einem einmaligen Erlebnis machen würde. So wie die Installation bereits in der Vergangenheit der Ambiente-Messe und dem Frankfurter Museumsuferfest oder der Zeil-Galerie zu außergewöhnlicher Strahlkraft verhalf. 

Die Installation „Metamorphosen“ ist eine mietbare mobile Lightshow. Der Empfangsbereich eines Unternehmens oder einer Event-Location würde mit der Metallinstallation „Metamorphosen“ in ein phantastisches Reich aus Metall, Licht und   Farbe verwandelt werden, dessen Zauber seine Wirkung auf die Gäste nicht verfehlen würde. Helfen Sie dabei, dass dieses Märchen aus Licht und Metall sich weiterentwickeln kann und uns das Wunder der Natur künstlerisch erleben lässt. 

Ausstellung bei der Luminale:

Die Installation „Metamorphosen“ soll zur diesjährigen Luminale (vom 30. März bis zum 4. April 2014) im Rahmen der Veranstaltungen des Kunstvereins Offenbach erstmals einem breiteren Publikum in ihrer weiterentwickelten Form präsentiert werden. Das großartige Spektakel aus Metall, Licht und Farben wird an allen Abenden der Luminale im Raum des Kunstvereins am Platz der Deutschen Einheit Nummer 5 zu bewundern sein. Unterschiedliche Programmpunkte wie eine Jazz-Session, zwei Poetry Slams, eine Mode-Phantasie sowie eine fulminante Finissage machen jeden Abend im Licht dieser Installation zu einem eigenen Event und fesselnden Erlebnis. 

Mit Ihrer Hilfe kann der Künstler seine Installation auf den neusten Stand der Technik bringen, zu neuer Strahlkraft verhelfen und unserer Stadt Offenbach einen Logenplatz über die Grenzen hinaus bei der diesjährigen Luminale sichern. 

Begleitprogramm "Metamorphosen"

Geet Robert Chorley's "metal magic lightshow"
Surrealisstische Metallinstallation

Sonntag, 30.03.14  

Axel Kemper-Moll & Jessica Born in concert
Jazz mit der Blues und Soul Sängerin Jessica Born

Montag31.03.14 

Katharina Eismann, Wolf-Dieter Köster: Electric Roses 
Lyrik und Klang Performance

Dienstag 01.04.14 

Geet Chorley: Metamorphosen
Der Künstler präsentiert die metal magic lightshow im Gespräch

Mittwoch 02.04.14 

Astrid Merger: Weiße Seide
Performance: Modephantasie in Weiß

Donnerstag 03.04.14 

Ingrid Walter: Lyrik und Kurzprosa zu Metamorphosen
Lesung zu Licht und klassischer Musik

Freitag04.04.14 

StefanX: DJ ambient atmosphere 
Abschlussparty mit DJ

Zur Symbolik der Installation: 

Die phantastische Installation „Metamorphosen“ besteht aus zwei bis vier meterhohen handgefertigten Metallobjekten, Licht, Farbe und bei Bedarf Musik. Das Hauptobjekt „Atomic Genetic Mutation“ ein kunstvoll gestalteter Kokon ist umgeben von vier riesenhaften graziösen Blumen, die in ihrer Unterschiedlichkeit die Artenvielfalt in der Natur widerspiegeln. Der Kokon  stellt lichtpulsierend in den Spektralfarben die Keimzelle neuen Lebens dar. Er kann Schönes oder Schreckliches gebären, je nach menschlichem Einfluss und Handeln. Umfasst wird die Skulptur von einem Hexagon aus farbigem Lampen. Beim Eintreten in dieses zauberhafte Naturreich muss man allerdings vorbei an einem dunklen Herrscher, der das gesamte Szenario mit glühenden Augen und langem Speer bewacht. Die Skulptur „Nature fights back“ zeigt auch wie die Natur sich wehrt.  

Die romantisch-surrealistische Installation greift in ihren einzelnen Objekten und in ihren farbigen Lichtspielen sowohl kunsthistorische (Romantik, Jugendstil) wie auch aktuelle Themen unserer Zeit (Ohnmacht gegen die Ausbeutung der Natur) auf und führt uns ein Schauspiel der Kräfte zwischen Mensch und Natur vor Augen, bei dem es keine Gewinner gibt. 

Mit Hilfe moderner LED-Lampen wird das Farbspektrum des Lichts mit allen Zwischentönen sichtbar. Der Betrachter sieht das Objekt im gleißend gelben Licht eines Sommertages, im blauen Licht um Mitternacht. Die Verwandlung, die der Installation ihren Titel gegeben hat, wird auch im Spiel der Farben sichtbar.  

Der Künstler:

Der Künstler:

Der in England geborene Künstler Geet Robert Chorley lebt seit Anfang der neunziger Jahre in Offenbach Bürgel, wo er sein Atelier Bürgelwood-Studios betreibt, in dem er seine Installation „Metamorphosen – Metall, Magie, Licht“ kontinuierlich weiterentwickelt und um verschiedene Metallobjekte erweitert hat. Zuletzt entstand ein Detail zur Skulptur „Lover's Flower“. 

Geet Chorley beschäftigt sich in seiner künstlerischen Arbeit häufig mit dem Thema Natur und der Ignoranz des Menschen ihr gegenüber. Seine Objekte haben demgemäß eine ambivalente Ausstrahlung, die durch Größe und Materialbeschaffenheit einerseits bedrohlich, durch phantasievolle verspielte Formen, mit Elementen aus dem Jugendstil gleichzeitig zart und elegant wirken. 

Als Künstler realisierte er zahlreiche Ausstellungen im europäischen Ausland und in Deutschland allein und in Gruppen. Seine Metallkunst war zu sehen bei verschiedenen Messen wie beispielsweise auf der Ambiente in Frankfurt und auf dem Museumsuferfest sowie in der Zeilgalerie in Frankfurt, im Kunstbahnhof Neu-Isenburg, in der Galerie SINNTROZ, bei Spaceplace in Frankfurt und White Cube Frankfurt. Geet Robert Chorley ist außerdem Schatzmeister des Kunstvereins Offenbach e. V.

In seinem Atelier entwirft und fertigt der Künstler auch Möbel und Wohnaccessoires aus Holz und Metal, sowie Kunstobjekte, die durch ihre phantasievollen Formen einen ganz eigenen Charme verbreiten. Er ist außerdem als Lichttechniker tätig und hat viele Jahre die Bühnenbeleuchtung im Künstlerhaus Mousonturm realisiert.

Technische Details:

Maße der Installation

1. Skulptur „Atomic Genetic Mutation“ (Eisen und Pergamentpapier)

    Fuß: Hexagon-Metallplattform, Umfang ca. 2 qm, bestückt

    mit 4 Metallblumen (Höhe 3,50 Meter), Kokon aus Metallgeflecht in der Mitte der

    Installation, Top: Hexagon-Metallgerüst bestückt mit 6 Lampen, Umfang bis

    maximal 6 Meter 

    Höhe variabel: Minimal-Größe: 2,80 Meter, Maximal-Größe: 3,50 Meter   

2. Skulptur Dunkler Ritter „Nature fights back“ (Eisen)

    Höhe 2,80 Meter, Durchmesser Fuß 50 cm, Breite (Top): 1,60 Meter

3. Skulptur „Lover's Flower“ (Eisen, VA2 mit Glas): Höhe 2,70 Meter

4. Skulptur „Chaise Longue“ (Eisen und VA2): Höhe 0,80 Meter, Breite 2,10 Meter

5. Skulptur Kelchleuchte „Lover's Embryo“ (Eisen und VA2): 1,85 Meter

6. Skulptur „Book of Secrets­“ (Eisen und VA2): Höhe 1,56 Meter, Breite 1,00 Meter,

    Tiefe 0,70 Meter 

Beleuchtung durch LED-Lampen Typ Showlite PAR64 18x8W Quad LED RGBW/A im Hexagon.

Kontakt: Geet Robert Chorley, Bürgelwood-Studios, Stiftstraße 49, 63075 Offenbach am Main, Tel.: +49 (0)69 86 94 52, Mobil: 0152 219 069 58, Mail: info@chorleyart.net, www.chorleyart.net, Facebook: „Metamorphosen“ Metal Magic Light Installation.

story:
BE THE CHANGE, A Global Inside Out Project | PHOTOGRAPHY BOOK

About The Book
Be the Change, A Global Inside Out Project, presents a photography book compiling more than 1000 images capturing the BTC | IOP Action that took place simultaneously in 15 countries and 26 cities around the world on September 21st, 2012. Be the Change is the story in images of diverse communities working together, regardless of their cultural, social and racial differences, to collaborate in a global project.

The book is an archive of photographic and conceptual messages about positive Change from thousands of citizens who believe in the power of art to change the world.  Hundreds of acclaimed and amateur photographers around the world donated their time to make this project possible. The ephemeral nature of street art only allows us to record this action in the format of a book to remain not only a source of inspiration, but also a testimony of a successful experience of global volunteer work dedicated to positive Change.

Within this context, it was natural to produce the book in-house with a team of amazing volunteers!!

The book is only available for purchase through our “Indiegogo” campaign from
March 12th - May 11th!

Be The Change Project + PREVIOUS SUCCESS
Following the success of our crowd-funding campaign where we raised $18,000 to print and ship, 5,000 portrait-sized posters on recycled paper; we are now publishing this beautiful (A5) hardcover photography book to continue inspiring other communities to live by example.

The Impact
This book is important because it reminds the public that change begins from within.  Our hope it that it will make citizens aware of their responsibilities and capacity to contribute to the changing world and that together, we can make a difference and be the change. 

FEEL GREAT by Being A Giver, Tweet, Post, Shout it out!
We invite you to at least give $5 to this campaign and also we'd love to encourage you to Tweet, Facebook post, Instagram, and email this campaign to your friends and followers. That is a BIG way to help! Use the share tools right here on the site.

About Be the Change
Be the Change is a participatory art project uniting 15 countries and 26 cities around the world, which aims to visually share the stories of those who believe in change and living by example a more sustainable life, with respect for their natural and human environment.

The Inside Out Project began with a wish by TED prize winner, JR, “to turn the world inside out”. Inside Out Project is a collaboration between TED Talks & French street artist, JR, which began in March 2011. It is a global, large-scale participatory art project, driven by the purpose of transforming messages of personal identity into artistic works. Inside Out aims to give anyone and everyone a voice through his or her image. Black and white photographic portraits are pasted in the streets of cities around the world, revealing and sharing the untold stories of everyday people. More on the Inside Out Project here.

Since JR’s initial project launched, the concept grew and 15 countries around the world decided to unite and simultaneously paste 5,000 portraits in the streets of their cities to draw attention to one issue: climate change. Thus the new action ‘Inside Out Project | Be the Change’ was born.

The action was born from the realization that climate change is not just about global warming, but about the human stories that unite us as world citizens. The global concept is about bringing people together from different fields, backgrounds and interests to create a unified message, which comes directly from the people for the people. Now more than ever, we have a responsibility to share our hopes and dreams in order to inspire real change.

BE THE CHANGE is the biggest and only multi-national action within the Inside Out Project to date, with the Inside Out Group Action leaders from Athens, Greece and Juarez, Mexico coordinating the project, globally.

The 26 cities in 15 countries participating in BTC are Alamata (Ethiopia), Athens (Greece), Austin (Texas), Aveiro (Portugal), Bandung (Indonesia), Brisbane, Cairns, Melbourne, Sydney and Woodford (Australia), Casablanca (Morocco), Juarez & DF (Mexico), Lima (Peru), Madrid (Spain), Mulhouse (France), New York (NY), Nicosia (Cyprus), Santiago (Chile), Seoul (South Korea) and Tunis (Tunisia).

Check out our BE THE CHANGE Website, the BE THE CHANGE Global Facebook Page and MELD Blog to follow the project in real time!


ESPANOL

Sobre el libro
Be the Change, A Global Inside Out Project  presenta un libro de fotografía que compila más de 1000 imágenes que capturan la  Acción que ocurrió simultáneamente en 26 ciudades alrededor del mundo el 21 de septiembre de 2012. Be the Change es la historia en imágenes de las comunidades diversas que trabajaron juntas, sin importarle sus diferencias culturales, sociales y raciales, para colaborar en un proyecto global.

El libro es un archivo de mensajes fotográficos y conceptuales sobre cambio positivo de miles de ciudadanos que creen a traves en el poder del arte para cambiar el mundo.  Cienes de fotógrafos aclamados y aficionados alrededor del mundo donaron su trabajo para hacer este proyecto posible. La naturaleza efímera del arte de la calle permite solamente que nosotros registremos esta acción en el formato de un libro para seguir siendo no sólo una fuente de inspiración, pero también un testimonio de una experiencia acertada del trabajo voluntario global dedicado al cambio positivo.

Fue natural en este contexto producir el libro con un equipo de voluntaries extraordinarios .

El libro está solamente disponible para la compra con nuestra campaña de “Indiegogo”

Be the Change + ÉXITO ANTERIOR
Siguiente el éxito de nuestra campaña anterior donde levantamos $18.000 y producimos, 5.000 retratos en papel reciclado; ahora estamos publicando este libro  hermoso para continuar inspirando otras comunidades que vieven dando ejemplo.

El impacto
Este libro es importante porque recuerda al público que el cambio comienza de dentro de uno.  Nuestra esperanza es que el libro inspire a ciudadanos sobre sus responsabilidadesciviles y sus capacidades de contribuir un mundo major que podemos cambiar  juntos y marcar una verdadera diferencia.

¡SIÉNTASE GRANDE : comparta en FB, Twitter y con todas sus comunidades
Le invitamos a por lo menos dar $5 a esta campaña y también quisieramos animarle a que comparta en Facebook, Instagram, y a traves email esta campaña a sus amigos y seguidores. ¡Eso es una manera GRANDE de ayudar! ¡Puede utilizar las herramientas que se encuetran a la derecha para compartir con sus redes socials.

Sobre Be the Change
Be the Change es un proyectode arte  participatorio que une a 15 países y 26 ciudades alrededor del mundo, que apunta compartir visualmente las historias de los que crean en cambio y la vivir como ejemplo a una vida más sostenible, con el respecto por su medio ambiente natural y humano. 

El Proyecto INSIDE OUT es una iniciativa por el artista JR, ganador del premio TED 2011 y es un proyecto global de arte participativo que transforma los mensajes de identidad personal en piezas de trabajo artístico. El reto consiste en utilizar retratos fotográficos en blanco y negro para descubrir, revelar y compartir los rostros de personas e historias que no han sido contadas alrededor del mundo. Éstas imágenes digitales se envían a las oficinas centrales donde se imprimen en formato de póster y se envían a los creadores del proyecto para que las exhiban en en sus comunidades. Las imagenes pueden ser instaladas en diferentes lugares, desde una imagen en una ventana a cientos de imagenes en un edificio abandonado o un estadio Estas intervenciones serán documentadas, archivadas y estarán disponibles para ser vistas virtualmente.

Desde el proyecto inicial de JR lanzado, el concepto creció y 15 países alrededor del mundo decididieron unirse y pegar simultáneamente 5.000 retratos en las calles de sus ciudades respectivas para lanzar mensajes sobre: cambio del clima. Así el nuevo interior del `de la acción hacia fuera proyecta | Sea el cambio' fue llevado. La acción fue llevada de la realización que el cambio el cambio cliamtico; un cambiono que no solamente habla sobre el alietamiento global, pero tambien sobre las historias humanas que nos unen como ciudadanos del mundo. El concepto global trata de unir a gente de diversos campos, fondos e intereses a crear un mensaje unificado, que viene directamente de la gente para la gente. Ahora más que nunca, tenemos la responsabilidad de compartir nuestras esperanzas y sueños para inspirar un cambio verdadero.

Be the Change es el más grande y la única acción multinacional hasta la fecha, estas son las 26 ciudades y 15 paises paticiapando: Alamata (Ethiopia), Athens (Greece), Austin (Texas), Aveiro (Portugal), Bandung (Indonesia), Brisbane, Cairns, Melbourne, Sydney and Woodford (Australia), Casablanca (Morocco), Juarez & DF (Mexico), Lima (Peru), Madrid (Spain), Mulhouse (France), New York (NY), Nicosia (Cyprus), Santiago (Chile), Seoul (South Korea), Tunis (Tunisia).

Pueden obtener mas informacion sobre la accion en vivo en los siguientes sitios web: Check out our BE THE CHANGE Website , BE THE CHANGE Global Facebook Page y MELD Blog


FRANCAIS

Au sujet du livre
Be the Change, A Global Inside Out,  présente un livre de photographie compilant plus de1000 images capturant l action globale qui a eu lieu simultanément dans 26 villes autour du monde le 21 septembre 2012. Be the Change cet ouvrage compilant, en images, l'histoire des diverses communautés travaillant ensemble, indépendamment de leurs différences culturelles, sociales et raciales.

Le livre agit comme une archive de messages photographiques et textuels, sur le changement positif de milliers de citoyens qui croient en la puissance de l'art pour changer le monde. Il permet à cette action de dépasser ce caractère éphémère de l'art de la rue, et de transmettre au-delà du plaisir,  un témoignage d'une expérience collaborative mondiale réussie grâce et avec des bénévoles investis dans le changement positif. Fidèle à notre façon d'agir, le livre a été co-construit en interne, grâce à la collaboration de membres de notre communauté. 

Le livre est seulement disponible pour l'achat a travers de notre campagne « Indiegogo »

Be the Change + SUCCÈS PRÉCÉDENT
Apres le succès de notre campagne précédente où nous avons levé $18.000 pour imprimer et transporter les 5000 portraits en papier recyclable  vers leur destination respective, nous produisons maintenant un livre pour continuer à inspirer d'autres communautés à vivre en donnant d'exemple.

L’ Impact
Ce livre est important parce qu'il rappelle au public que le changement commence par soi même.  Notre espoir est qu'il permettra aux citoyens d être conscient sur leurs responsabilités civiles et leur capacité de contribuer au changement positif de ce monde: ensemble, nous pouvons marquer une différence

SENTEZ-VOUS MAITRE DU MONDE en partageant sur FB, Twitter
Nous vous invitons à donner au moins $5 à cette campagne et également nous aimerions vous encourager à partager sur Facebook, Instagram, et email et tous vos réseaux sociaux cette campagne. Utiliser les boutons sur notre page pour diffuser l information.


Au sujet de Be the Change
BTC est un projet participatoire d'art unissant 15 pays et 26 villes autour du monde, qui visent à partager visuellement les histoires de ceux qui croient au changement et à vivre en donnant l  exemple une vie plus soutenable, avec un grand respect pour leur environnement naturel et humain. 

En 2010, quand JR, le lauréat du prix TED, a annoncé son désir de bousculer le monde, en invitant des citoyens du monde entier à partager leur portrait accompagné de quelques mots sur leurs convictions, il y a eu une réponse active des grandes villes et des individus du monde entier. Face à cette réponse internationale, les leaders d’Inside Out à Athènes et Juarez ont décidé de réunir des milliers de citoyens du monde dans une action internationale nommée BE THE CHANGE.

Depuis le lancement du projet initial de JR, le concept s'est développé et 15 pays autour du monde ont décidé de s'unir et coller simultanément 5.000 portraits dans les rues de leurs villes pour focaliser sur la thématique du changement climatique et en réalisant que le changement climatique n'est pas seulement constitue par réchauffement global, mais il fait aussi reference aux histoires humaines qui nous unissent comme citoyens du monde  et qui font parties des consequences du changement climatique.  L’ensemble des citoyens a participé à la création d’une mosaïque internationale de visages, utilisant l’art comme vecteur de communication et catalyseur de changement social. Un projet crée par le peuple pour le peuple!  Le concept global a pour but de réunir des personnes de différents champs, milieux et intérêts de créer un message unifié. Maintenant plus que jamais, nous avons une responsabilité de partager nos espoirs et rêves afin d'inspirer le vrai changement.

Be the Change est le plus grand et la seule action multinationale du Inside Out Project jusqu'ici, avec les leaders des groups d'action Athènes, Grèce et Juarez, Mexique coordonnant le projet, globalement.

Les 26 villes dans 15 pays participant à BTC sontare Alamata (Ethiopia), Athens (Greece), Austin (Texas), Aveiro (Portugal), Bandung (Indonesia), Brisbane, Cairns, Melbourne, Sydney and Woodford (Australia), Casablanca (Morocco), Juarez & DF (Mexico), Lima (Peru), Madrid (Spain), Mulhouse (France), New York (NY), Nicosia (Cyprus), Santiago (Chile), Seoul (South Korea), Tunis (Tunisia).

Pour plus d´ informations en temps réel consultez nos pages: BE THE CHANGE Website , BE THE CHANGE Global Facebook Page  et  http://blog.meld.cc/

story:
Forest For The Trees is a non-profit project dedicated to the creation of contemporary public art. The project brings together local and international artists in a collaborative setting and provides them with the creative freedom and resources to create lasting works in environments that are freely accessible in the Portland community. The organization aims to improve the visual landscape of the city through quality artwork, and to provide opportunities to the creative community to participate in establishing Portland’s visual identity. Furthermore, the organization educates the public on the artwork, intent and process through workshops, panel discussions and classes.

This August, we intend to further our organization’s goals by providing new artists with more opportunities to create both murals and three-dimensional installation works in the public realm. During the week of August 24th, 30 artists will be provided the locations, equipment, materials and support necessary to realize their creative visions. In the last two years, Forest For The Trees has been behind the creation of 35 new murals in various neighborhoods around Portland, almost entirely created within two weeklong painting sessions. These murals have become landmarks that are embraced by the local community and visitors alike, contributing to Portland’s reputation as a creative cultural destination.

Artists play a powerful role in building the culture of a city, and by allowing artists to present their work in highly visible public environments we are cementing their value in our culture. Not only does this project create a local identity through the work of Portland’s art community, but also connects us to a larger global community. Visiting artists come from Australia, Austria, Brazil, Canada, Cambodia, China, Germany, Japan, Kazakhstan, Mexico, the Netherlands, New Zealand, Puerto Rico, Russia, South Africa and the UK, as well as various US cities and Native Reservations. The mixing of local and visiting artists has allowed for a greater diversity of work and sharing of ideas that enrich the Portland culture. It also broadens the exposure and opportunities for local artists to further develop their careers before a global audience, thus contributing to Portland’s stature as an international creative hub.  

This project has shown that with your support we can offer the right mix of resources and creative freedom to allow artists to impact the visual culture of Portland.

ARTIST LINEUP:

Aaron Glasson
Alex M Peterson
Andrew Hem

Blaine Fontana

Spencer Keeton Cunningham

Stella Im Hultberg

Troy Lovegates

Zach Johnsen

Zach Yarrington


What We Need & What You Get

We've set the funding goal of $10K here, but we could definitely use more to make this even bigger and better. This is a shoestring budget for the amount and scale of the artwork we produce, but costs still add up. The money goes directly towards paint, equipment, materials and permits needed to create these pieces, as well as travel and lodging. The artists and organizers are donating their time in order to bring this to life. Plus, with the help of local grants that match our funding, every dollar you give is worth twice the value.

We have some exciting new rewards we are offering, including prints from AJ Fosik, Josh Keyes and Troy Lovegates, a 10-course dinner by chef Gregory Gourdet, Artist discussion panels at PNCA and Portland Art Museum, Artist led workshops, Coava Coffee and FFTT mugs, as well as new hats and tees!

This is our third year now, and each Summer we've learned how to make a bigger impact than the last. There are many challenges, but we know how to navigate those so that they do not become risks. If we do not reach our entire goal, we will still use the money we've raised to go as far as it can to create some new amazing work in Portland. If we do reach our goals, it will be an awesome Summer :)

MERCH:


ARTIST PANEL SESSIONS:
August 29

SOUTHER SALAZAR:
Souther Salazar was born in 1978 in Hayward, CA. In the early 1990s, as a teenager in rural Oakdale, Salazar made photocopied cut-and-paste mini-comics and ‘zines. After graduating from Art Center College of Design in Pasadena, he moved to Los Angeles where he lived and worked for ten years before re-locating to Portland OR, where he is currently based. Salazar’s artwork transports the viewer into a vibrant and endless world of overlapping narratives and dreamscapes— half-remembered, half-imagined places “where stories can develop and take on a life of their own.”  Utilizing a wide variety of freely mixed media, found objects and layers of assemblage, his work evokes the wonders and imagination that many of us abandoned in childhood. Salazar often exhibits his collages, paintings, drawings and sculptures in dense and frenzied installations that encourage exploration and discovery. 

MARYANNA HOGGATT:
In 1981 I was born on a naval base in the Philippine islands. For well over a decade my family hopscotched back to the US where we finally settled in Arizona. In 2007 I managed to escape the desert before I was baked alive and chased down my art school dreams in rainy Portland, Oregon. Later I decided art school wasn’t my ticket and entered a period I like to call The Great Lull.

In 2013 I procured a tiny vial of magic potion from a creepy old witch lurking in a dark cobblestone alleyway. The cost of my soul was an exceptional bargain. After imbibing the glowing confetti colored syrup I removed the bar towel from my back pocket and quit my bartending job, running all the way home to immediately start painting. Enriched by a steady diet of youtube videos and intense research I taught myself to sculpt and made a small army of bipedal animals wearing clothes. Initially I had sought the career of an Artist because I thought it would be a great excuse to rise around noon each day, but instead I became something of a Morning Person and am now enslaved by the army I myself created.

JOHN GOURLEY:
John Gourley is an Alaskan who grew up “off the grid” whose best friends were dogs and his sketch pad.  His companions of wildlife, northern lights, silence and whatever sci-fi videotapes he could get his hands on inspired his early art and remain a consistent theme today. As a child, in Wasilla, he was prohibitively introverted; he claims that his bandmates forced the lead-singer job on him when Portugal the Man formed, in 2005. Seven records and a decade later, Gourley seems to have settled into his role. John currently lives in Portland with his girlfriend and baby daughter and stacks upon stacks of unfinished art. 

September 12

YOSKAY YAMAMOTO:
Born and raised in Toba, Japan, Yoskay Yamamoto moved to the United States at the age of 15. A self-trained illustrator, Yamamoto's artistic tastes expanded as he fell in love with the urban culture of the West coast. Yamamoto discovered a way to fuse the two different cultural backgrounds together into his work. Yamamoto nostalgically blends pop iconic characters from his new Western home with traditional and mythical Japanese elements, balancing his Asian heritage with urban pop art.

BRENDAN MONROE:Currently I live and work in Oakland, California with my wife Evah and our cat Jalapeño. Once in a while I take on illustration commissions, but most of the time I paint and sculpt for exhibitions. I think it’s important to constantly challenge oneself with new ideas and new mediums. My interpretations of the world are mostly rooted in science then executed through painting and sculpting. These are the best ways for me to communicate, but I always enjoy making other things as well.

MARY IVERSON:
“She’s climbed up the leg of a crane to research her paintings’ subjects, the perspective lines drawn with a sharp blade. A true explorer, she sets up camp in the northwestern wilderness, searching for the perfect landscape to destroy in the nearly non-fictional, post-apocalyptic story she’s telling.”

-Kristin Farr, Juxtapoz Magazine


October 17


ANDREW HEM:
Born during his parents' flight from Cambodia in the wake of the Khmer Rouge genocide, Andrew Hem grew up poised in the balance between two cultures — the rural animistic society of his Khmer ancestors, and the dynamic urban arts of the tough Los Angeles neighborhood where his family eventually came to rest. Fascinated by graffiti at an early age, he honed his skills with graphics and composition on the walls of the city before following a passion for figure drawing to a degree in illustration from Art Center College of Design. Working in gouache, oil and acrylic, he weaves atmospheric, richly textured narratives in a vivid palette of twilight blues enlivened by swaths of deep red and splashes of golden light. His haunting impressions of culture and landscape evoke the life of the spirit through the visionary manifestation of memories and dreams.

AJ FOSIK:
“Fosik’s feral creations take the shape of fantastic beings that communicate a subversive, anti-religious commentary through the depiction of hyperbolized fictional gods. Nameless, ​assigned no specific meanings or powers, beholden to no formal faith—real or contrived—Fosik’s idols are not meant to contribute to some grand theological narrative of the artist’s design. They are masterfully made beautiful objects that examine the nature of spiritual iconography through an absence of religious discourse. In this way, Fosik points to the power and scope of man’s innate creativity devoid of divine inspiration.” – Lainya Magana, ​​Hi-Fructose

JOSH KEYES:
Born in 1969 in Tacoma Washington.  Josh Keyes received his BFA in 1992 from the School of the Art Institute of Chicago and an MFA in 1998 from Yale University School of Art.  He has exhibited his work nationally and internationally and has work in private and public collections. Keyes currently lives and works in Portland Oregon with his wife and artist Lisa Ericson.

Inspired by 18th and 19th-century aesthetics and philosophy, Josh Keyes paints animals in a style reminiscent of anatomical diagrams. His work is characterized by an attention to detail and to physiological accuracy. Keyes, however, does not place his animal subjects in their natural settings; rather, they are often in peril, displaced from their natural ecosystems into dioramic fantastical situations. These landscapes are frequently isolated and contain an incompatible mix of the natural and manmade. Keyes acknowledges that themes of migration and displacement frequently feature into his work as a form of his preoccupation with global climate change and the human impact on nature. 

J.SHEA:
Born in Boston, MA and based in Porltand, OR Shea creates mixed media sculptures out of small discarded gadgets and lost cultural icons. These assembled parts are fused together with hand sculpted figures and animal forms carved out of clay and wood modeling mediums. Imbuing them with a sense of adaptability, transience and animism as they are pulled out of context, repurposed and recontextualized.

STUDIO VISITS | WORKSHOPS

AJ FOSIK:

“Fosik’s feral creations take the shape of fantastic beings that communicate a subversive, anti-religious commentary through the depiction of hyperbolized fictional gods. Nameless, ​assigned no specific meanings or powers, beholden to no formal faith—real or contrived—Fosik’s idols are not meant to contribute to some grand theological narrative of the artist’s design. They are masterfully made beautiful objects that examine the nature of spiritual iconography through an absence of religious discourse. In this way, Fosik points to the power and scope of man’s innate creativity devoid of divine inspiration.” – Lainya Magana, ​​Hi-Fructose

BLAINE FONTANA:

Blaine Fontana currently lives and works in Portland, Oregon. Imbuing his vision with the divine symbolism of religious myths, worldly folklore and current social dynamics, his works contain a kind of shamanic exploration of meaning that recognizes the totemic quality and power of the image. With extensive experience within the design world, including working as a designer for Felt Bicycles and acting art director for Zero+ Publishing, Fontana’s work displays a virtuosic understanding of sign & simulacra and their role within our contemporary visual culture. Straddling the physical and metaphysical, organic and architectural, painterly and graphic sensibilities, Fontana fuses multiple visual strategies to forge an aesthetic language entirely of his own making.

Blaine Fontana received his BFA in Communication Art/Design from Otis College of Art and Design in Los Angeles, CA in 2002. He was awarded “Best in Show” for his senior thesis project, and is one of only seven distinguished alumni from 2000-2010. He is currently an Advisory Board member for the Northwest College of Art.

PRINTS

"Duality" by Gage Hamilton

Troy Lovegates

AJ Fosik

Other Ways You Can Help

There are a lot of people that are aware of the many murals we have been behind over the last few years, but they might not know where they come from since we don't put signage with branding or websites on the artwork or pay for advertising. That has been a conscious choice and we feel it is the right one. That means word of mouth is really essential in funding this project, so please oh please share this with your friends!
story_txt:
Forest For The Trees is a non-profit project dedicated to the creation of contemporary public art. The project brings together local and international artists in a collaborative setting and provides them with the creative freedom and resources to create lasting works in environments that are freely accessible in the Portland community. The organization aims to improve the visual landscape of the city through quality artwork, and to provide opportunities to the creative community to participate in establishing Portland’s visual identity. Furthermore, the organization educates the public on the artwork, intent and process through workshops, panel discussions and classes.
This August, we intend to further our organization’s goals by providing new artists with more opportunities to create both murals and three-dimensional installation works in the public realm. During the week of August 24th, 30 artists will be provided the locations, equipment, materials and support necessary to realize their creative visions. In the last two years, Forest For The Trees has been behind the creation of 35 new murals in various neighborhoods around Portland, almost entirely created within two weeklong painting sessions. These murals have become landmarks that are embraced by the local community and visitors alike, contributing to Portland’s reputation as a creative cultural destination.
Artists play a powerful role in building the culture of a city, and by allowing artists to present their work in highly visible public environments we are cementing their value in our culture. Not only does this project create a local identity through the work of Portland’s art community, but also connects us to a larger global community. Visiting artists come from Australia, Austria, Brazil, Canada, Cambodia, China, Germany, Japan, Kazakhstan, Mexico, the Netherlands, New Zealand, Puerto Rico, Russia, South Africa and the UK, as well as various US cities and Native Reservations. The mixing of local and visiting artists has allowed for a greater diversity of work and sharing of ideas that enrich the Portland culture. It also broadens the exposure and opportunities for local artists to further develop their careers before a global audience, thus contributing to Portland’s stature as an international creative hub.  
This project has shown that with your support we can offer the right mix of resources and creative freedom to allow artists to impact the visual culture of Portland.

This is a shoestring budget for the amount and scale of the artwork we produce, but costs still add up. The money goes directly towards paint, equipment, materials and permits needed to create these pieces, as well as travel and lodging. The artists and organizers are donating their time in order to bring this to life. Plus, with the help of local grants that match our funding, every dollar you give is worth twice the value.
We have some exciting new rewards we are offering, including prints from AJ Fosik, Josh Keyes and Troy Lovegates, a 10-course dinner by chef Gregory Gourdet, Artist discussion panels at PNCA and Portland Art Museum, Artist led workshops, Coava Coffee and FFTT mugs, as well as new hats and tees!
This is our third year now, and each Summer we've learned how to make a bigger impact than the last. There are many challenges, but we know how to navigate those so that they do not become risks. If we do not reach our entire goal, we will still use the money we've raised to go as far as it can to create some new amazing work in Portland. If we do reach our goals, it will be an awesome Summer :)

story:
THE ARTIST 

My name is Kiri Østergaard Leonard. I'm a Danish illustrator who grew up in the small country village of Boeslum. While still living in Denmark, I attended The Academy of Fine Arts in Arhus, before I left my home country behind to continue my studies at the Pratt Institute in New York. I currently reside in New York City along with my husband Alexander Leonard (and our two cats), where I work as a freelance illustrator.

I enjoy working on projects that range from children’s books and fantasy illustration, to realistic portraiture. I draw upon inspiration from my own childhood, along with nature, mythology, folklore, and fairy tales, my artwork tends to take on an imaginative and whimsical feeling, full of color and with occasional modern elements.

Even more so I enjoy sharing my artwork with the world and that's what this campaign is about!

THE CAMPAIGN

RAW: Natural born Artists (http://www.rawartists.org/) recently invited me to participate in their October Showcase in Brooklyn on Oct. 20th, 2013. The showcase is a single night event in Brooklyn, NY where a selection of artists have the opportunity to showcase and sell their work without RAW taking any commission of the sales.

RAW is a independent arts organization, for artists, by artists, who encourage the creative success of the many visionaries and storytellers of our generation.

 

THE IMPACT & FUNDING NEEDS

Part of what makes art so valuable and so full of impact is its ability to speak to, and be experienced by a variety of people across all walks of life and even time. 

The RAW initiative is funded by ticket sales, so for artists to participate they have to commit to selling 20 tickets to the show and that's where you come in. By supporting this campaign you are making it possible for me to participate in the show. 

WHY $500?

To be in the show I have to sell 20 tickets or raise $300 in sponsorship, the remaining $200 will go towards framing for the artwork that'll be in the show.

WHAT'S IN IT FOR THE ARTIST?

RAW artists do not only get to join the showcase. They are also promoted on the RAW website, they receive a set of professional photos and a video with an interview to use for press releases after the show and also the opportunity to exhibit in one other US city later on.

THE PERKS


$1

Much love, every little bit helps! You are awesome, thank you for your support.

$5

A digital wallpaper.


$10 - The postcard

$15 - You're on the guest list!

Your name is on the guest list to see the RAW: Natural Born Artists showcase: ENCOMPASS

The event takes place 10/20/2013 at 74 Wythe Avenue, Brooklyn.


$15 - The Limited Edition Print:

Montague Mouse and the great Acorn Escape. (8.5"x11")

$ 50 - Digital Portrait

A digital bust portrait of a person of your choice. Here's an example of one I did last year.

$100 - Original Drawing

An original 8"x10" pencil drawing just for you. Subject will be determined by the artist. Here's an example of what to expect:

$250 - Full color digital illustration

Full color digital illustration: Subject is entirely up to you! Includes a Giclée print of your illustration. Here's an example:


Please tweet, share, post, shout it out!

Lastly I'd really love to encourage you to share this campaign with your friends and followers. It'll help out immensely and I'd deeply appreciate it if you would. You can use the share tools right here on the site.


Thank you for your time and consideration!

story:
What we're up to:

We believe diplomacy shouldn’t just be left up to politicians. Artists are cultural and social changemakers and we are passionate about creating more opportunities for artists to bring a broader cultural understanding into their work.

Over 30 artist residency programs that give artists time and space to create work in China, but thousands of creatives don't have a way to connect with these opportunities.

Our solution is China Residencies, a 501(c)3 non-profit and website. Our mission is to: 

Why we need your help:

To make our project a reality, we need your donations to:

  • design and develop the website
  • cover the fees from registering as a 501c3 non-profit 
    (yes, that means your donations are tax deductible in the US!) 
  • conduct a research trip to Beijing, Shanghai, Kunming, Lijiang, Shenzhen and Hong Kong to document and discover some of the best programs
  • film and edit videos and interviews about artist residencies in China

How you can support us:

Please give generously and help us spread the word to artists you think could benefit from the tools we are building! We know money is tight for artists these days, you can also help us out with tweets, shares and introductions! Every little thing helps. 

We're offering some great rewards (take a look to your right), including fine art prints from past artists in residence in China:

story:
Hello!

I'm an independent artist and graphic novelist, currently earning a bachelor's degree in Mathematics and funding my schooling with my artwork. As my college life becomes more and more demanding, I have a greater need for portable art tools and my laptop isn't cutting it so well anymore. Unfortunately, I'm having trouble raising the money for new tools on my own. What I want is a Yiynova Tablet Monitor, a device that would allow me to work directly onto the screen. The Yiynova isn't as expensive as the more famous Wacom Cintiq, but it's still not something I can afford.

 

That's where you come in.

What I Need & What You Get

This project will raise exactly the cost of the tablet plus shipping to the US. See for yourself. In return, you will receive custom artwork made with my spiffy new tablet. You can see examples of my artwork at: http://cassiethomas.deviantart.com or http://theworldisyours.smackjeeves.com

I have previously published two graphic novels that were funded via Kickstarter. You can see them here and here. Several backers were so pleased with the rewards they received that they funded both campaigns. Crowdfunding has worked well for me in the past and I'm hoping it can help me out again.

Anything I receive over the funding goal will go towards any new programs I may need to use the new device to its fullest potential, or towards my other business expenses. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to pledge, please share this campaign! Every little bit helps.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Stephanie Piña, I am a chair member of The Liberal Arts Council at The University of Texas at Austin. I am a third year Government and International Relations student. Below is our proposition and our goal.

The Liberal Arts Council, the official student voice of the Liberal Arts students at the University of Texas at Austin, has pledged efforts for the Spring 2013 semester to raising money for a local Austin charity. The charity we have chosen is Casa Marianella, and emergency sherlter for recent adult immigratns to the United States. Casa provides housing and food for up to 35 immigrants, English classes, and a shelter for women and children escaping violent situations, among others. This charity is very worthy and in need of your support so that the Austin area may provide more support for recent immigrants, helping them acess resources and education. Casa Marianella's website is: http://www.casamarianella.org/

This year, my committee, Campus and Community Focus, along with our council (LAC) has decided to take on the philantrophic initiative of fundraising for a local charity in Austin, TX. As a council we voted and decided it would be of most fitting to fundraise for Casa Marianella. Casa Marianella is an emergency homeless shelter that has served recently-arrived men and women immigrants, seekers for asylum for over 26 years in the East Austin area. This organization means much for Liberal Arts Council. We have faculty who serve on their board, we have members who have volunteered for Casa Marianella, and we really value and appreciate the work Casa has done for the Austin community. 

Raising this amount of money won't only help Casa Marianella, but it will also silence our challengers. Besides challenging ourselves to raise $5,000 we have a few Council members who have challenged my committee by proposing to shave their heads, go complete bald if my council, succeeds in funding this amount of money. These individuals are three council members who decided to make our initiative a bit interesting and we simply cannot lose, the satisfaction from seeing them go bald will be pretty amazing to all of council. But more so, because we were able to cross the finish line, reach our goal, and prove the skeptics wrong. We need your help! 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $5,000. This money will be fully donated to Casa Marianella. We wish to have this amount by the end of the school semester where we will then introduce Casa Marianella with a big fat check that will help them provide the individuals they aid with food, blankets, extra clothing, shoes, and for all other miscellaneous activities for which they need funding.

The Impact

This project is valuable to council in so many different ways and its extremely valuable to me and those who have volunteered in the past and those who have worked for Casa Marianella. It's near to our hearts and we would appreciate any dollar to be donated to us.

I can be reached at stephanie.pina@utexas.edu if you are interested in helping us in any other way.

Other Ways You Can Help

We kindly ask you let your friends and family members know what the Liberal Arts Council is doing to help Casa Marianella. Any amount of monetary donation would be much appreciated. If you are unable to donate through our online platform and would prefer to submit a check, please contact us at utexaslac@gmail.com.
Casa Marianella also accepts donatins of cloting and househols items, which can be dropped off at their location:
821 Gunter St.
Austin, TX 78702

Thank you for your time!

Hook 'Em!

story:
Where They're Going

How many of us know in the depths of our being that Jennifer McAfee is gonna make it to the big screen?

I sure do, and I'm guessing if you're here, you do too.

Jenney's been acting for God knows how long, but without the encouragement of her ultimately supporting husband, Noah, it's not likely she'd be making the life-altering leap toward stardom. 

Having been settled in Chico, CA for years, Jenney and Noah Herbold's network of friends and family is the backbone to their blissful, joy-filled lives.

But passion is a funny thing.

While comfort and security, as well as support and community, create the platform for a satisfying and pleasurable existence, they can't be enough for someone whose conduit for fulfilling her sense of purpose dwells miles away, in a far-off land known as Los Angeles.

As Noah recognized that Jenney's goals were larger than what Chico could offer, Jenney too had this bittersweet epiphany. 

Together, it became apparent that life was about to drastically change. And together, they've taken step after step toward realizing what is now an equally shared dream. 

Piece by piece things have fallen into place, almost as if the Universe is intentionally collaborating with their efforts to get Jennifer McAfee on the big screen. 

Now, it's our turn to help.

Contributing to assisting the Herbolds make their move to Long Beach does so much more than merely get them from point A to point B—it supports the dreams and future reality of this amazing family's journey toward living a life full of passion and purpose, risk and adventure, and ultimately, unbounded joy. 

What They Need (And What You Get!)

The family of four—Jenney, Noah, Tori, and Jeffery—are moving. They're going. They're already gone. But not quite. 

These incredible people need help paying for the move. U-hauls, gas, food, and animal accommodations add up, and it's going to take a pretty penny to get them to realize their dream. 

The thing is, this tightly-knit friend-family they have here in Chico got together and cooked up a plan to help them on their way. This plan includes a donation from you. And in turn, you will receive a nifty gift for your generous contribution. 

Ever wanna take a body shot off one of those fine Herbold specimens? Or perhaps receive a signed 8 x 10 black and white photo of Jennifer McAfee sealed with a kiss? Maybe you're more practical and have seen those snazzy CHICO CHICA tank tops floating around the internet and have been dying to get your hands on one. Or maybe it's a credit with Artwork by Caitlin Schwerin that tickles your fancy? (Many of these perks can be redeemed directly at the farewell party on Saturday, June 29th.)

Of course, whatever this campaign receives in donations will directly benefit the move of the Herbold family. Anything and everything goes to them. So you can be sure that your contribution will fund the path that ultimately lands Jennifer McAfee in line with her dream, and the family in line with their new, exciting lives in Los Angeles. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If offering even $5 is just too much for you at this point there are still plenty of ways you can help:

Have stuff you want to get rid of? Bring it to the fundraising Yard Sale on Saturday, June 29 from 8 a.m. to 1 p.m. All profits go toward helping the Herbolds move. 

By using the Indiegogo share tools you can get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. But remember to use your indoor voices, as this undercover mission isn't to be revealed until the good-bye party on the night of Sat., June 29th. After that, use those digital lungs to scream and shout!

story:
Here we are!

Trust me is a magazine about visual art.
Any Issue concerns a word, a symbol, a number, an image.
They could seem very abstract topics, but they can suggest reflections around art, culture, society, they can be the starting point for memories, stories, artworks.
Trust me, it’s a magazine for graphic designers, photographs, artists, illustrators and more.
The result of every issue is a monographic work with extremely heterogeneous media and contents.
Contributors are different every time. Trust me exists only thanks to free and spontaneous cooperation of the people who want to be part of this project.



How do we do?

As editorial staff, we usually contact young artists, involving them in a free collaboration, but we often consider also many spontaneous submissions. For now we’ve published works from more than 1000 artists from the four corner of the world. TMM is present on many social networks, which carry additional content, enriching and deepening the magazine itself.
The strength of trust me is to give equal visibility to different artistic realities, to bring together many different points of view of people who otherwise would never meet.
For now, Trust Me is a small project, but due to its simplicity and strong connectivity is expanding rapidly, overcoming territorial, linguistic and cultural boundaries. For that reason we are planning to introduce in the next issues different topics stronger related to social, documentaristic and environmental issues, that can stimulate a more complex conversation among contributors.
The next goals of the magazine are: the print publication, the distribution in specific sites as gallery and bookshops and the development of a stranger and more interactive web platforms.



The Impact

Money raised through Indiegogo will go directly to building the infrastructure of the magazine to make it a sustainable venture. All the funds goal will directly allow us to set up an advertising/accounting department, purchase relevant software and supplies, and cover printing costs. This may not sound sexy, but this is the backbone we need to expand the creativity and reach of the magazine.

The Project

Trust me #5 will be about BREAD.
During the past two years this magazine is leavened like a dough left next to the oven: new people, new ideas, new topics. So let’s celebrate one of the most basic foods in the world.
What is bread? At its simplest it is merely a paste of flour or meal and water cooked over or surrounded by heat. Bread is a great source of energy. The dough is soft and unformed, which anyone can give the shape he wants.
It is widely believed that the domestication and cultivation of wheat and other grains directly influenced human transition from nomadic people to domesticated, stationary people.
Bread is a foodstuff of great historical and contemporary importance, in many cultures bread has a significance beyond mere nutrition. The Roman poet Juvenal satirised superficial politicians and the public as caring only for "panem et circenses" (bread and circuses). In Israel the most usual phrase in work-related demonstrations is "lekhem, avoda" (bread, work). In Cockney rhyming slang, bread means money.
The cultural importance of bread goes beyond slang to serve as a metaphor for basic necessities and living conditions in general. In India, life's basic necessities are often referred to as "roti, kapra aur makan" (bread, cloth and house). Since bread has this significance of necessity, we ask  to our contributors to report what is their daily bread.

Why should I fund you?

To move Trust Me Mag forward, editors and contributors will continue to scour the globe for individuals, organizations, and regions buzzing with enterprising spirit. But to do this, we need…money!!

Thus far, Trust Me Magazine has been produced on a shoestring. We wanted to prove we could produce something from nothing before moving forward. Thus far we hustled some money together, worked lots of late nights. But, with a little financial backing, we can take this progress leaps and bounds forwards.

The next issue, for wich we are asking your help, will be "The Bread issue".

Our dads always told us that we must not trifle with food. Certainly for most of us, bread is a good at our fingertips but not for everybody. So we want to support the important projects of FAO about food. We will devolve the 10% of the proceeds to these initiatives : https://getinvolved-donate.fao.org/supporter/donationforms.do?n=F6@5Cs

Should I keep funding you after you meet your goal?

Yes! Any money above that will go towards other much needed areas of expansion. This includes researching and writing grants, distributing issues to partners in the developing world, building out our new website, expanding our outreach, increasing our editorial staff.

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out about our campaign, share our facebook profile, if you are an artist show us your stuff, if you have a nice bookshop and you like our project write us, we could make a deal!

story:
The â€œDivination of 2012,â€ the fifth installment of artist-augur Lynn Nessethâ€™s â€˜Divination Series,â€™ is a conceptual artwork collaborating the psychic and photographic craft of thirteen artists.  This piece was channeled through inspiration for Black Mountain College Museum's event the 2012 {RE}HAPPENING.  Nesseth and the appointed twelve artists, pictured below, are using consecrated single-shot disposable â€œFortune Camerasâ€ as mediums for evidencing prophetic images of their lives.  The pictures now being taken will be laid into spreads; each individual photograph acting as a card with its own fortune.  Twelve pairs of two compose each roll of 24 exposures, signifying binary aspects of the twelve Astrological Signs.  Each photograph is contextualized into a realm of the artistâ€™s life by its placement into its corresponding Astrological House, or life field, based on the artistâ€™s time of birth.  Adherent to American â€œpop-ritualâ€, each fortune will be tagged with phrases relative to aspects of each House via â€œin bedâ€ or â€œin my unions.â€

 

In essence, the spread provides a reading of each individual artistâ€™s Natal Birth Chart; the first pair of photographs corresponding with the artistâ€™s Ascendant or Rising Sign.  The spread was divined by Nesseth while walking in the forest carrying a single-shot disposable camera under a sun in Scorpio, a moon transitioning from Pisces into Aries at 2:02pm conjunct Uranus and the influence of divinatory psychotropics.  In this divined system, the unknown is harnessed through the artistsâ€™ intuitive choices for content and composition within their imagery.  The most revealing indication of meaning will be foremost the artistsâ€™ feelings and intuitive impressions when regarding a given subject within the spread.  The entire collection of images from all twelve rolls of film will be installed within a grand binary configuration of the spreads.  Adjunct to the installation, archetypal portraits are being taken of the inspired twelve.  Each artist will be gifted an album containing and documenting their personal divinatory reading.

   

More on the Lynn Nesseth:

http://www.themap.org/lynn/

http://flabmag.com/visual-musical-literary-arts/conceptual-artist-lynn-nesseth/

 

More on the Twelve Collaborating Artists:

 

Harper Leich

http://harperleich.wordpress.com/2012/03/07/photographers-and-mystics/ 

 

Mignon Petrini

http://www.facebook.com/?ref=tn_tnmn#!/pages/Mignon-Petrini-Photography/109291892463850

 

Sarah Catherine Golden

http://www.facebook.com/#!/pages/Fat-Guy-Photography/299498760111659

 

 Lindsay Bostic

http://www.flickr.com/photos/avlpanicchic/

 

 Jack Ramshaw

http://www.anywhereusathemovie.com/blog2.html

http://refractconjecture.blogspot.com/

 

Meredith Aphieme

 

Hope McCartney

 

Alyssa Kieffer

 

Eva Weinmann

 

Crystal Rose Nyerick

 

Laura Jensen

 

Ellen Furiss

 

 

 

The Give and Take

If the entire goal is not reached any contribution money will go to developing the divination rolls. If the film cannot be developed the piece will not show; there is no other source for funding of this piece. The rest of the contribution money will pay for the reimbursement of purchases made: cameras, albums, plastic sheet protectors, costumes. The complete budget in detail follows:

 

  • 16 â€œFortune Camerasâ€ from Urban Outfitters have been purchased for this piece: 12 for the collaborating artists and 4 for the Mediatrix; 3 for documentation and 1 as the original divination camera: (16) $12.81= $204.96

  • Iris Photo, of Asheville, is providing a 10% discount for development; doubles and a high resolution CD for each camera, with the discount, is $23.44(16)= $375.04

  • For each collaborator to be gifted an album of their individual divination  reading: 16 S.E.I brand 4x6 â€œpreservation albumâ€ have been purchased at wholesale: (16)$1.99=$31.84  http://www.shopsei.com/main.cfm?heading=0&categoryoid=26
  • 400 extra plastic sheet protectors have been purchased from S.E.I wholesale to complete each album plus hold the installation of 336 photographs: (40)$0.99= $39.60 (plus shipping: $16.98)

  • Estimated budget for Archetypal Portraits costuming and make-up ~$12/artist: $144

  • Estimated cost for installation materials: $30  

 

 

Incentives

  • $6 level: One 4x6 print chosen at random from the entire collection

  • $12 level: One 4x6 print of the Artist-Augur (Artistâ€™s Choice)

  • $24 level: One pair of 4x6 prints from the Archetypal Portraits (Your Request)

  • $48 level: One pair of 4x6 prints from the Twelve readings (Your Request)

  • $96 level: Two pairs of 4x6 prints from the â€œDivination of 2012â€ collection (Your Request)

 

 

 

 

Special Enticement Incentive Offer:$202 level

 

â€œDivination of 2012â€Limited Edition Personal Reading Set

 

There will only be twelve of these Sets available.  Purchase of a set will require your contracted agreement to share the property rights with Lynn Nesseth.  By agreeing you are a co-creator of the â€œDivination of 2012â€ and will be subject to disclose duplicates of the Divination Roll film from your Limited Edition Personal Reading Set and share the contents of your notation journal with the Artist at any time when she may contact you.  The Personal Reading Set will be made available within one month after full payment and signature of agreement are received. 

 

Limited Edition Personal Reading Set Contents:

One Divination Camera, One Notation Journal, One Preservation Album, Divinatory Reading Sheets for Album Organization, Seven Golden Star Stickers, Page of Instructions, Fortune Cookie

 

One Limited Edition Personal Reading Set will be gifted to the Black Mountain College Museum Archive.

 

 

 

 

Special Thanks to Kelly Lee Phipps

(for teaching me about the houses) 

http://www.divineinspirationastrology.com/ 

http://www.kellyleephipps.com/astrology.htm

 

 

 

Contribution Alternatives

 

You can help this campaign by sharing it with your friends!!!!!

 

 

 

http://rehappening.com/

 

 

 

 

 

THANK YOU TO MY SPONSOR!

 http://www.shopsei.com/

 

 

 

 

Thank you to Iris Photo and Digital Imaging for giving me 10% off develpoment

http://www.irisphotodigital.net/about.html

 

 

This art work exists to make record for man-kind and marks the new age of timeless presence. Our co-creative powers, in relation to each other, and in relation to the unseen and as yet unknown, are beyond limit. When human consciousness invites communication in open receptivity within this paradigm the answering reciprocity is palpable. In this case our documentation holds as evidence. Here, now, the dream, the vision, the image (the photograph), is co-created and codified through the conscious mind and the imaginal world instigated by the waking senses. Whereas in our dreams our subconscious chooses the content of our prophetic imagery, in 2012 and hereafter, we awakened choose our vision.

~Lynn Nesseth

 

 

 

 "Awake.  Shake dreams from your hair my pretty child my sweet one; choose the day and choose the Sign of the day, the day's divinity: first thing you see"   

~Jim Morrison

 

"It's a new day, and it's a new time; it's a new feeling, it's a new Sign: oh what a new day."  

 ~Bob Marley
story_txt:
The â€œDivination of 2012,â€ the fifth installment
of artist-augur Lynn Nessethâ€™s â€˜Divination Series,â€™ is a conceptual artwork
collaborating the psychic and photographic craft of thirteen artists.  This piece was channeled through inspiration for Black Mountain College Museum's event the 2012 {RE}HAPPENING.  Nesseth and the appointed twelve artists, pictured
below, are using consecrated single-shot disposable â€œFortune Camerasâ€ as
mediums for evidencing prophetic images of their lives.  The pictures now being taken will be laid
into spreads; each individual photograph acting as a card with its own fortune.  Twelve pairs of two compose each roll of 24
exposures, signifying binary aspects of the twelve Astrological Signs.  Each photograph is contextualized into a
realm of the artistâ€™s life by its placement into its corresponding Astrological
House, or life field, based on the artistâ€™s time of birth.  Adherent to American â€œpop-ritualâ€, each
fortune will be tagged with phrases relative to aspects of each House via â€œin
bedâ€ or â€œin my unions.â€ 


 

In essence, the spread provides a reading of
each individual artistâ€™s Natal Birth Chart; the first pair of photographs corresponding
with the artistâ€™s Ascendant or Rising Sign.  The spread was divined by Nesseth while walking
in the forest carrying a single-shot disposable camera under a sun in Scorpio,
a moon transitioning from Pisces into Aries at 2:02pm conjunct Uranus and the
influence of divinatory psychotropics.  In this divined system, the unknown is
harnessed through the artistsâ€™ intuitive choices for content and composition
within their imagery.  The most revealing
indication of meaning will be foremost the artistsâ€™ feelings and intuitive
impressions when regarding a given subject within the spread.  The entire collection of images from all
twelve rolls of film will be installed within a grand binary configuration of
the spreads.  Adjunct to the
installation, archetypal portraits are being taken of the inspired twelve.  Each artist will be gifted an album
containing and documenting their personal divinatory reading. 

   More on the Lynn Nesseth:http://www.themap.org/lynn/http://flabmag.com/visual-musical-literary-arts/conceptual-artist-lynn-nesseth/ More on the Twelve Collaborating Artists: Harper Leich
http://harperleich.wordpress.com/2012/03/07/photographers-and-mystics/ 
 
Mignon Petrini
http://www.facebook.com/?ref=tn_tnmn#!/pages/Mignon-Petrini-Photography/109291892463850 Sarah Catherine Goldenhttp://www.facebook.com/#!/pages/Fat-Guy-Photography/299498760111659  Lindsay Bostichttp://www.flickr.com/photos/avlpanicchic/  Jack Ramshawhttp://www.anywhereusathemovie.com/blog2.htmlhttp://refractconjecture.blogspot.com/ Meredith Aphieme
 
Hope McCartney
 
Alyssa Kieffer
 
Eva Weinmann
 
Crystal Rose Nyerick
 
Laura Jensen
 
Ellen Furiss
 
 
 
The Give and Take
If the entire goal is not reached any contribution money will go to developing the divination rolls.  If the film cannot be developed the piece will not show; there is no other source for funding of this piece.  The rest of the contribution money will pay for the reimbursement of purchases made: cameras, albums, plastic sheet protectors, costumes.  The complete budget in detail follows:
 




16 â€œFortune Camerasâ€ from Urban Outfitters
     have been purchased for this piece: 12 for the collaborating artists and 4
     for the Mediatrix; 3 for documentation and 1 as the original divination camera:
     (16) $12.81= $204.96

Iris Photo, of Asheville, is providing
     a 10% discount for development; doubles and a high resolution CD for each
     camera, with the discount, is $23.44(16)= $375.04 

For each collaborator to be
     gifted an album of their individual divination  reading: 16 S.E.I brand 4x6
     â€œpreservation albumâ€ have been purchased at wholesale: (16)$1.99=$31.84  http://www.shopsei.com/main.cfm?heading=0&categoryoid=26

400 extra plastic sheet
     protectors have been purchased from S.E.I wholesale to complete each album
     plus hold the installation of 336 photographs: (40)$0.99= $39.60 (plus
     shipping: $16.98)

Estimated budget for Archetypal
     Portraits costuming and make-up ~$12/artist: $144 

Estimated cost for installation materials: $30  

 




 
Incentives



 $6  level:  One 4x6 print chosen at random from the     entire collection
$12  level: One 4x6 print of the Artist-Augur (Artistâ€™s Choice)
$24  level: One pair of  4x6 prints from the     Archetypal Portraits (Your Request)
$48  level: One pair of 4x6 prints from the Twelve readings (Your Request)
$96  level: Two pairs of 4x6 prints from     the â€œDivination of 2012â€ collection (Your Request)


 
 
 
 
 
Special Enticement Incentive Offer:$202 level
 
â€œDivination of 2012â€Limited Edition Personal Reading Set
 


There will only be twelve of these Sets
available.  Purchase of a set will require
your contracted agreement to share the property rights with Lynn Nesseth.  By agreeing you are a co-creator of the
â€œDivination of 2012â€ and will be subject to disclose duplicates of the
Divination Roll film from your Limited Edition Personal Reading Set and share
the contents of your notation journal with the Artist at any time when she may
contact you.  The Personal Reading Set
will be made available within one month after full payment and signature of
agreement are received.  

 
 
Limited Edition Personal Reading Set Contents:
 
One Divination Camera, One Notation Journal, One Preservation Album, Divinatory Reading Sheets for Album Organization, Seven Golden Star Stickers, Page of Instructions, Fortune Cookie

 
One Limited Edition Personal Reading Set will be gifted to the Black Mountain College Museum Archive.
 
 
 
 Special Thanks to Kelly Lee Phipps
(for teaching me about the houses) 
http://www.divineinspirationastrology.com/ 
http://www.kellyleephipps.com/astrology.htm
 
 
 
Contribution Alternatives
 
You can help this campaign by sharing it with your friends!!!!! 
 
 
http://rehappening.com/
 
 
 
  THANK YOU TO MY SPONSOR! http://www.shopsei.com/
 
 
 
 
Thank you to Iris Photo and Digital Imaging for giving me 10% off develpoment
http://www.irisphotodigital.net/about.html

story: Hey guys, I'm Ashley Lockhart, aka Radiant Estelle and I recently discovered the wonderful world of Burlesque. After having body issues with my weight for almost 25 years, Burlesque taught me to love who I am. Not only did I have issues with just my weight, but being a Type I Diabetic always makes life more difficult: scars don't heal until about 2-3 years after you get them, I'm constantly attached to a purple thing called my insulin pump, and simply put, people typically just don't understand what we have to go through. I am starting this campaign so that I can become a better burlesque performer and can continue to love myself more and more each day. I truly want to take this workshop so that I can work on my stage presence and character so that I can continue to perform for many years to come. Burlesque is one of the absolute best things to happen to me and I hope you'll support me in my endeavors!
