story:
About the Project

atlas soccer is part of atlas, a collection of images taken from newspapers and gathered from 1990 to 2010 and later filed by subject. The material, exclusively in paper format, was found by chance and collected without a particular reason other than the compulsive attraction to the photographic image. It was only later, in the filing process, that it has found its current form, a sort of map of the author's obsessions.
atlas soccer is different from other, more uniform, collections in that inside the soccer world there are an infinite series of sub-categories that can be traced back to the actions and gestures taking place on the 90 minutes of the match. This chain of gestures opens to wider reflections on performance and production. Every gesture goes beyond its primary nature of spontaneous action and into the hybrid territory of representation. Soccer players, modern heroes relentlessly followed by camera lenses, give vent to their narration in a chain of poses that find their outlet in the image itself, displaying forms dripping with erotism and involuntary history of art. The match becomes synonym with the world; its gestures being its subjective variant.
———
atlas soccer fa parte di atlas, collezione d'immagini archiviate per soggetto, ritagliate da giornali dal 1990 al 2010. Tutto il materiale esclusivamente cartaceo è stato trovato casualmente e raccolto senza un motivo particolare se non il desiderio compulsivo per l'immagine fotografica. Solo successivamente archiviandolo ha trovato la sua forma attuale, una sorta di mappatura delle ossessioni dell'autore.
atlas soccer  si differenzia dalle altre raccolte, tendenzialmente più omogenee, poiché all'interno del “mondo” calcio esistono una serie infinita di sotto-soggetti rintracciabili, nelle azioni e nei gesti sviluppati nei novanta minuti di gioco. Questo concatenarsi di gesti apre ad una serie di riflessione più ampia che riguarda la performance e la messa in scena: ogni gesto deborda dalla sua natura primaria di elemento spontaneo sconfinando nel territorio ibrido della rappresentazione. I calciatori, eroi moderni seguiti incessantemente dagli obbiettivi, danno sfogo alla loro narrazione in un concatenarsi di pose che nell'immagine trovano la loro cifra, mostrando forme intrise di erotismo e storia dell'arte involontaria. La partita diventa sinonimo di mondo e la gestualità la sua variante soggettiva.

Football “is” a language with its writers of poetry and prose by Pier Paolo Pasolini, first published in “Il giorno”, January 3, 1971 / l’articolo di Pier Paolo Pasolini, "il calcio «è» un linguaggio con i suoi poeti e prosatori", pubblicato sul quotidiano Il Giorno del 3 gennaio 1971 e presente in atlas soccer 

— 
cover / copertina: offset printing, stampa offset
pages / pagine: 208 - risograph printing,  stampa risograph
size / dimensioni: 180 x 265 mm 
print run / tiratura: 300 copies
ISBN 978-88-99058-10-4 
year / anno 2016 
—

About the Artist

Marco Mazzoni, choreographer, performer and visual artist, is a founding member of Kinkaleri, a collective of artists involved in performing arts since 1996. In addition to the work done with the group, he has developed his own research into the visual arts and in 2013 he founded mazoopub, an independent editorial project that publishes a number of periodical fanzines.
———
Marco Mazzoni, coreografo, performer e artista visivo, è membro fondatore di Kinkaleri, collettivo di artisti che dal 1996 si occupa di arti della scena, parallelamente al lavoro del gruppo ha sviluppato una propria ricerca personale nelle arti visive, nel 2013 fonda mazoopub progetto editoriale indipendente pubblicando una serie di fanzine ad uscita periodica. 

mazoo.it
mazoopub.tumblr.com
kinkaleri.it

About the Publisher

bruno is a Venice-based publishing house and graphic design studio initiated in 2013 by Andrea Codolo and Giacomo Covacich. Concurrently with its activity as publisher, bruno works in editorial consulting, graphic design, art direction mostly for art and design projects. In addition, bruno functions as a space for book presentations and exhibitions.
———
bruno è una casa editrice e uno studio di grafica con base a Venezia, fondato nel  2013 da Andrea Codolo e Giacomo Covacich. Oltre all'attività editoriale bruno si occupa di consulenze, design grafico, direzione creativa principalmente per progetti di arte e design. bruno è anche un bookstore e uno spazio espositivo.

b-r-u-n-o.it
 

translations / traduzioni Luca Camilletti, Sonia Torretta
we would like to thank / si ringrazia Giuseppe Gulizia, Kinkaleri, Monica Maggio, Mariapaola Pierini, Alberto Salvatori

story:
Hello Everyone! Thank you for taking the time to learn about my project!

  • My name is Danielle Gonzalez and my Dream is to be a character designer and/ or storyboard artist at an animation company 
  • I will be visiting the Creative Talent Network Expo this year where I will be having my portfolio reviewed! I would love to present a professional looking  sketch book to all the possible employers! 
  • I am a full time student at the moment learning all the possible avenues I can take in the animation industry! So funding this alone is a bit difficult for me. With your precious help, I will be able to put together some of my best work in a bound book to present at the portfolio review! 


What I Need & What You Get

  • The amount I am asking for is based on a price calculator where I will be getting my books printed. I would like to make 60 -70 books TOTAL. MAYBE more!
  • I will be having perks for Certain amount Donations! I will be doing original sketches, prints, and sending a few sketch books out! 
  • If for some reason I don't reach my goal the funds will still contributed to making the sketch books! You would still receive any perks you claimed, so don't hesitate to contribute :)

  • No matter what you contribute on this campaign, i want you to know that i'm very honored that you decided i was worth your support. Thank you!

The Impact

  • This project could help me to obtain a job in the animation industry! as well as helping spread my work and name. This has been a dream of mine and Im just realizing I cant do it alone. =)


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please share !! Thank you too much

story:
Apollo VII – XVII: A collection of photographs taken by NASA’s Apollo program astronauts 1968 – 1972

 

NASA’s Apollo program astronauts are more often hailed for being some of the world’s greatest explorers, adventurers, pilots and scientists, but rarely are they portrayed as some of the world’s most important photographers.

‘Apollo VII – XVII: A collection of photographs taken by NASA’s Apollo program astronauts 1968 – 1972’ is a photography book that revisits the iconic images taken by the astronauts of NASA’s Apollo program between 1968 and 1972.

The book is introduced with an essay written by Apollo 7 astronaut Walt Cunningham, sharing his memories and stories on early space exploration photography from the Apollo program.

Photography has become a crucial technique for documenting the history of mankind. The early exploration of space is one such historical event, unrivalled among humanity’s achievements. Fortunately, the skill and daring of a very particular group of ‘photographers’, the Apollo astronauts, were able to bring back beautiful, moving and instantly recognizable images. It is these images that created a new understanding to what it means to be human, living on this planet and its relation to the sun and the stars.

This book presents 225 of these photographs in large print format. Bringing them to life and restoring the color from the original scans of 70mm film the astronauts shot during their missions. An additional chapter at the back of the book gives background information on the photographic equipment and the training and technique the astronauts undertook in order to create these beautiful images using modified Hasselblad 70mm film cameras they were given to use on board.

 

Product details

  • Hardcover: 320 pages
  • Publisher: JDFS (November 15, 2016)
  • Language: English
  • ISBN-13: 978-90-825982-0-9
  • Product Dimensions: 11.8 x 11.8 x 1.5 inches (30 x 30 x 3.8 cm)

 

 

William Anders: Oh my God! Look at that picture over there! There's the Earth coming up. Wow, is that pretty. 

Frank Borman: Hey, don't take that, it's not scheduled. (joking) 

William Anders: (laughs) You got a color film, Jim? Hand me that roll of color quick, would you... 

Jim Lovell: Oh man, that's great! 

 


 

 

 

 

 

Get involved

This project was successfully funded via the Kickstarter platform but we would like to offer the book at a special pre-order price on Indiegogo. This is to put more funding into the book so we can make this project even bigger than we have achieved so far. The goal is to create a real community around the book, to bring people together not just to contribute with funding the printing costs. We would love people to put forward suggestions that we can put in the book. Additional Apollo stories, information or any special insights that you guys might have. Any special artefacts or mementos from that time. Or perhaps you might know someone, or even are someone, who worked on the program. We want to make this book as special as it can be, and we truly believe that with building this community, we will together be able to pull off something exceptional.
 

 

Who are we?

We are small team of four friends and colleagues working at a creative agency in Amsterdam. Our team consists of Floris, Simon, Joel and Delano. Our backgrounds are in Graphic Design and Art Direction.

 

 

 

Floris was born in Amsterdam but his love for space travel started as he spent his childhood summers in Florida growing up near the Kennedy Space Center. 

Joel and Delano are both keen photographers who have been collecting and researching NASA missions over the years. 

Simon originates from the UK. His love of books and publishing has led him to create a number of projects, one book in particular was funded through a Kickstarter campaign which saw his Origin of Species Variorum Edition being placed in the London Natural History Museum next to some of Darwin’s original books.

 

The timeline
 

 

April – August 2016 – We will start putting together the book and finalising the research for the first chapter explaining the camera and astronaut training. During this time we will be seeking any additional permissions and image rights if needed and will meticulously prepare each photograph and colour grade each image for printing. We will also use this time to explore further opportunities with new insights, interviews and any other contributions for the book.

September 2016 – We will start to prepare the book for press.

October 2016 – The book goes to print

November 2016 – Worldwide shipping starts

December 2016 – Everyone to receive their book

 

 

Risks and challenges

There are always risks and challenges with such an ambitious project as this. However, within our small team we have the necessary expertise and skills to produce this book to the very highest standards. Our international team consists of creatives and graphic designers that work together at an agency where we produce books and edit photographs all the time.

We can also draw a lot of learnings from one of the team members previous crowdfunding projects (https://goo.gl/EC6GVh) where we learnt the ins and outs of publishing and shipping the book worldwide.

We have set ourselves a comfortable timeframe to produce the book in order to make sure the project isn’t rushed and is given the time and attention that it needs. This will hopefully allow us to maintain our proposed shipping date. We will use tried & trusted shipping methods to send the book and also adequately protect the book with a custom made shipping carton to make sure you receive the book in perfect order.

We would love people to put forward suggestions that we can put in the book. Additional Apollo stories, information or any special insights that you guys might have. Any special artefacts or mementos from that time. Or perhaps you might know someone, or even are someone, who worked on the program. We want to make this book as special as it can be, and we truly believe that with building this community, we will together be able to pull off something exceptional.

 






 Why Indiegogo InDemand? Kickstarter has been a great platform for us to realise a project and bring it to life. However with additional help and support during the production process we feel we can make the book grow even bigger. Investing more into extra special features and to also offer the book at a special pre-order price for those that missed the opportunity to back us first time round. The team behind this project strongly believes in the power of crowdfunding, and how it allows us to really create a book that people want. It gives us full control of all aspects of the book production, which means we can reduce costs and invest the funding straight into the quality of the book. But we also want to create a community. A place where people put forward suggestions that we can put in the book. Additional Apollo stories, information or any special insights that you guys might have. Any special artefacts or mementos from that time. Or perhaps you might know someone, or even are someone, who worked on the program. 
Who are we?
We are small team of four friends and colleagues working at a creative agency in Amsterdam. Our team consists of Floris, Simon, Joel and Delano. Our backgrounds are in Graphic Design and Art Direction.
 
 
 
Floris was born in Amsterdam but his love for space travel started as he spent his childhood summers in Florida growing up near the Kennedy Space Center. 
Joel and Delano are both keen photographers who have been collecting and researching NASA missions over the years. 
Simon originates from the UK. His love of books and publishing has led him to create a number of projects, one book in particular was funded through a Kickstarter campaign which saw his Origin of Species Variorum Edition being placed in the London Natural History Museum next to some of Darwin’s original books.
 
The timeline 
 
April – August 2016 – We will start putting together the book and finalising the research for the first chapter explaining the camera and astronaut training. During this time we will be seeking any additional permissions and image rights if needed and will meticulously prepare each photograph and colour grade each image for printing. We will also use this time to explore further opportunities with new insights, interviews and any other contributions for the book.
September 2016 – We will start to prepare the book for press.
October 2016 – The book goes to print
November 2016 – Worldwide shipping starts
December 2016 – Everyone to receive their book
 




 


Risks and challenges
There are always risks and challenges with such an ambitious project as this. However, within our small team we have the necessary expertise and skills to produce this book to the very highest standards. Our international team consists of creatives and graphic designers that work together at an agency where we produce books and edit photographs all the time.
We can also draw a lot of learnings from one of the team members previous crowdfunding projects (https://goo.gl/EC6GVh) where we learnt the ins and outs of publishing and shipping the book worldwide.
We have set ourselves a comfortable timeframe to produce the book in order to make sure the project isn’t rushed and is given the time and attention that it needs. This will hopefully allow us to maintain our proposed shipping date. We will use tried & trusted shipping methods to send the book and also adequately protect the book with a custom made shipping carton to make sure you receive the book in perfect order.

story:
Short Summary

Those of you with a knowledge of underground and cult horror movies will recognise names such as Jorg Buttgereit who I have worked extensively with, most recently writing and illustrating the first official sequal to his movies nekromantik and nekromantik 2.

I have worked with large distribution companies such as Arrow video and Blacklava, created art for huge underground break out movies like Found, Headless, Flowers and Lung and created pieces for the likes of Marian Dora. 

In short I've had the absolute pleasure to have worked for and alongside some of who I consider the most daring and envelope pushing creatives of our time.

What We Need & What You Get

The great thing about this project is that the work is already done and out there,this is purely a presale platform to fund printing and shipping costs.

Over the years I have been asked if I would sell prints etc of the work I produced and until now I have avoided it, but what better way I thought of getting it into peoples hands than a collected album of some of my best and better known pieces.

This will be a limited run, so each copy will be hand signed and numbered.. dependant on  how many sell during this campaign

There will be a choice of a trade 8/10 hardback or soft cover issue to suit budget, introductions by Jorg Buttgereit, Scott Schirmer and Phil Stevens.. where the original work was produced in full colour, that glorious bloody colour will be reprinted here.. also on offer will be a few of my original pieces.

    The Impact

    In the great tradition of Movie cover art books this works as a snapshot in time, a nostalgic look back at when cover art was paramount to impulse viewers to check out a movie or project.. unlike the mainstream movie market the underground scene is very small and very loyal and much of this work ( other than the arrow video pieces) is only seen by a hand few of us.

    This is not merely a vanity project on my part, I want this book to capture this time when the indie movement ballooned and beautiful art was produced ( and sadly some unproduced!) by an under appreciated few.

    At the very least this book is for us... hopefully down the line someone else will be curious enough to pick it up and take a glimpse into this sick, twisted, beautiful, passionate world of indie underground horror.

      Risks & Challenges

      The work is done, the mock up complete.. this is a very low risk venture

        Other Ways You Can Help

        If you cannot afford to contribute, not all of us can, the best way to help would be by sharing, spreading the word.

story:
Our Story

Hi our names are Vaan Manoukian and Lana Sokoloff  and we are painters from Los Angeles, California

We have both received an honorable invitation to exhibit at the Biennale in the historical Fortezza da Basso in Florence, Italy this December.

The Impact

The Biennale is the most prestigious art exposition in the world, and is recognized by the  United Nations as an official partner in their program“Dialogue Among Civilizations”. Invitations are limited and given specifically to artists around the world to represent their country with different ethnic, linguistic and religious traditions.

 

 Artists at the exhibition will compete on behalf of their nation for the ‘Lorenzo the Magnificent” career prize, which is one of the most prestigious honors in the world, a prize that was previously bestowed on world-renowned artists such as David Hokney.

So as you can imagine, it is a huge honor and responsibility to be asked to participate as an ambassador for the United States. But it’s also very expensive.

 

What We Need 

Entrance fees alone cost $4,500 dollars per artist, plus, when you factor in roundtrip airfare $1,200, hotels and travelling expenses like hotel around $150 a day and food, all these  really start to add up. Which is why we’ve turned to indiegogo for help. We’re reaching out to you to help us raise our goal of $16,000 to send the two of us to represent America in the exposition and compete for the award. We only have 60 days to reach our goal, so every little bit you give will help us on our way to achieving this dream.

 

What You Get

 

We’ve created a number of rewards for anyone who donates to our cause, such as postcards and signed limited edition prints from both Lana and Vaan.  Those who contribute over 1,000 will be listed as a sponsor in the Beniale catalogue.

 

 Other Ways You Can Help

We hope you take the time to look at our rewards and give to what we think, is a really great cause. This is truly a once in a lifetime opportunity that is not to be missed, so any and all contributions, big and small, are greatly appreciated. Thank-you from the bottom of our hearts.

story:
Short Summary

f/8 consists of eight senior University of Central Florida Bachelor of Science in Photography students. This is our graduating semester and we are creating an exhibition at Gallery 500 in downtown Orlando on April 20th, 2013.

Without proper funding, we will be unable to produce the graduation exhibition we've been steadily working towards for the past four years (and plus some!).

With your help, we will be able to conduct the most accomplished exhibition this side of Central Florida.

Meet the eight of us!

 

Benjamin Hayward

Benjamin Hayward is a conceptual photographer focusing on the world around him. He has been a part of many group exhibitions, such as the Snap! Orlando student event, In Our Hands, Projections/Reflections, First Friday Art Show, and more. Also, Hayward is a member of the Student Photography Association and has attended a workshop with Lauren Henkin.

 

Karly Scheuerman

Karly Scheuerman is very excited to be graduating this spring with her Bachelor's in Photography. Scheuerman has exhibited work at the Southeast Museum of Photography and Gallery 202 in Daytona Beach, as well as the Tallahassee Community College Fine Art Gallery, where she also participated in an international art exchange exhibition with Bosnia. Her photography has been published in the Tallahassee Democrat and the Daytona State student literary magazine, Aeolus. Scheuerman has both volunteered with and attended multiple conventions with the Society for Photographic Education, and is the current vice president of UCF's Student Photography Association. She has participated in photography workshops with Lauren Henkin and Keliy Anderson-Staley, and the Florida Professional Photographers. 

 

Amy Wuertz

Amy Wuertz is a mad woman with a camera, with a love for pop culture and rock concerts. She has been published in the Daytona Beach News Journal, and her work has been recognized by a variety of international bands. With her degree, she hopes to focus on concert photography and band portraiture.

 

Amanda Rollins

Amanda Rollins is a photographer hailing from Palm Coast, Florida. She thrives on the quirky and when she isn't obsessing over Harry Potter, she is looking for comical situations in her daily life. Her work can be seen on display at the J.M. Goddard Center in Daytona Beach, and has been featured in the juried exhibitions Portraiture 2011 and Illustration 2012.

 

Katie Altvater

Katie Altvater has covered local sporting events for the Daytona Times, and has photographed for other sports photographers in the area. She has worked as a photographic assisstant to local photographer Greg Keller of the Frame and Photo Works in Daytona Beach. Altvater has shown work in juried exhibitions Portraiture 2011 and Illustration 2012 in Gallery 202, as well as the UCF Healing Arts exhibition. She also volunteered at and attended the Society for Photographic Education Southeast regional conference and is treasurer of the UCF Student Photography Association.

 

Nicole Calvin

Nicole Calvin is a central Florida photographer who specializes in portraiture. She has assisted established photographer Brook Pifer, and has been featured in the Easter Seals exhibition Faces of Ability. 

 

Wren Brock McLeland

Wren Brock McLelland is photographer, decorator, cheerleader, and organizer. She serves as president of the UCF Student Photography Association and director of the f/8 group. McLelland assisted Professor Steven Benson in organizing the Society of Photographic Education Southeast regional conference in the fall of 2012. She also received a scholarship from the Orlando Camera Club. As a member of the OCC, she has been invited to jury photo competitions. McLelland has attended multiple workshops, including Photoshop World 2010, Florida Professional Photographer's School in 2010 and 2011, and the Keliy Anderson-Staley workshop in 2012.

 

Brittany Fournier

Brittany Fournier is the photo editor of In Motion, the Daytona State College newspaper, and is a freelance photographer for Orlando Magazine. She has participated in a variety of exhibitions: Cell-f Absorbed and Reflections/Projections in Gallery 202 and In Our Hands at Sweet Marlay's in Daytona Beach. Juried shows include Portraiture 2011 and Illustration 2012. Fournier has attended the College Media Association regional conference in Orlando and national conference in New York City, as well as the Society for Photographic Education Southeast regional conference in Daytona Beach. She has also participated in workshops with Amanda Sosa-Stone, Bernard Brzezinski, and Lauren Henkin.

 

What We Need

Your contributions will primarily aid us in funding promotional printed materials- most importantly, our exhibition catalog. Funding will also help us afford the materials needed to physically hang the exhibition. 

If we don't meet our goal, we will redistribute the funds to the above necessities equally, with the same ideas in mind. Aside from Indiegogo, we're also conducting fundraising activities such as photo booths in our local communities. 

The Impact

For most of us in f/8 this is the first full exhibition production, and for others- the first public exhibition. Your contributions will help us seize this oppurtunity.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford a contribution, spread the word!

Share our facebook fan page!

http://www.facebook.com/f8exhibition

or

Share this Indiegogo page!

http://www.indiegogo.com/f8/

story:
Short Summary

My name is Chris Walstad.  I’m a 24-year-old fine-art photographer with a passion for the world.  I’ve been doing photography professionally for 7 years.  In the future, I plan to take my talents into a community college classroom, and share my passion for photography with the youth of tomorrow. My community college photography professor changed how I see the world, and ultimately changed my life.

      

In 2010, I had the privilege to travel across the Pacific Ocean to Okinawa, Japan.  I stayed abroad for a little less than 3 months; it was one of the most revealing experiences of my life.  In the two years since my return, my soul has longed for Asia. And the photographic opportunities that still await me there. Up until a few months ago I had almost written off my dream of traveling the Far East.  But when a few friends offered to be traveling partners, it re-kindled the fire inside my heart. As our departure in January draws closer, and the plans begin to solidify, the only stumbling block in my way is money. I’ve set a goal to get 100, forty-dollar donations, if I reach my goal that leaves me with $3,720.  These donations will not only help me with the expenses of the trip, but they will promote art, and allow our team to fulfill a longtime dream.

 

 

The Impact

The trip will last for 100 days; the team and I will start in Hanoi and head south, zigzaging through Vietnam and Laos.  We will end our southward journey in Ho Chi Minh City, and then shift gears heading north through Cambodia. Eventually we aim to end up in Thailand.  From here we will head south into Malaysia and ultimately the Indonesian Islands.  The entire journey will be traveled either by rail, bus, boat, or on foot.  We long to move as the natives do, to intermingle with the people of the region.  It is said that you cannot truly understand someone unless you’ve walked a mile in their shoes, we plan to seek out understanding.  This will not be a lavish trip with rated hotels or swanky restaurants; it will be an artistic adventure from the cheap seats.

 

      

It is my dream to travel, and create photographs that evoke real human emotion.  I want to connect people with a world they may never see in person, and put a dent in human ignorance.  I am a disciple of light, and a wanderer trying to capture it.  I am an advocate to young artists and their aspirations.  Today’s youth is our future, and I believe it would be folly to overlook art, simply based on the age of the artist.

 

     

Throughout the trip the team will carry cameras and/or journals to document our experiences.  After we return home, we will be putting together a book of our words and our photographs. The book will explore a region riddled with ancient cultures influenced by modern day ideals.  It will be dedicated to discovering the people of South East Asia, by seeking out their culture through photography.  This is a trip meant to document the travelers, the experiences, and the people we meet along the way; it is to be a trip of disclosure. I want to share our relationships with as many people as possible.  The ones we have, and the ones we have yet to encounter.  Thank you so much for your donations, prayers, and well wishes. Godspeed.  

 

What We Need

If I am fortunate enough to reach my goal of $4,000 in donations, after the service fees, I will be left with $3,720 to fund the adventure, and offset printing and shipping costs for donator perks.

Airfare will cost about $1,100.00

Perks will cost me around $500.00 (This is my best guess)

After a subtracting $1,600 from $3,720, I will be left with $2,120, which equates to $21.20 a day for the duration of the trip.

If I don’t reach my goal the money will go towards the airfare first, and then I will attempt to finance the rest of the trip myself.

What You Get

$1.00 - Donations of $1.00 are as welcome as any, everything helps towards our goal.  Every $1.00 donation will receive a thank you on the official Chris Walstad Photography Facebook page.

$10.00 - Every $10.00 donation will receive a signed, special edition thank you post card from my photography portfolio.

$25.00 - Every $25.00 donation will receive a signed limited edition 4x6 print from my Japanese portfolio available on Flickr.com

$40.00 - Every $40.00 donation will receive a signed limited edition 5x7 print from my Japanese portfolio available on Flickr.com, and your name will be printed on the donations page of our special edition book.

$50.00 - Every $50.00 donation will receive a signed limited edition 5X7 print from my Japanese portfolio available on Flickr.com, and your name will be printed on the donations page of our special edition book.

$100.00 - Every $100.00 donation will receive a signed copy of our special edition book in the 7x7 soft cover format, and your name will be printed on the donations page of our book.

$150.00 - Every $150.00 donation will receive a signed copy of our special edition book in the 7x7 hard cover format, and your name will be printed on the donations page of our book.

$250.00 - Every $250.00 donation will receive a signed copy of our special edition book in the large 12X12 hard cover format, and your name will be printed on the donations page of our book.

$500.00 - Every $500.00 donation will not only receive a signed copy of our special edition book in the large 12X12 hard cover format, with your name printed on the donations page of our book, but you also receive a Limited edition archival 11X14 framed and matted print of your choosing from my portfolio available at flickr.com

$1,000.00 - Every $1,000.00 donation will not only receive a signed copy of our special edition book in the large 12X12 hard cover format, with your name printed on the donations page, but you also receive a limited edition, signed 36X48 gichlee of your choosing from my portfolio available at flickr.com

*** All Prints will be signed with a date and print number.

        

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to support our adventure with a financial contribution, but still feel moved by our dream, there are plenty of ways that you can help.  Please, please, please, share this link and information about our project with your friends, family, and co-workers.  Post on your Facebook, Myspace, Twitter, and any other social network you are apart of.  Help us get the word out.  Everything helps.  Thank you so much for supporting the dream of young art.

$10.00 - Every $10.00 donation will receive a signed, special edition thank you post card from my photography portfolio.
$25.00 - Every $25.00 donation will receive a signed limited edition 4x6 print from my Japanese portfolio available on Flickr.com
$40.00 - Every $40.00 donation will receive a signed limited edition 5x7 print from my Japanese portfolio available on Flickr.com, and your name will be printed on the donations page of our special edition book.
$50.00 - Every $50.00 donation will receive a signed limited edition 5X7 print from my Japanese portfolio available on Flickr.com, and your name will be printed on the donations page of our special edition book.
$100.00 - Every $100.00 donation will receive a signed copy of our special edition book in the 7x7 soft cover format, and your name will be printed on the donations page of our book.
$150.00 - Every $150.00 donation will receive a signed copy of our special edition book in the 7x7 hard cover format, and your name will be printed on the donations page of our book.
$250.00 - Every $250.00 donation will receive a signed copy of our special edition book in the large 12X12 hard cover format, and your name will be printed on the donations page of our book.
$500.00 - Every $500.00 donation will not only receive a signed copy of our special edition book in the large 12X12 hard cover format, with your name printed on the donations page of our book, but you also receive a Limited edition archival 11X14 framed and matted print of your choosing from my portfolio available at flickr.com
$1,000.00 - Every $1,000.00 donation will not only receive a signed copy of our special edition book in the large 12X12 hard cover format, with your name printed on the donations page, but you also receive a limited edition, signed 36X48 gichlee of your choosing from my portfolio available at flickr.com
*** All Prints will be signed with a date and print number.
        
Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to support our adventure with a financial contribution, but still feel moved by our dream, there are plenty of ways that you can help.  Please, please, please, share this link and information about our project with your friends, family, and co-workers.  Post on your Facebook, Myspace, Twitter, and any other social network you are apart of.  Help us get the word out.  Everything helps.  Thank you so much for supporting the dream of young art.

story:
Peace and love beautiful beings! My name is Charlie X!

I am a dancer, truth seeker, prenatal yoga instructor, yogi, spoken word poet, political activist, black liberator activist. I am a member of a Black Womyn's artist collective called The Moth Maiden Collective. We embrace things Afro-centric, queer, creative and liberated.

One of the collective members Assa is from Senegal and several collective members are planning to visit there this summer. In Senegal we will be going to a town called Thies. We are black liberators so going back to the land where all magic and creativity stemmed from is a quaint sensation. I would love for this trip to Africa and economic liberation to be more than a really dope colorful comic in my mind. I want it to be real. This campaign is to cover my passport, plane ticket, and my current economic liberation. If you have any questions ask, ask and ask! Share this far and wide with love! I love you for it. I give light to you in advance.

story:
Eat Pray Like -

Two girls, one journey. Life refracted.

 

About Sylvia and Juliet

Our names are Juliet Rothman and Sylvia Hölscher, we come from Sweden but hail from a multi-cultural upbringing. Spending much of our childhood and early adolescence in the far-flung corners of the globe, we finally ended up back home, Sweden, except we didn't know it as our home. Then slowly, the years passed, we went to school and learned to live what is commonly referred to here as, the "Svensson" life.

So here we are thinking, we got it all figured out! But in actuality, do we? We started asking ourselves now that we have come to that point in our lives where one chooses their personal place and path: What happens next? We began searching and realize that with all of our wandering around and finally finding home, there is still a void inside us, a longing to understand and to find out. Hence we have decided to venture out into the unknown!

We are both artistically inclined, not just in the way we like to make things beautiful but want to discover the world through our art. (We assure you our art is better than our writing skills!). Heres a little somethin something! Past art exhibition at Cybergymnasiet in Odenplan of some of our various art work and photography. 

                                  

While thinking, discussing and planning we thought even though this is our inner journey it might be somewhat empty and limited if we were to discover it on our own. 

We want to experience and partake of the lives of others not only appreciating their art, culture and cuisine but interact and listen to them and then; share their story to the world, you.

 

And here is how we are going to do it!

We will be documenting our entire journey through constant documentation such as videoing, photographs and interviews of the various people we will be meeting along our world journey and stream it live on our Facebook page for all to see and then share it through television (Swedish svt1), exhibitions, schools and seminars.

 

And here is what we are going to do!

Broadcast all the various people we meet whom will include, for example,
the experiences of a 20 year old Masai in Masai Mara, What are his dreams and what is his impression of the world? The Tibetan family, how do they spend their day, what are their traditions and cuisine? The 18 year old at the refugee camp in Nairobi, who lost his parents while raising his brothers and sisters. How would he tell his story?

 

Our Project!

Throughout our journey we will also be visiting youth centers, orphanages, refugee camps and creche where we will personally hold art classes with the children, photograph, video film and interview their stories.

Our ambition at the end of our journey is to hold exhibitions and seminars with photographs approximately 84x55 cm of the children, written interviews of their stories along with their art in Schools, The Stockholm Culture House and Art Fair. Our eventual plan with these exhibitions is to raise money for them by auctioning their artwork.

 

On The Road

Some of the places we will be visiting and documenting will include, spending a day and night with the Masai's in one of their 1000 tribes, meditating at the Buddha temple, experiencing rush hour in India. And we already have invitations from : Refugee camp in Nairobi, youth organizations 'Change the World', 'Siembamba creche' in Sir Lowry's Pass Village in South Africa and the center for underprivileged children in Bangkok,Thailand where our art project will take place.

On the 13th of December we will be leaving the comforts of our home in Stockholm, Sweden to Qatar then Kenya and passing through Rwanda while heading for South Africa, landing in Johannesburg and traveling down the coast heading west arriving in Cape Town. In February we will travel through India up to Tibet and from there venture out into Vietnam, Indonesia and Thailand and finally, in June, returning back home to Sweden.

 

With Your Support...

We would be honored to receive your donation. Every contribution helps! Each penny goes a long way, and that penny might be just what we need for a live streaming interview of an advanced philosophical discussion with a dedicated Tibetan!

 

What We Need & What You Get

At the moment all we have is an old laptop from 2007, which doesn't fulfill its purpose. Juliet's camera was recently stolen. And we have never had the honor of owning a video camera!

  • Laptop - For storage, compilation, live streaming and broadcasting our journey straight to you!
  • Camera - To capture life's moments in one frame. For live streaming and exhibition use.
  • Videocamera - The largest insight for the people, a story with a voice. Will be used for interviews and documentation. (Plus a mic, clearly..)
  • Tickets - We already have enough for around 2/3 of the tickets! But lets be honest, the more money we get the more tickets we can purchase and the more places we are able to visit the more projects we are able to do.
  • Art Material - Art material for our far out art lessons with the kiddos! Shipment - Ship the children's art back to our storage in Sweden, pilling it up for our exclusive exhibition!
  • Exhibition - To fund an exhibition of photographs approximately 84x55 cm of the children along with their art and stories at "Kulturhuset" and "Fotomässan" in Stockholm once our journey is complete. Which in turn will serve as advertisement for their arts' auctioning.
  • Visas - Not to get deported :)
  • Vaccines - Against death!

 

Your support and help means the world to us, you can see where your money goes by following our journey on our page www.facebook.com/eatpray like
From our dizzying highs to our disillusioning lows, partaking of this smorgasbord called life.
Thank you thank you thank you for your generosity and looking through our page and hope you follow us on our journey,  which will be officially launched on the 13th of December...but you can like it today already if you want so you don't forget :)

story:
There has been a mix-up the past few weeks with contributions so make sure you make it all the way to the last page (bottom right)  before leaving. Otherwise your contribution will not be successful.

The Why? - Why are we doing this?

Haiti was hit with a catastrophic 7.0 magnitude earthquake in January of 2010. Journey Community Church has been in relationship with a community in Carrefour Haiti since May of 2010. We have seen an abundance of artistic talent in our San Diego community, and we see immense skill in the people of Haiti.

Our Vision

 Utilizing the gifts and talents we have seen in our community to bring hope and offer opportunity to our family in Haiti. In doing so, we desire to align all included with their dignity and identity as an artist. We see this as a rare opportunity to show our partner community how much we believe in them, to create a feeling of empowerment, and to introduce further freedom of expression. Our hope is to take advantage of the lack of garbage system in Haiti as means for potential supplies.

The Who? - Who are we? Who are they?

We are a group of passionate people who have fallen in love with the people of Haiti. We are artists (in one way or another). We are: Dani-Jo, Marina, Tiffany, and Summer, as well as 7 others from San Diego, California.

The Haitian artists that we will include in our time will be decided by the man Journey first made contact with in 2010. Pastor Edouard. He has the best understanding of the talents surrounding him as well as financial situations of the families of Carrefour, Haiti.

The What? - What We Need & What You Get

To cover all of the costs we need roughly $20,000. I'll break it down for you.

Plane Tickets - Along with the four of us, we are taking 7 more artists from the San Diego area to Haiti with us.

Living Expenses - We will be eating rice and beans everyday, staying in a house with sporadic electricity, no hot water, and cots as beds; we are cutting living expenses to a minimum.

Transators - They do not speak English in Haiti

Transportation - We will have to take local Tap-taps (taxi trucks) and busses to buy supplies and such.

Supplies/Microloans - Not only do we need to buy initial supplies to work with and manipulate while we are there, we also need funding for microloans for those who have proven able to continue a business.

The more we get the more we can supply them. Any extra funds would go towards the haitian people in a number of ways: trips to/funding for medical clinics, rice and beans to many different communities, and any further needs we witness as we are down there ie - shoes, underwear, toothbrushes, etc. We will give every last penny to the Haitian people.

Even if you cannot contribute, spreading the word is dire for us to meet our goal. We are going to tell people as best as we can, but we need your help to reach people we wouldn't have been able to before!

story:
Hey there :

My name is Phoenix Storm, and I am an alternative model of 6 years from Norwich, UK.

I am on Suicide Girls, and I am also an Ultravixens girl too :)

http://phoenixstormmodel.wix.com/portfolio

I am on a mission to embark on a Tattoo tour around East Anglia, to raise money for charity and advertise local artists.

The new ink will also be advertised in my job too as I will be able to show them off while doing my shoots.

I have local media ready to follow our journey, and I have magazines ready to print and advertise the new ink. Now all I need is your help to raise the funds to start my journey!

For every donation, i will send you something from me to you as a special thank you for helping me on my way :)

Lets do it for the charity (Addenbrooke's paediatric Intensive Care Unit), and for all of the amazing undiscovered talent we have so close.

Thanks in advance lovelies,

Phoenix Storm :) x x

story:
Our Story

Fat Foot Films started with making a horror/comedy about humping zombies called "Mourning Wood".  During the production we made a promotional calendar called "Looks that Kill" for 2009 to help raise funds and grow awareness for the small Massachusetts based production company.  The 2009 calendar had an extremely short deadline and we only had 3 months to create, print and then sell it.  Even with time against us, we were still able to make it a success. 


This past October 2010, "Mourning Wood" premiered to a sold out crowd of over 300 people.  In January 2011 we came out with our second film, drama/romance "Joy and the Apocalypse" which went straight to TV.  All of our projects have been done with nothing more than a deep love for what we do and donating our own personal funds.  We are currently trudging full speed ahead on the newest Fat Foot Films creation, the “Looks that Kill” 2012 Calendar. This time around, we have more experience and better knowledge for creating the visions in our heads, and producing to you this amazing product.

 

Where's It Going and Who It'll Affect

Fat Foot Films wants to show you the beauty of horror, with gorgeous empowering females thrown into the macabre world of horror. The majority of funds raised will be dispersed to the printing process, which is the most expensive part of this project.  The more funds that you all help us raise, the higher quality calendar we can provide to you as supporters and fans. We would also like to thank and give back to all of the people who made this project happen-the models, photographers, make-up artists, set designers and editors.  They volunteered their time and energy, having no personal agenda but to help us bring this artistic collaboration to life, and we would like to promote and help them reach their dreams as well.

 


Help spread the word of our campaign and share us!


fatfootfilms.com

facebook.com/fatfootfilms

twitter.com/fatfootfilms

youtube.com/fatfootfilms

story:
About My Campaign

My name is Miranda Allen.  I am a professional actor, fire spinner, and stilt-walker.  Whether I am performing Shakespeare's verse or unimaginable circus acts, I love meeting an audience in the arena of entertainment and learning what makes them tick and tickled.

Recently, I have been granted the opportunity to meet continents of new audiences - I have been offered two acting roles in Australia!  I couldn't stand to miss all of the audiences and cultures along the way, so I've planned stops in Germany, France, England, and New Zealand.  To fund my travels I've composed a street performance show about a Canadian lumberjack traveling the globe.  

This trip and this show mean a lot to me.  Being able to perform on a global scale has been a dream of mine ever since I was a little girl.  I hope it's something I can do on an increasingly professional and stable scale for years to come.

You can help me build this feature into my career.  Hiring in both theatre and performance art on a whole is becoming increasingly based in demo footage, who you know, and how you can prove past success.  By donating to my show you can stretch the professional mileage I will get out of my trip.


What I'm Asking For And Why

The goals of this Indiegogo campaign are to:

  • Purchase a digital camera to record archival and promotional footage of my busking show.  This will let me review my show to make improvements, and to send demo footage to festivals, cruise ships, and other potential hirers.  
  • Purchase a 150 W portable amplifier.  An amplifier will give me the ability to perform for larger groups of people, and to perform more shows in a day without straining my voice.
  • Purchase the materials to build custom props.  I've designed my props to do two things.  1) Give the show a professional look by presenting a clear unified theme. 2) Be lightweight and durable to pack and travel easily.


Call It a Gift

I don't need anything for my birthday.  I don't need anything for Christmas.  I'll be on the other side of the planet for both this year.  Call this my going-away-present, birthday present, and Christmas present all in one - or don't call it anything.  

So many of you have been amazing sources of strength for me in the past 3 years as I've finished university and embarked on the unpredictable and unimaginable journey of being an artist.  I cannot thank you enough for all the love, encouragement, and generosity you have already provided.  If you are willing and able to donate to my tour, thank you so much.  Every little bit will help, even $5 - 20 makes a difference.  If not, I still thank you for your love, support, and being in my life.


Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can't throw any cash my way but you'd still like to contribute to the general awesomeness of my adventure.  Here are ways to do so:

  • Know a foreign friend?  If you know someone in one of the countries I'm going to, put us in touch!  It's always great to be shown around by a local or have a friendly couch to sleep on.
  • Remind our other friends and family.  Go pull on your dad, mom, or brother's shirt sleeve and say, "hey, remember that $20 you found on the ground 4 days ago?  I think that was Miranda's".
  • Like my fan page on Facebook at: https://www.facebook.com/Miranda.Allen.Actor and keep up with my whereabouts and performances.

Thank you all for reading this.
Much love to you all.

Sincerely,

Miranda Allen

Call It a Gift
I don't need anything for my birthday.  I don't need anything for Christmas.  I'll be on the other side of the planet for both this year.  Call this my going-away-present, birthday present, and Christmas present all in one - or don't call it anything.  
So many of you have been amazing sources of strength for me in the past 3 years as I've finished university and embarked on the unpredictable and unimaginable journey of being an artist.  I cannot thank you enough for all the love, encouragement, and generosity you have already provided.  If you are willing and able to donate to my tour, thank you so much.  Every little bit will help, even $5 - 20 makes a difference.  If not, I still thank you for your love, support, and being in my life.

Other Ways You Can Help
Maybe you can't throw any cash my way but you'd still like to contribute to the general awesomeness of my adventure.  Here are ways to do so:


Know a foreign friend?  If you know someone in one of the countries I'm going to, put us in touch!  It's always great to be shown around by a local or have a friendly couch to sleep on.
Remind our other friends and family.  Go pull on your dad, mom, or brother's shirt sleeve and say, "hey, remember that $20 you found on the ground 4 days ago?  I think that was Miranda's".
Like my fan page on Facebook at: https://www.facebook.com/Miranda.Allen.Actor and keep up with my whereabouts and performances.

Thank you all for reading this.Much love to you all.
Sincerely,
Miranda Allen

story:
Se siete stati a Wroclaw li avrete sicuramente visti. Queste piccole, innocue, mute creature sbucano ad ogni angolo di strada. Sono rappresentati nelle mansioni tipiche delle professioni piú comuni: c’è il muratore, il pompiere, il macellaio, il guardiano, la birraia, il postino, quello che offre un gelato, qualcun altro tiene un girasole, un motociclista col giubbottino di pelle...Trovo semplicemente inammissibile che manchi lo Gnomo Italiano!


Wroclaw è la cittá degli gnomi. Oltre ad essere una trovata originalissima e un potente strumento di marketing, queste simpatiche e spiritose sculture di bronzo hanno una storia precisa. Durante il periodo di piombo attraversato dalla Polonia negli anni Ottanta, infatti, i militanti di un movimento artistico surrealista underground, noto come Pomaranczowa Alternatywa (ita. alternativa arancione), cominciarono a disegnare gnomi sui muri ogni qualvolta il regime comunista si affrettava a cancellare sugli stessi gli slogan e le scritte contro le autoritá. Gli gnomi acquistarono quindi immediatamente una valenza politica e diventarono un modo geniale per opporsi pacificamente ad una realtá quotidiana fatta di violenza e soprusi.

Nella Wroclaw di oggi, gli gnomi sono diventati una presenza che permette di visitare la cittá in un modo totalmente diverso. I piú piccoli ne vanno pazzi, i turisti vanno a caccia di gnomi con in mano cartine che ne segnalano la posizione, te li trovi davanti quando meno te l'aspetti e sono dei veri e propri punti d'incontro!
Grazie al tuo contributo, anche lo Gnomo Italiano potrá diventare un solido punto di riferimento sulla mappa di Wroclaw. Quale sará la sua residenza e che aspetto avrá? Puó essere intento a consumare un espresso oppure al volante di un testarossa, puó essere rappresentato col gesto celebre della mano "a pigna" oppure impegnato in un'altra attivitá tipicamente italiana. Decidiamolo insieme, il nuovo orgoglioso esponente del mondo degli gnomi è giá su facebook!

Questa è la seconda raccolta fondi, la prima si è svolta in un'altra piattaforma di crowdfunding e ha raccolto quasi il 40% dei fondi necessari. Ora, grazie alla crescente popolaritá del blog Un Italiano a Wroclaw e al reportage della RAI, sono convinto che lo Gnomo Italiano ci metterá un attimo a valicare le Alpi e ad arrivare a Wroclaw! La somma da raggiungere è di 1600 euro (intorno ai 6500 zloty): mille euro per la realizzazione dello gnomo in bronzo, il resto in volantini (in polacco e in italiano) e after party, l'evento che organizzeró per festeggiare (lo spero bene!) la presenza in cittá del rispettabilissimo Gnomo Italiano. I benefattori non rimarranno a mani vuote, date un'occhiata ai premi che vi aspettano ;)

Nota Bene: se all'importo da raggiungere mancherá anche un solo centesimo, tutti i fondi torneranno ai loro legittimi proprietari. Naturalmente faró di tutto per evitare questo scenario apocalittico!

Volete conoscermi meglio? Mi troverete su youtube, i parlanti polacco potranno leggere qualcosa su di me qui e qui, per eventuali domande potete contattarmi qui. Spargete la voce e affrettatevi a comprare un volo per Wroclaw, lo Gnomo Italiano vi deve dare il benvenuto!

story:
Who am I?

Cassandra Mendoza a college student at the University of Hartford. I have had a long road getting here. I am not looking for hand outs. I am looking for a opportunity. I never had much as a child. Just the important stuff like a roof over my head, clothes on my back, and food in my belly. But I never had many luxuries, just Love. So now that i am an adult I am trying to make a name for myself and trying to explore the world. I hope with the donations i receive, i will be able  to go on this journey to this amazing place to document the local people and to experience local culture. I am a photographer with a need to see the world around me. So please help me pursue my dream and give me the opportunity to document and explore ghana. 

What am I requesting?

$5500 to be exact

Where are you going?

Kokrobite, Ghana 19 miles from Accra

When is the trip?

The trip will take place in January

Why do you need the money? 

I am going on 3 week Sustainable Studio course at the Kokrobitey Institute.

story:
A last minute push to make this happen...

This is a campaign intended as a life-start-up fund, to get established with studio and materials for a great creative endeavor. All investments go towards a run of productions and the ability to live during the time of such. The investment and reward vision is based on utilizing personal inventiveness and connecting with local businesses and groups. 

My thoughts are on the beauty We can bring forth together when sharing creative energy.

There is so much to say, many details and visions come up when imagining the potential of this campaign. It all has to do with being ready to be responsible with my creative vision and gift. The work I have done to reach this grand new starting point has taught me all I need to know to move forward.

My primary intention is to become established as an artist here in the City of Grass Valley and to utilize my creativity in a holistic integrative way. Six years ago I began to see how creativity can powerfully transform a community situation, a household, and the lives of many individuals. Having had a challenging upbringing it was not clear how I could start, what direction to go. This is where I have found a place that has attracted for years and has many great opportunities to get into creativity.

Now, as I make a new home here, there is a tremendous amount of energy to share with the community, to offer up in many ways. Being home and feeling a part of makes further participation a bright path to follow. Calling out for support as an assistance to get along my way.

These are my current goals and actions, what I am attending to in order to ensure this process and that I may be responsible for all supporters contribute and expect.

1) Put aside time each day to express new ideas and visions. Keep these organized and made available online as a portfolio

2) Connect with local businesses in order to integrate productions and be a part of the thriving community. 

3) Stay organized and build a strong foundation through daily review of progress, share each step of the way.

Thank You for reading and considering supporting my campaign!

Many Blessings, Nathan

story:
I am excited to announce that I have reached my goal in this campaign to fund printing the tarot deck I have been creating for the past four and a half years.  However my goal was less than actual printing costs and I am still looking for people who want to contribute to funding. I have found some excellent printers who will print 1000 good quality decks with a full color booklet in a lidded box. I am looking forward to offering Tarot de St. Croix in the spring.

Check out the perks to see what level of contribution you want to make. Be one of the first to receive the Tarot de St. Croix deck. Choose a fine art archival print of the card of your choice. I am also offering the original oil painting of the Empress.   Receive a  tarot reading from me using my deck. You will be contributing to making this deck a reality.

                                       

The Tarot de St. Croix is a contemporary multi-cultural deck. The imagery is unique and yet relates to the archetypes typically found in the tarot. My paintings have been inspired by the world I see around me, my experiences and visions. As I pulled a card randomly from a tarot deck; I opened myself to whatever information came through relating to the meaning of the card – amazing synchronicities guided me.

                                      

The Nine of Pentacles was the first card I painted. Traditionally you see a woman standing next to a grape vine loaded with fruit. On her hand is a falcon. The meaning of this card is harvesting the fruits of your labor. I painted myself gathering a bunch of sunflowers in front of an adobe house. I am now living this card – I have a home of my own that looks quite similar with a falcon that visits regularly! Printing this deck will be the harvesting of years of work painting it.

The Hermit is a curandero, a healer and wise woman from the American southwest or Mexico. She emerges from a cave where she has been on a vision quest discovering new knowledge. Her aspen staff with knots that resemble eyes; symbolizes the ability to see hidden truths. Recently I took a trip to Durango with Tarot experts: Carrie Paris, Marcus Katz and Tali Goodwin to be part of the Living Tarot Oracle and present workshops. On the way we stopped at echo cave in Abiquiui which is the landscape of artist Georgia O'Keeffe; who is an inspiration of mine. I realized it was almost the same scene I painted in my Hermit card, with the eye to the sky. When I found an aspen staff in a herb shop in Durango I knew that my year card the Hermit was alive. I have been in a cave of sorts painting my deck. I am emerging - help me bring this deck into the world.

In gratitude,

Lisa de St. Croix

story:
Our Story

//BUZZCUT// began its life on December 15th 2011 in a tenement flat in Glasgow. With the loss of New Territories and Into The New (two very important performance festivals) the Scottish cultural landscape took a big blow! Unwilling to getting stuck in the mud, a team of energetic young artists decided to create //BUZZCUT// as a positive response to a bad situation and to create a brand new, exciting platform for outstanding performance work to be showcased in Glasgow... thus maintaining its reputation as a thriving cultural hub!


Since its birth on that December morning, due to its appeal to artists and audiences, the festival has grown from a three day festival in one venue, to a FIVE day festival in TWO venues! The programme is now finalised, supporting 45 artists from Strathclyde to Stockholm. 


//BUZZCUT// is a FREE festival, operating on a 'pay what you can' system' and all those artists who are travelling have met our spontaneity and inspiration. They will be paying their own travel to Glasgow while we put them up in each others' houses and feed them.


To see the unbelievable programme, go to: www.glasgowbuzzcut.wordpress.com


//BUZZCUT// takes place between March 14th-18th 2012, and with your kind donations we will be able to afford all of our essential expenditures listed below. 


Thank you so much for reading this and we really hope to hear from you soon,


Love //BUZZCUT// x

glasgowbuzzcut@gmail.com


The Impact

This festival's most exciting feature so far has been its spontaneous nature! It has existed for 6 weeks and has only 6 weeks until opening night. This has inspired the Glasgow community to pull together and make it happen as a lot of people really believe in its cause. 


Beyond Glasgow, the performance communities in Britain and Europe have all expressed the need for such initiatives to be present in our lives despite wintery economic climates. This festival is inspiring people to look around to each other as opposed to above, and we're really excited by this!


Finally, //BUZZCUT// is providing a platform for 45 artists to show work, many whose work had no platform after the loss of the two aforementioned festivals. //BUZZCUT// also takes place in two new, vibrant, independent venues which are establishing themselves in the Glasgow community.


What We Need & What You Get

Essentials:


Venue 1 hire = Â£300

Venue 2 hire = Â£150

Soup kitchen for day long events = Â£150

Food for artists on day of performance = Â£200

Van hire (3 days) = Â£132


Preferable:

Promo 300 badges + 200 posters = Â£155 

Printing 400 programmes (exactly how we'd like them) = Â£140 


Total = Â£1,227


We have included some preferable expenses as they would really make the festival feel professional and realise how we've imagined it!


Our target is exactly the same amount as our budget total as we will not need any more than this, so why ask? The festival operates on a 'pay way you can' system so we will be using these funds during the festival for unknown expenditures at this point. If we do not reach our target, of course the festival will still happen but we will have to be finding different ways to pay the venues and hire companies, and feeding the artists.


All donations are so gratefully received and we will be thrilled with any financial support you can provide and we promise it will always go to essential use. Should you like to know exactly where your money went, we will happily and excitedly tell/prove to you.


We would like to include all contributors names in our programme. You would then be part of the first ever //BUZZCUT// contributors list and we would express our huge gratitude in paper form, but we'd also love it if you were able to attend the festival so we could personally thank you and show you all the work.


Other Ways You Can Help

We have a big online presence and you can also help us by spreading the word!


You can find us on Twitter: @glasgowbuzzcut

                              Website: www.glasgowbuzzcut.wordpress.com

                              Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/events/201920446569321/ 

                              E-mail: glasgowbuzzcut@gmail.com


Love //BUZZCUT// x

story:
About me
My name is Costas Schuler, artist, graphic designer, funny man, also known as The Pen Guy, happily married to my wife Sandy and father to four amazing children. Today I seek your financial support to help me create seven 48"x48" works of art using recycled pens called "Pentings".

In 2005 I had a fantastic idea to collect pens and glue them on my 1981 Mercedes Benz 300SD, affectionately called the Mercedes Pens. So far I have managed to collect over 70,000 pens locally and from around the world, the first 10,000 ending up on the art car. Now that the Mercedes Pens is totally covered in pens I am launching phase two of my master plan to find homes for the other 60,000+ used pens I have pilled up and over flowing at my house.

I seek to raise support to produce seven recycle pen art pieces and take my passion for art, pens and recycling to the next level. Together we can help create something amazing, wonderful and full of joy. And as an added bonus prevent a whole bunch of pens from ending up in the landfill.

The Goal
I want to raise $8400 to fund the first seven 48"x48" works of art made from donated used pens already in my possession. Your funding will go towards my time and materials such as paint, lumber, nails and lots and lots of glue. The good part is that I can get started on my first Penting for as little as $1200 and finish the rest as the fundings continues to pour in.

The Big Picture
Every year about 1.6 million pens are disposed of and end up in the land fill and right now there are very few solutions to this growing problem. My dream is to create great art using old pens of every kind, ball point, markers, dryerase, felttip, crayolas and reduce the impact in this one area with your help.

  • I started out by collecting and gluing about 10,000 used pens to my mercedes pens art car and although a great start I had to redo sections as the plastic broke down in the sun and rain. Not a permanent solution.
  • The second phase is to take the 60,000 pens I have collected so far and create art works that will be displayed indoors and thus prolonging the life of an empty pen a bit longer and create beauty in the environments in which they are displayed. (this is the part I need funding for)
  • The third phase is to get further funding to create large art instillations using millions of pens
  • The fourth phase is to put together a team of that will create and implement viable solutions in reducing the flow of empty pens into the landfills of the world that is profitable for all those involved.
  • The fifth phase is to see what happens when you cross disneyland and a billion pens.


My Track Record

Collecting Pens
From the first day I started gluing pens to my car I had amazing favorable responce to my request for used pens with people, business and the media. All my friends brought me bags of pens and emptied out their draws.

Business would pile their extra pens on the counter and head out the door to take a look at the Mercedes Pens, emptying and entire bank once in the proicess. Schools have created pen recycling programs on my behalf and give me pens on a regular basis.


I have several local thrift shops that collect pens for me on a weekly basis and continue to receive thousands of pens every month localy and from all over the US. I have also received pens from as far as Canada, England, Japan, China, Thailand Malaysia and Africa

I have recently partnered with TerraCycle who send me 30,000 pens and commissioned me to produce two Pentings for them in return.

Media Attention
I have had countless of articles written, pictures taken and videos made and seen all over the world of the Mercedes Pens and my pen recycling program.

Feature Articles on:

  • Mail Online
  • AOL
  • MyFox News
  • Huffington Post
  • Forbes
  • PC Magazine

Feature Video on:

  • Mag Rack
  • Smithsonian TV
  • The Wealth Channel
  • National Geographic
  • Front page of Yahoo

Movies:

  • Documentary Film called "Penultimate" by Paul Myers
  • Appearance in the movie called "Doggie Boogie"

Appearances at:

  • ArtCar Fest
  • Maker Faire
  • Sacramento Car Show
  • Local Schools
  • Local Retirement Homes

All that to say I am not the only one who thinks this is a good idea. Therfore I ask for your support both financialy and with pen donations to continue on to my One Million Pen goal.


Additional Ways You Can Help

Wether you can support this project or not please consider doing two things for me at the very least.

  1. Spread the word about my projects and tell all your friends by using the Indiegogo share tools!
  2. Gather all those empty pens laying around in mugs, draws, boxes even down the couch and send them in the mail to me for future art projects to:
    The Pen Guy
    PO BOX #994
    Forestville CA, 95436

And that’s all there is to it.
story_txt:
About meMy name is Costas Schuler, artist, graphic designer, funny man, also known as The Pen Guy, happily married to my wife Sandy and father to four amazing children. Today I seek your financial support to help me create seven 48"x48" works of art using recycled pens called "Pentings".In 2005 I had a fantastic idea to collect pens and glue them on my 1981 Mercedes Benz 300SD, affectionately called the Mercedes Pens. So far I have managed to collect over 70,000 pens locally and from around the world, the first 10,000 ending up on the art car. Now that the Mercedes Pens is totally covered in pens I am launching phase two of my master plan to find homes for the other 60,000+ used pens I have pilled up and over flowing at my house.I seek to raise support to produce seven recycle pen art pieces and take my passion for art, pens and recycling to the next level. Together we can help create something amazing, wonderful and full of joy. And as an added bonus prevent a whole bunch of pens from ending up in the landfill.

The GoalI want to raise $8400 to fund the first seven 48"x48" works of art made from donated used pens already in my possession. Your funding will go towards my time and materials such as paint, lumber, nails and lots and lots of glue. The good part is that I can get started on my first Penting for as little as $1200 and finish the rest as the fundings continues to pour in.The Big PictureEvery year about 1.6 million pens are disposed of and end up in the land fill and right now there are very few solutions to this growing problem. My dream is to create great art using old pens of every kind, ball point, markers, dryerase, felttip, crayolas and reduce the impact in this one area with your help.

I started out by collecting and gluing about 10,000 used pens to my mercedes pens art car and although a great start I had to redo sections as the plastic broke down in the sun and rain. Not a permanent solution.
The second phase is to take the 60,000 pens I have collected so far and create art works that will be displayed indoors and thus prolonging the life of an empty pen a bit longer and create beauty in the environments in which they are displayed. (this is the part I need funding for)
The third phase is to get further funding to create large art instillations using millions of pens
The fourth phase is to put together a team of that will create and implement viable solutions in reducing the flow of empty pens into the landfills of the world that is profitable for all those involved.
The fifth phase is to see what happens when you cross disneyland and a billion pens.
My Track Record
Collecting PensFrom the first day I started gluing pens to my car I had amazing favorable responce to my request for used pens with people, business and the media. All my friends brought me bags of pens and emptied out their draws. Business would pile their extra pens on the counter and head out the door to take a look at the Mercedes Pens, emptying and entire bank once in the proicess. Schools have created pen recycling programs on my behalf and give me pens on a regular basis.I have several local thrift shops that collect pens for me on a weekly basis and continue to receive thousands of pens every month localy and from all over the US. I have also received pens from as far as Canada, England, Japan, China, Thailand Malaysia and AfricaI have recently partnered with TerraCycle who send me 30,000 pens and commissioned me to produce two Pentings for them in return.

Media AttentionI have had countless of articles written, pictures taken and videos made and seen all over the world of the Mercedes Pens and my pen recycling program.

story:
Out of the Diamond Bank ~

Hello!  I am the artist Victoria Cessna, who rents a small space in an old building that once housed the "Diamond Bank" in downtown Pittsburgh, PA. This Campaign introduces the idea of you supporting my rent there and in return, you receive the work I do in the form of 'PERKS' according to the donation amount you make to help me. The list of thank you gifts is to the right side of this page.

The reason I am turning to ask you for help is that sometimes sales of my work can be slow. As with us all, my bills still come at a steady pace.   This studio is vital to the creating of my works as a full time artist. Your help will reduce the shear panic of debt when I can’t keep up with the rent.

Will You Support Me?

The amount I am seeking to raise is about two months studio rent plus the fees for listing on the indiegogo web service, and credit charges incurred for this campaign, shipping costs and supplies. Your donations will be an enormous boost and will allow me this time to keep building my portfolio while creating and delivering the wonderful "perks" for your donation. I will also have time to keep applying for grant opportunities (simply applying takes much time out of the work day). 

I will be working for you!  Since you will be funding me, I will show you what I am doing. You can see the progress and what I am able to create in the time you have helped me rent my studio.  This campaign will give me confidence by knowing I am doing the correct thing, following my dreams and knowing it is what I am meant to do, because you support me to do it!  

If I don't reach my goal, I will still send you what is promised to you according to the perk that your donation chose.  I have a lease on my studio, and will have to pay for it somehow. I will keep working and working and hoping. 

Does your donation matter? 

Yes! Every bit helps.  For five dollars or more, I thank you deeply for that. Your name will be mentioned in my thanks! I feel the support in the gesture more than you know.

If I can raise the full campaign amount, this funding will pay for my rent at my studio for three months. Any extra will carry me to further months, be used to buy supplies, and be put toward my transportation and costs around me working from my studio. 

It's always tricky to sell and stay afloat in bills with my sales in flux, so the impact for me is that I will be able to push forward steadily, studying and practicing my work without the shear panic of where my rent will come from, for at least this bit of time. I am so grateful for that freedom to push without fear, feeling your support.

How else can you help?  

If you cannot contribute monetarily at this time, please keep in mind that I am working as an artist full time.  I love communication about my work. Please follow it through all those networking ways I try my best to use for that reason. 

Indiegogo has share tools! Maybe you know someone that might donate? Please pass this request along.

Sign up to follow me on Facebook, Instagram and /or Twitter. It's free and fun!

 

Here is A bit about me~

I am a full time visual artist.  Art has been my passion all my life. If you know me, you know I grew up always creating something! I attended School of the Museum of Fine Arts in Boston before raising a family and continue taking classes as I can afford for continued learning in the/my Arts. Writing, photography and painting have been my favorite mediums. Married to a musician for 24 years, our children grown and pursuing their own careers in the arts, I am asking for help to continue.  When selling artwork as the sole income for any artist, the trouble comes with maintaining a balanced income. I could see benefits right away to having my own space. My productivity has really increased! 

 

I am excited for the work to come and for you to share it with me!
