story:
I want to take a second to thank everyone for your help! All this generosity is humbling. I have made enough to pay for my books. I am currently working on nine different scholarship applications for school, however they are all very competitive, and it is unlikely I will be awarded many of them, if at all. I am also planning to apply for work study, and am working on getting my cosmetology license transferred to PA so I can work. While many of you know that I am not above working, this is a very labor intensive program and the less I have to work, the more I will be able to achieve academically. I am also trying to reduce the amount of student loans that will need to be taken out.


There are only a few days left in this fundraisers, and if you would like to help, I can still use any donation given towards school. 

So you can all understand where I am sitting financially, I have laid out this rough budget. 

                          Amount.               total

Housing Deposit $1,200.00 $1,200.00

Housing                $700.00/mo         $5,600.00

Living/ utilities   $300.00/ mo.      $2,400.00

Tuition.                  $8,250/sem $16,500.00

Books                $680.00/sem.     $2,720.00

Registration         $100.00        $100.00

Bills.                      $379.00/mo.        $6,064.00

Moving              $300.00 $300.00

            Total              $34,884.00

Pell grant $1,480.00 $1,480.00

Pell Grant $1,479.00 $1,479.00

Subsidized $1,732.00 $1,732.00

subsidized $1,732.00 $1,732.00

unsubsidized $2,968.00 $2,968.00

unsubsidized $2,968.00 $2,968.00

Indiegogo $672.00 $672.00

  Total.   $13,031.00

Potential scholarship money is unlikely, but I have put it here for reference

"DEC  IDEA"                              $8,250.00

Savini.                                         $5,000.00

"Flavor of the month"              $1,500.00

 Total.  $14,750.00


                                 34,884.00

                               -13,031.00

                               -14,750.00

                               =$7,103.00



So, after all my loan and grant money, and the three scholarships I feel I have a decent shot at, I still am in the hole $7,103.00

Like I said any assistance is more than appreciated. 

Again I thank everyone for all of your help.

 

I'm not trying to beg unnecessarily, I'm merely trying to finally go after the dream I have been trying to achieve for years.  Thank you all for reading this.

Can social media truly help fund my education? My financial issues are not due to a lack of frugality, but one of circumstance wiping my savings. My name is Julia Cuellar, Between my love of theater, and my jobs, I have been involved with makeup for over ten years. I went to Regency Beauty Institute in Wichita, Kansas where i received the education to take my state boards. I earned my cosmetology license over three years ago. I started my own business: Julia Cuellar Stylist and Artist (I'm working on a better name) two years ago trying to legitimize my business as a fx artist/cosmetologist.  

This past week I was accepted to the Tom Savini special makeup effects school at the Douglas Education Center in Pennsylvania. The overall cost of the program is over $30,000. Pell, and Stafford loans cover almost half.  No other school offers the education I will receive. For the past three years i  have been working towards funding my education.
I work for a home health agency full time. This job pays my bills and provides health insurance. I have two side jobs. I also work odd jobs doing face and body painting, makeup, and costumes when needed. I worked in a salon part time, but booth rental at a salon began eating my savings, so I had to quit once I became eligible  for reciprocity. Finally, I worked for the local school district as a special education para. This job alone would have been enough to cover a semester of books, and a semester of supply costs. In the last month of working at the school I had to have surgery. Part of the hospital bills, the time off from work, and medications ate almost everything I had saved, which was close to seven hundred dollars. 
So here I am working three jobs, applying for any grant applicable. I have begun using social media outlets to show, and promote my work as an artist, offering any type of Makeup related service possible without putting my cosmetology license in jeopardy. I am cleaning out closets and shelves selling whatever i can. I am starting up a YouTube channel for makeup and hair tutorials, in the hopes of  gaining sponsorship or supplies. All of this to reach my ultimate goal: to expand my knowledge so i am able to work in the haunted house industry. I would also like to create affordable and comfortable custom prosthetic limbs for those who are in need. 

Here's the breakdown:
for four semesters:
Tuition: $33,000
Books: $620
Supplies: $5,585
Cost of living: $10,000

Pell Grant: $3,500. 
Stafford Subsidized: $2,300
Stafford Unsubsidized:$3,000
Assuming I will recieve a similar award the following year that is approximately $13,000 I will be able to cover outside of working to fund living expenses.

The amount I am asking for ($620) is for books. Anything I make above, below, or at the goal will fund books, tuition, and supplies. 
LET ME BE CLEAR: I do not expect to generate $39,000. It would be great, but at this point I'm truly looking for ANY assistance, whether it be financial, or helping me spread the word.

HERE'S WHAT I CAN DO FOR YOU:

If you can't give monetarily that's OK. Here are some things I'm willing to do if you're able to help me out:

Businesses: Print this off, and place in a window, or desk area, of your business, and tag me on Facebook, twitter, Instagram, linked in, pintrest, or tumblr so I can see it, and I will gladly thank you on my pages, your business page, and mail a personally hand written thank you note.

Friend/family/people I've never met: share on Facebook, twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, LinkedIn, Tumblr. Tag me so I'm aware, and I'll thank you on mine, and your page (on whatever site you choose).

$1 - I will personally thank you on my Facebook, Instagram pages
$5 - I will personally thank you on your Facebook pages
$10 - I will personally hand write you a thank you note.
$25 - I will send you a prosthetic scar or wound complete blood for effect,                       directions, and latex for application.
$50 - photographic/ text beauty consult on a problem area via mail, Facebook, Pinterest or Instagram. 
$75 - photographic/text  fx consult for a basic level issue (appliance, techniques etc) via mail, Facebook, Pinterest or Instagram
$100 - a one on one beauty makeup or hair consultation via skype
$150 - a one on one fx consult via Skype, OR a one on one beauty makeup & hair consult.
$200 - personalized YouTube tutorial on a beauty or fx makeup of your choosing.
Working with kids with special needs has taught me so much, prosthetic limbs can be outrageously expensive, and not always comfortable. With this education I will learn how to mold and create limbs that are not only comfortable but affordable. It is my small contribution in giving back all that I have gotten out of my experiences.
It would mean the world to me to attain something I have been working towards for the past decade, and if I could do it all on my own, believe me I would; I've tried these past three years, and I'm simply getting nowhere.. I can't do this alone. If there is simply nothing you can do; I understand as I've been there. I would like to thank you any way for taking the time to read this and hopefully pass this along. The best business is word of mouth

THANK YOU:
To this of you who donate your money, or time and to the amazing community of people i am surrounded by who makes me rich in the most important ways: love, acceptance, creativity, family and friendship. 

Mom, Dad, Cia, Tino Maia, Judy, Russ, Ginny, Dudley, Rosie, Chuck, Angie, Randy, Michael, Jena, Jim, Danielle, Shaun, Brian, Mama Joyce, All of my cousins, and their kiddos: your unending support, love, and never once openly doubting, or mocking my dream of making people beautiful and horrific let's me know how truly blessed I am.

To my partner in crime Jen: thank you for always having my back, and being the best friend a girl can ask for.

To my friends: From legit deep friendship to those who "like" Facebook stuff: from the bottom of my heart I thank you.

To my families at Riverside Hair Station, Rambling Rose Salon, Tú Imagen Productions, Ichiico Comics, Aspen home care, the SMD II room & our classroom neighbors at USD 373: Thank you for putting up with me, and allowing me to grow with you. 

To my clients both in the salon, and at Aspen who support me, even if it means me having to leave them without their favorite stylist: thank you for all the love and support

Last but not least: Ian (Tré) we may not have been together long, but from the bottom of my heart thank you for reminding me of the potential I have inside of me.
story_txt:
I want to take a second to thank everyone for your help! All this generosity is humbling. I have made enough to pay for my books. I am currently working on nine different scholarship applications for school, however they are all very competitive, and it is unlikely I will be awarded many of them, if at all. I am also planning to apply for work study, and am working on getting my cosmetology license transferred to PA so I can work. While many of you know that I am not above working, this is a very labor intensive program and the less I have to work, the more I will be able to achieve academically. I am also trying to reduce the amount of student loans that will need to be taken out.There are only a few days left in this fundraisers, and if you would like to help, I can still use any donation given towards school. So you can all understand where I am sitting financially, I have laid out this rough budget.  
                           Amount.               totalHousing Deposit $1,200.00 $1,200.00 
Housing                $700.00/mo         $5,600.00 
Living/ utilities   $300.00/ mo.      $2,400.00 
Tuition.                  $8,250/sem $16,500.00 
Books                $680.00/sem.     $2,720.00 
Registration         $100.00        $100.00 
Bills.                      $379.00/mo.        $6,064.00Moving               $300.00   $300.00 

             Total              $34,884.00
 Pell grant $1,480.00 $1,480.00 
Pell Grant $1,479.00 $1,479.00 
Subsidized $1,732.00 $1,732.00 
subsidized $1,732.00 $1,732.00 
unsubsidized $2,968.00 $2,968.00 
unsubsidized $2,968.00 $2,968.00 
Indiegogo $672.00 $672.00 
  Total.   $13,031.00 Potential scholarship money is unlikely, but I have put it here for reference "DEC  IDEA"                               $8,250.00 
Savini.                                         $5,000.00 
"Flavor of the month"              $1,500.00 Total.  $14,750.00                                  34,884.00                               -13,031.00                               -14,750.00                               =$7,103.00So, after all my loan and grant money, and the three scholarships I feel I have a decent shot at, I still am in the hole $7,103.00Like I said any assistance is more than appreciated. Again I thank everyone for all of your help.
  I'm not trying to beg unnecessarily, I'm merely trying to finally go after the dream I have been trying to achieve for years.  Thank you all for reading this.
Can social media truly help fund my education? My financial issues are not due to a lack of frugality, but one of circumstance wiping my savings. My name is Julia Cuellar, Between my love of theater, and my jobs, I have been involved with makeup for over ten years. I went to Regency Beauty Institute in Wichita, Kansas where i received the education to take my state boards. I earned my cosmetology license over three years ago. I started my own business: Julia Cuellar Stylist and Artist (I'm working on a better name) two years ago trying to legitimize my business as a fx artist/cosmetologist.  
This past week I was accepted to the Tom Savini special makeup effects school at the Douglas Education Center in Pennsylvania. The overall cost of the program is over $30,000. Pell, and Stafford loans cover almost half.  No other school offers the education I will receive. For the past three years i  have been working towards funding my education.I work for a home health agency full time. This job pays my bills and provides health insurance. I have two side jobs. I also work odd jobs doing face and body painting, makeup, and costumes when needed. I worked in a salon part time, but booth rental at a salon began eating my savings, so I had to quit once I became eligible  for reciprocity. Finally, I worked for the local school district as a special education para. This job alone would have been enough to cover a semester of books, and a semester of supply costs. In the last month of working at the school I had to have surgery. Part of the hospital bills, the time off from work, and medications ate almost everything I had saved, which was close to seven hundred dollars. 
So here I am working three jobs, applying for any grant applicable. I have begun using social media outlets to show, and promote my work as an artist, offering any type of Makeup related service possible without putting my cosmetology license in jeopardy. I am cleaning out closets and shelves selling whatever i can. I am starting up a YouTube channel for makeup and hair tutorials, in the hopes of  gaining sponsorship or supplies. All of this to reach my ultimate goal: to expand my knowledge so i am able to work in the haunted house industry. I would also like to create affordable and comfortable custom prosthetic limbs for those who are in need. 
Here's the breakdown:for four semesters:Tuition: $33,000Books: $620Supplies: $5,585Cost of living: $10,000Pell Grant: $3,500. Stafford Subsidized: $2,300Stafford Unsubsidized:$3,000Assuming I will recieve a similar award the following year that is approximately $13,000 I will be able to cover outside of working to fund living expenses.The amount I am asking for ($620) is for books. Anything I make above, below, or at the goal will fund books, tuition, and supplies. LET ME BE CLEAR: I do not expect to generate $39,000. It would be great, but at this point I'm truly looking for ANY assistance, whether it be financial, or helping me spread the word.HERE'S WHAT I CAN DO FOR YOU:If you can't give monetarily that's OK. Here are some things I'm willing to do if you're able to help me out:Businesses: Print this off, and place in a window, or desk area, of your business, and tag me on Facebook, twitter, Instagram, linked in, pintrest, or tumblr so I can see it, and I will gladly thank you on my pages, your business page, and mail a personally hand written thank you note.Friend/family/people I've never met: share on Facebook, twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, LinkedIn, Tumblr. Tag me so I'm aware, and I'll thank you on mine, and your page (on whatever site you choose).$1 - I will personally thank you on my Facebook, Instagram pages$5 - I will personally thank you on your Facebook pages$10 - I will personally hand write you a thank you note.$25 - I will send you a prosthetic scar or wound complete blood for effect,                       directions, and latex for application.$50 - photographic/ text beauty consult on a problem area via mail, Facebook, Pinterest or Instagram. $75 - photographic/text  fx consult for a basic level issue (appliance, techniques etc) via mail, Facebook, Pinterest or Instagram$100 - a one on one beauty makeup or hair consultation via skype$150 - a one on one fx consult via Skype, OR a one on one beauty makeup & hair consult.$200 - personalized YouTube tutorial on a beauty or fx makeup of your choosing.Working with kids with special needs has taught me so much, prosthetic limbs can be outrageously expensive, and not always comfortable. With this education I will learn how to mold and create limbs that are not only comfortable but affordable. It is my small contribution in giving back all that I have gotten out of my experiences.It would mean the world to me to attain something I have been working towards for the past decade, and if I could do it all on my own, believe me I would; I've tried these past three years, and I'm simply getting nowhere.. I can't do this alone. If there is simply nothing you can do; I understand as I've been there. I would like to thank you any way for taking the time to read this and hopefully pass this along. story:
Chicago Art Magazine has survived a malware attack but may not survive the next one. 

Chicago Art Magazine (chicagoartmagazine.com) was the most widely viewed visual art news source in Chicago between 2009-2012. After it closed in 2012, all 1,000+ articles remained online. Last month, the site went down due to a malware attack. Interestingly, it was the critics, artists, influencers and gallerists who noticed the problem – a testament to how valuable the articles in the archive are.

It cost several hundred dollars to restore. It will need nearly a thousand dollars over the next two years to update and protect the suite of websites from the new attacks that are created every day. Chicago Art Map (chicagoartmap.com) is also at risk, but a more complex site to support, so our stretch goal will include an audit of that software utility. 

The Impact

Even years after closing, the traffic to the magazine remains high due to the continued interest in our content. We showcased thousands of artists, who often link to their articles and reviews on their own portfolio sites, and those links will break if the archive goes down again.  For many artists and closed galleries, it is their only presence on the web. Over 2,000 sites currently link to Chicago Art Magazine, which is one of the many factors as to why it performs so well in terms of search engine optimization. 

The Chicago art scene between 2009-2012 was an odd time for art and the true wild west of publishing.  As I worked on the New Art Examiner book, a decade after the closing of the magazine, I realize how these moments in time, no matter how imperfectly we documented them, have great value, and the value of the content increases over time as the past stretches farther into the distance.

Risks & Challenges

Technologically, from an internet/website perspective, the online magazine is now like a little old rickety boat in a sea that is infected by malware, spammers and hackers. The internet always moves forward, so even though the website remains unchanged, it becomes increasingly more vulnerable as new security flaws are exploited. Old Wordpress websites don’t age well and often vanish from the internet. For a few hundred dollars, we can protect the site, but not rebuild it. With a stretch goal of $3,000, we could give the entire site a face lift, manually re-format the articles, and re-launch the new website design, while preserving all the current hyperlinks to articles.  

Team

Kathryn Born- I am the founder and creator of the site. Chicago Art Magazine actually launched my career as a web designer and social media strategist. When we launched, we had no money for graphic designers, web designers, or system administrators, so I wore all those hats. Social media was in its infancy, and I feel like (along with millions of others) we pioneered the idea of “pushing” out our content through this newly popularized site called “Facebook”. Social media was the cornerstone of our distribution. 

Chicago Art Magazine was a massive paid team of writers and editors. I could list over a hundred people, but there are two people I must name.  Stephanie Burke, with whom I began the site, launched site and pulled the original editorial team and gallery review system together.  As the years went by, Robin Dluzen went from intern, to writer, to editor, to managing editor, to Editor-in-Chief. She transformed the magazine into an edited an elegant journal, and she took over completely when I fell ill.  Both of these partners have continued their art careers and are formidable forces in the contemporary art scene today.  I’m connected to dozens of our writers through social media and IRL friendships and enjoy watching their careers flourish as well.  

We closed the magazine due to my health issues and the fiscal impossibilities of running a local visual art magazine.  Occasionally I work on a series of short pieces entitled, “The History of Chicago Art Magazine”, which tells the story of the insanity of doing a local art magazine in a new wild west of online publishing. The stories of how we slugged through a newly fragmented media landscape tells not only the story of Chicago Art Magazine, but a time capsule of Chicago art and the media landscape during those years.

FAQ 
I'm broke but want to help, what can I do? 
That's easy- post the campaign to social media. Even one posting is worth its weight in gold in the age of social media. So please share.  

Why is the goal so low? Isn't tech security stuff really expensive? 
It doesn't take a lot of money because I do most of it personally. Since I built these sites, I've probably built about 20 more sites for clients and small businesses. So I'm very good at 90% of it. For the remaining 10%, if we hit the goal, I can bring in some experts who will fill in the knowledge gap. I don't think we'll hit $3K, but if we do, I can take the time to rebuild the site. I would need some temp work for re-formatting the articles - there's no automated way to do some of these tasks. 

 

UPDATES

Note: updates are only visible to funders, so I'm putting some where so they can be seen by everyone

11/18/14

UPDATE: The process has begun and we've extended this to the other sites in the Chicago Art Machine, which include

Chicago Art Map
Chicago Art Magazine
TINC Magazine (Technology Industry News – Chicago)
Tech Startup Catalog
Computers After School (teacher blog, still active)
Chicago Art Machine
DIY-film.com

I'm excited this campaign was a success - the hosting bill has been paid and we're working through the first attempt to build a clone site (for additional backup) -- this process has helped uncover corrupted databases, and I'm grateful to this fund - it has given us the resources to dedicate to this project and work slowly and carefully. 

11/7/14

We are at 90% with 28 days to go. I don’t know what to say except thank you, and I am honestly a little stunned. And I also say WE thank you – I include Robin Dluzen and all the writers and artists when I say “we” because Chicago Art Magazine meant so much to us - and we believe in our hears we did something unique with the online publication. One piece of trivia: when a critic reviewed a gallery we had never covered before they were paid double. We did this, and things like this, because we were fascinated not just with the trendy galleries, but the full ethnic and geographical range of the city. I’m also proud of the ten-article series “40 Artists Over 40” in which we savagely bucked the youth-fetish trend and featured some of the best, seasoned artists in the city.

So once the goal has almost been hit, we can look at the stretch goal, which is the  modernization of the magazine, and include some tools that help sort and search,

Anyway, I could link to articles all day, but … just thank you. Years after the closing of the magazine, I’m fighting for these websites and asking, “Why am I doing this? Who even cares? Does anyone want this?”

And now I know.

Thank you.

story:
Warrior Gateway is excited to continue to lead the charge in transforming outdoor spaces to honor the sacrifice and service of the military community through our Patriots in Paint initiative. Following the success of last year’s artistic repackaging of the Jericho Project in New York City, we’re heading to Dallas this October to continue to honor the military community, their sacrifice and service through the purposeful strokes of mural artist, Sam Welty’s paintbrushes.

This year, Sam will be painting a series of large scale military focused murals at the American Airlines Sky Ball XII honoring the Navy and Korean War veterans. We are excited to continue transforming blank walls into purposeful works of art while simultaneously bringing color to the lives of incredible veterans well deserving of artful acknowledgement in our public spaces. We invite you to learn more about our organization, this upcoming project and how you can help!

A Little About Warrior Gateway

We are Warrior Gateway, a virtual community center connecting service members, veterans and military families to each other, to their local communities and to a wealth of knowledge. We harness state-of-the art technology and community collaboration to help today's military community make better decisions about what service provider they can go to for help. For more information visit www.warriorgateway.org

A Little About Our BIG Project - Patriots in Paint!

Patriots in Paint is a program designed to build a strong network of community involvement through art, activities and multi-media platforms. Through a large-scale mural series, Patriots in Paint seeks to honor the sacrifice and service of our nation’s bravest men and women and inspire millions in the community to come together and support our nation’s veterans.

Warrior Gateway, in partnership with mural artist Sam Welty, is creating a national movement that delivers local impact by rallying the community to recognize the work of local organizations serving the military. The murals will serve as call to action to collaborate and create a holistic solution to support our veterans and military families.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal this year is to raise $10,000 to cover some of the costs associated with painting 11,000 sq. ft. of canvas. That includes the supplies (canvas, paint, brushes and so on) along with supporting the talented Sam Welty during this marathon mural painting extravaganza (including food, transportation and a nice bed to sleep in each night). 

Not only will your donation go to support the creation of these magnificent murals but you'll get a little something in return. All will receive our endless gratitude and for a little extra cash you could be the proud owner of an original work of art from Mr. Welty himself. 

We really, really, really (did I say really) want to reach our goal so we can get this mural done right. But, if for some reason we don't hit the $10,000 mark - the funds will still be put to use to off-set the cost of all the materials we need. 

    The Impact

    Every year, American Airlines SkyBall honors a branch of the military and veterans from a particular conflict.  The funds raised during this gala go to support the Airpower Foundation in the Dallas - Fort Worth area and Warrior Gateway is proud to be partnering with the American Airlines SkyBall and the Airpower Foundation.

    Risks & Challenges

    The honest truth, 11,000 sq. ft. of canvas is no day at the park. But Sam Welty is certainly up for the challenge. Throughout his career he has painted hundreds of thousands of square feet of murals from Virginia Beach to New York City and nearly everywhere in between. 

    These murals will challenge Sam but with support from you, nothing can stop him. 

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Speaking of support to get this project done, we need VOLUNTEERS! Don't worry, you don't have to be a master mural artist to help out. We just need volunteers who have time to commit and aren't afraid to get a little dirty. Interested in volunteering? Email us today at Volunteer@warriorgateway.org! 

      Got Questions? Connect with us on social media to stay up to date with the progress of the project and ways to help if you are in the area.

That includes the supplies (canvas, paint, brushes and so on) along with supporting the talented Sam Welty during this marathon mural painting extravaganza (including food, transportation and a nice bed to sleep in each night). 
Not only will your donation go to support the creation of these magnificent murals but you'll get a little something in return. All will receive our endless gratitude and for a little extra cash you could be the proud owner of an original work of art from Mr. Welty himself. 
We really, really, really (did I say really) want to reach our goal so we can get this mural done right. But, if for some reason we don't hit the $10,000 mark - the funds will still be put to use to off-set the cost of all the materials we need. 

  The Impact Every year, American Airlines SkyBall honors a branch of the military and veterans from a particular conflict.  The funds raised during this gala go to support the Airpower Foundation in the Dallas - Fort Worth area and Warrior Gateway is proud to be partnering with the American Airlines SkyBall and the Airpower Foundation.
  Risks & Challenges The honest truth, 11,000 sq. ft. of canvas is no day at the park. But Sam Welty is certainly up for the challenge. Throughout his career he has painted hundreds of thousands of square feet of murals from Virginia Beach to New York City and nearly everywhere in between. 
These murals will challenge Sam but with support from you, nothing can stop him. 

  Other Ways You Can Help Speaking of support to get this project done, we need VOLUNTEERS! Don't worry, you don't have to be a master mural artist to help out. We just need volunteers who have time to commit and aren't afraid to get a little dirty. Interested in volunteering? Email us today at Volunteer@warriorgateway.org! 
Got Questions? Connect with us on social media to stay up to date with the progress of the project and ways to help if you are in the area.

story:
PLEASE JOIN THE BURMA-FOUNDATION'S HELPING HANDS CAMPAIGN TO ASSIST FLOOD VICTIMS IN MYANMAR.

The effect of Cyclone Koman on Myanmar (Burma), a developing country in South East Asia, is devastating. Weeks of ceaseless downpours since July 16 resulted in severe flash flooding in 11 out of 14 States in Myanmar. One hundred people have died and 1;000,000 have been impacted. However,the death toll and the number of flood-affected people has been rising. This is the worst flood in 100 years of Burmese history.

The flood waters toppled buildings, spilled over dams, created landslides, destroyed bridges, rail lines and roads, swallowed villages and trapped people in high flood waters. The heavy monsoon rain triggered flash floods, landslides and destroyed thousands of houses, schools, bridges and roads. There is no food, no water and little shelter. Whole villages have sunk in the flood and families, children and animals who have survived now have nowhere to go. They are being surrounded by fast currents and deep water. Bridges are being destroyed, and the lack of communication and emergency transportation has isolated them from food, clean water and shelter. Many areas are still completely cut off by high waters or damaged roads. 

Due to the Burmese government’s characteristic delayed response to the flood victims, private citizens and many local non-profit organizations are rushing to access the flooded areas, but many can only be reached by rescue boats and helicopters. Therefore, under life threatening conditions, many thirsty and starving people have been waiting hopefully to be rescued. 

The emergency management plan for natural disasters was not properly developed by the government although Burma previously experienced Cyclone Nargis in 2008. There are no real time status updates about the flood in state-run TV and radio. Only recently the Burmese government has admitted to its weak response to Cyclone Koman and has requested international aid. 

Currently, flood victims are in dire need of safe drinking water, food, clothing, shelter and medical supplies. Starving farm animals and pets are also in need of food. Additionally, the flood victims are faced with the daunting task of rebuilding their lives and livelihoods. 

PLEASE JOIN THE BURMA FOUNDATION'S HELPING HANDS CAMPAIGN TO ASSIST THE FLOOD VICTIMS IN MYANMAR.  Please do share this campaign with your friends and family. 

Burma-Foundation is a non-profit group comprised of expatriate Burmese in the US  and their American friends who support the needs of the Burmese community in many ways. We are launching this “Helping Hands Campaign” with two objectives:

  1. To support the local aid groups and NGOs currently helping at those affected areas.

  1. To buy the Emergency & Disaster Relief Water Purification Equipment ($9300/machine) to help affected villages purify drinking water.

With no overhead for administration, every dollar you donate will go directly into disaster relief efforts. Your donation will be used to purchase vital supplies such as medicine and water purification systems/equipment. Regardless of the dollar amount, your donation makes a big difference in helping flood victims. We thank you very much for your generosity. Contact us for any further inquiries concerning the donations or the situation of the current disaster, please feel free to contact us by email using the information given below:

Coban Tun – email: ct@yuyu.net

Htun Myat Oo - email: htunmyatoo@gmail.com

Robert Stone – email: robstone@cruzio.com

Yuyu Thein - email: yuyu@yuyu.net

story:
ABOUT THE ARTIST

My name is Stuart Lantry and I am an emerging artist from Los Angeles currently based out of Philadelphia.  I have received a Masters in Fine Arts from RISD’s Painting Department and a BA from Dartmouth College. 

ABOUT THE WORK

In this chaotic time where facts, truth and the basic tenets of reality seem constantly called into question, my work explores how we generate meaning from the surrounding barrage of stimulation. Using the artist's studio/scientist's lab as an ideal staging area for the production of meaning, I make mad machines. These complicated contraptions often create their own purpose and thereby solve a problem of their own devise. Turning ‘function’ on its head, my work wallows in its own absurdity. Individual pieces and installations often find themselves caught in continuous closed loops that perform my self-reflexive anxieties. Drawing on tensions both within myself and in relation to the surrounding built environment, my practice investigates aspects of routine while tenuously hovering on a hazy continuum between the past, present and future, fact and fiction. I try to use dark humor as a response to a world under duress, placing the viewer on a Mobius treadmill on which he or she must ask ‘where are we going?,’ 'is there value in effort?' or 'did I leave the water running?'

 

ABOUT THE PROJECT

Starting two years ago as my grad school thesis project, this sculpture began as an attempt to design a water-based economy of scale for a potential near future. However, given the limitations of a thesis show, the piece felt rushed and never quite at home in the Convention Center.  The sculpture needed reworking, retouching and a  new setting.  It was then that I remembered California City.

WHERE?

In 1958, sociology professor Nat Mendelsohn purchased 80,000 acres of empty land in the Mojave Desert, with the aim of master-planning a model city designed to rival Los Angeles in size. However, Mendelsohn’s city never grew the way he had anticipated. In fact, it barely happened at all.  Today, all that remains of California’s 3rd largest geographic city is a vacant urban grid of crumbling paved roads extending indefinitely from a a tiny cluster of buildings, the only developed part of town.  

California City

WHY?

As my practice’s focus shifted towards looking at how people generate meaning, I knew that I needed to film this water-based machine in the desert.  What better location than this section of desert, which was given the plans and physical structure for a city, but no people ever came. Nothing ever gave these streets life, purpose or meaning… at least not until my sculpture came along!

Over time I have also moved away from documenting my sculptures with a dry video designed to illustrate how the piece works.  Instead, I have started making commercials for my sculptures.  While a commercial is able to achieve the same amount of documentation, the form represents an immediately recognizable genre that explicitly explores  how a video-based presentation can generate meaning.   Hopefully, these commercials will be able to add a layer (s) of meaning to the documentation my meaning-generating machines.  

 

WHERE WILL YOUR MONEY GO?

As this campaign video was something of a test run for my proposed series of commercials, I have learned a lot about what I need to change in order to drastically increase the production quality.

WHAT YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS HELP FUND

  • Renting (Buying?) New Film Equipment
  • Improved Sound Equipment 
  • Green Screen Set up (lights, green fabric)
  • Editing Software (Final Cut Pro)
  • Art Supplies (hardware, wood, tiles, instrument parts, paint, wire, metal, etc. to finish final touches on the sculpture/machine)
  • Transportation (renting a U-haul to and from the film location in California City)
  • Paying my Film Crew (Unfortunately, the sculpture is both large and heavy. I will need at least one person on hand to film and help assemble the sculpture.  It goes without saying that having two people on hand would be twice as helpful.  However, I would like to be able to provide fair financial compensation to those who contribute to the project, given what the budget will allow)
  • Costumes
  • Etc.  (surprises always arise and having a small portion of the budget set aside for these unexpected moments will be essential)

 

Speaking of compensating my contributors… The table to the right of the page shows what you will receive for your contribution. As the value of your contribution increases, so to do the rewards and perks you will be able to claim.  Each of the perks is either a unique series or work of art created by myself as a way of saying thank you.  With these perks, you will be able to take a little piece of this project with you,  possessing a talisman for thought and a physical reminder of how you helped an young artist realize one of his ambitions.

 

If my entire goal is not reached, the video(s) will still get made.  Under these circumstances, the videos would have to be at a smaller budget and there would be the unfortunate and corresponding downgrade in production value associated with less funding and available resources.  

 

HELP IN A DIFFERENT WAY

Even if you can't afford to contribute right now, you may know someone who can or may want to. If you could share this page or tell a friend, it would help immensely! Every little contribution helps!

 

Thank you so much for your generosity, time and support of this project.  

 

 --Stuart Lantry

story:
The Interchangeable Mechanical Pen and Pencil is a single-bodied writing instrument that offers true portability and convenience with two writing systems, a compact construction, and uncomplicated swappable components, all the while maintaining strict adherence to minimal and industrial forms - for a pen that’s smart and looks good. 

The Interchangeable Mechanical Pen and Pencil is a hefty instrument, machined out of C3604 solid brass. It comes equipped with a removable clip; switch between full on minimalism and portability for all your carry demands. The pen system uses a standard refill size - Parker refills - ensuring accessibility (sold everywhere) and versatility (Parker size refills come in a variety of brands and styles). 

This is one tool to cover all your writing needs. With the build and aesthetic to support different situations - from carrying and travel, taking notes on the field, to signing deals.

 

 

 

Reviews:

Read what Mike from the Clicky Post has to say about our Mechanical Pen and Pencil, review available here. Mike runs the Clicky Post, a very high quality stationery blog with reviews on pens, pencils, fountain pens, notebooks, and ink refills.

Ed Jelley has a lovely stationery blog with some stunning high quality photography, with no shortage of reviews on fountain pens and machined pens. Check out his comprehensive review here. 

Joe from Gentleman Stationer has a great stationery blog with many categories and helpful yearly roundups of best stationery products. Read his review here.

More coming soon.

 

 

The Mechanical Pen and Pencil is precision machined out of solid C3604 brass for a full brass body construction. Specs are as follows: 

  • Mechanical Pen
  • 49g 13.7cm / 5.4” (Parker G2 refill for the Pen)
  • Mechanical Pencil
  • 49g 13.7cm / 5.4” (Schmidt DSM 2007 Pencil)

Each Interchangeable Mechanical Pen and Pencil will include:

  • Interchangeable Mechanical Pen and Pencil body
  • Push Cap for pen system
  • Eraser Cap for pencil system
  • Schmidt 9000 Easyflow M Pen Refill
  • Schmidt DSM 2007 Pencil Mechanism
  • 3 Spare eraser heads
  • A choice for knurled or solid end caps

The Mechanical Pen and Pencil present with two cap options for your choosing. A solid and smooth cap for a streamlined look, or a knurled cap for a more classic aesthetic.

 

We work with brass to bring vintage discernment to our otherwise minimal industrial look.  The Mechanical Pen and Pencil come in three finishes - raw brass, black oxide treatment, and brushed nickel plating.

 

The Interchangeable Mechanical Pen and Pencil is a powerhouse between the Schmidt DSM2007 pencil system and the Schmidt 9000 EasyFlow M pen refill.

Being one of the most popular refills in the pen world, the Schmidt 9000 EasyFlow writes with a rich, fast drying oil based black ink with a touch of sheen. It's one of the smoothest refills on the market.

The DSM 2007 pencil mechanism is a compact pencil advancing system that's both reliable and enjoyable to write with. The mechanism screws into the barrel with screw threads for added stability.

 

The Mechanical Pen and Pencil will already come marked with an individual serial number on the inside of the clip. For the first time ever, custom laser engraving on the outside of the cap is offered. 

 

 

Single Pack

One writing tool, two functions. For minimalists and functionalists seeking one do-it-all sleek instrument that can hold ink or graphite.

Double Pack

One for yourself, one for a friend. Or two for yourself. 

Double Pack + Pouch

Our favorite option: have both pen and pencil at your disposal at all times. This combo comes presented in a minimal, sleek, full-grain leather dual case, so you'll never have to sacrifice style for convenience. (Each comes with both systems and accessories for pen and pencil.)

Corporate Set (10x)

A gifting set - great for businesses, events, and parties. Complimentary engraving on clip included - company name or individual initials/names. We will reach out after campaign ends for engraving details.

Corporate Set (22x)

An even bigger gifting set - great for businesses, events, and parties. Complimentary engraving on clip included - company name or individual initials/names. We will reach out after campaign ends for engraving details.

 

We're a small company, but we're beginning to establish ourselves as a purveyor of fine goods and writing instruments. We've made headlines with past products and are skilled in the trade of product design, development, and manufacturing. We adhere to strict quality control and work closely with our factories in Taiwan to assure high quality products.

This time, we're partnering with the same factories that we've worked with over the past three years to deliver the new, much anticipated Interchangeable Mechanical Pen and Pencil. 

We're confident in our delivery dates and have teamed with up INDIEGOGO to be part of their Guaranteed Delivery program. 

 

We’re an independent design house specializing in refined goods and fine writing instruments. Our writing instruments are precision machined from solid metal stock with an updated aesthetic for the modern audience.

Reach out to us anytime at support@inventery.co or jeffrey@inventery.co. Have a question? Send us a message on Facebook and we'll get back to you immediately.

story:
Hello!

My name is Lousine Karibian and I'm on a mission to create the world's most highly recommended network for entrepreneurs!

I have decided to sell my paintings (yes I paint!) in helping raise funds for my first marketing campaign + my trip to China to meet with investors. 

I have always had a passion for art and creating things.  Years ago I had the opportunity to feature my paintings at a local boutique and host events to connect amazing people in the community to each other. 

This fun project and passion led to a 10 year journey in 'finding myself' and my life's mission through hosting world class networking events and connecting amazing people to opportunities. At the same time supporting local charities!

ABOUT MY COMPANY The World Networks is an invite only network connecting entrepreneurs to opportunities through our wold class networking events all while supporting local charities. 

WHY SUPPORT?  After hosting and attending hundreds of networking events with over 7,000 professionals in the past years I’ve come to realize many professionals lack the knowledge and skills needed for proper & effective networking.

Now that we are in the ‘age of entrepreneurship’ networking skills are most crucial for college students, professionals, and industry leaders who seek to stand out from their competition.

Hence, PEOPLE NEED OUR NETWORK! 

According to the Global Entrepreneurship Monitor

Entrepreneurs Now Numbering Near 400 Million In 54 Countries, According To GEM 2011 Global Report

The Global Entrepreneurship Monitor (GEM) 2011 Global Report finds an upsurge in entrepreneurship around the world – entrepreneurs are now numbering near 400 million in 54 countries -- with millions of new hires and job creation expectations in the coming years.

So if you LOVE ART and SUPPORT ENTREPRENEURS ... 
YOU CAN MAKE A DIFFERENCE with your pledge today!


MY BACKGROUND

Lousine Karibian aka the Networking Queen

Attended: North Hollywood High School, Valley Community College, 

Cal State University, Northridge 

Title: Founder, President at www.TheWorldNetworks.com

Mission: On a mission to create 1 million opportunities for entrepreneurs worldwide

Professional Background Includes: Networking,  Marketing & Events


What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to raise $11,000 to launch our 1st marketing campaign to reach 10,000 entrepreneurs in search of Ambassadors 
  • Ambassadors can be local artist, professionals, moms, college students etc... Anyone who is looking expand their network and give back to their community! They will have the opportunity to launch a chapter of The World Networks in their town to help create jobs and opportunities through our world class networking events
  • $4,000 out of $11,000 will be used for travel expanses to CHINA (3 cities I will visit) towards meetings with investors 

In Return For Your Contribution

You Get Paintings By Me + Other Perks 

  • By pledging today YOU WILL BE APART OF creating the worlds next big thing all while receiving some great art work for your home or office + other awesome perks! 
  • Some of my art is dated as old as 10 years ago! 
  • My paintings have been featured in 2 films, events, galleries, and boutiques 


The Impact

If you have attended my networking events you already know how important and effective they are in creating life long relationships and help grow your business 

  • We are in the age of entrepreneurship and times have changed!
  • More people are struggling with their life style in hopes of a better life for their families
  • Entrepreneurship is on the rise worldwide and by targeting the market with our company now we REALLY CAN MAKE A BIG DIFFERENCE in the lives of millions!  This might be the first campaign to many but your pledge and help in raising awareness will go a LONG WAY! 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    You can share this Indiegogo campaign via the share tools! You can also share on facebook, twitter, instagram etc... The more people see this the faster YOU CAN HELP me reach my goal! 

    HASHTAG #theworldnetworks #lousinekaribian

    And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Hello! 
My name is Lousine Karibian and I'm on a mission to create the world's most highly recommended network for entrepreneurs!
I have decided to sell my paintings (yes I paint!) in helping raise funds for my first marketing campaign + my trip to China to meet with investors. 
I have always had a passion for art and creating things.  Years ago I had the opportunity to feature my paintings at a local boutique and host events to connect amazing people in the community to each other. 
This fun project and passion led to a 10 year journey in 'finding myself' and my life's mission through hosting world class networking events and connecting amazing people to opportunities. At the same time supporting local charities!
ABOUT MY COMPANY The World Networks is an invite only network connecting entrepreneurs to opportunities through our wold class networking events all while supporting local charities. 



WHY SUPPORT?  After hosting and attending hundreds of networking events with over 7,000 professionals in the past years I’ve come to realize many professionals lack the knowledge and skills needed for proper & effective networking.
Now that we are in the ‘age of entrepreneurship’ networking skills are most crucial for college students, professionals, and industry leaders who seek to stand out from their competition.
Hence, PEOPLE NEED OUR NETWORK! 
According to the Global Entrepreneurship Monitor

Entrepreneurs Now Numbering Near 400 Million In 54 Countries, According To GEM 2011 Global ReportThe Global Entrepreneurship Monitor (GEM) 2011 Global Report finds an upsurge in entrepreneurship around the world – entrepreneurs are now numbering near 400 million in 54 countries -- with millions of new hires and job creation expectations in the coming years.

So if you LOVE ART and SUPPORT ENTREPRENEURS ... YOU CAN MAKE A DIFFERENCE with your pledge today!


MY BACKGROUND
Lousine Karibian aka the Networking Queen
Attended: North Hollywood High School, Valley Community College, 
Cal State University, Northridge 
Title: Founder, President at www.TheWorldNetworks.com
Mission: On a mission to create 1 million opportunities for entrepreneurs worldwide
Professional Background Includes: Networking,  Marketing & Events

  What We Need & What You Get
We need to raise $11,000 to launch our 1st marketing campaign to reach 10,000 entrepreneurs in search of Ambassadors 
Ambassadors can be local artist, professionals, moms, college students etc... Anyone who is looking expand their network and give back to their community! They will have the opportunity to launch a chapter of The World Networks in their town to help create jobs and opportunities through our world class networking events

$4,000 out of $11,000 will be used for travel expanses to CHINA (3 cities I will visit) towards meetings with investors  


In Return For Your Contribution
You Get Paintings By Me + Other Perks 

By pledging today YOU WILL BE APART OF creating the worlds next big thing all while receiving some great art work for your home or office + other awesome perks! 
Some of my art is dated as old as 10 years ago! 
My paintings have been featured in 2 films, events, galleries, and boutiques 







  The Impact
If you have attended my networking events you already know how important and effective they are in creating life long relationships and help grow your business 

We are in the age of entrepreneurship and times have changed!
More people are struggling with their life style in hopes of a better life for their families 
Entrepreneurship is on the rise worldwide and by targeting the market with our company now we REALLY CAN MAKE A BIG DIFFERENCE in the lives of millions!  This might be the first campaign to many but your pledge and help in raising awareness will go a LONG WAY! 


  Other Ways You Can Help
You can share this Indiegogo campaign via the share tools! You can also share on facebook, twitter, instagram etc... The more people see this the faster YOU CAN HELP me reach my goal! 
HASHTAG #theworldnetworks #lousinekaribian

story:
[Türkçe metin için lütfen aşağı ininiz.]

[Scroll down for English text]

Ein Partizipative Ausstellungsprojekt:

ABC des Bundesverbands der Migrantinnen // Ein Weibliches Wörterbuch

Wir Frauen des Bundesverbands der Migrantinnen stammen aus den verschiedensten Regionen der Türkei, unsere Wege kreuzten sich hier in Deutschland. Am 28. November werden wir in Köln nicht nur unser 10jähriges Jubiläum feiern, sondern auch eine PopUp-Ausstellung vorbereiten, die unseren Weg bis heute darstellen wird. Mit der Ausstellung schreiben wir unser ABC des Bundesverbands der Migrantinnen!

In diesem ABC werden die in den letzten 10 Jahren lancierten Kampagnen und Projekte vorkommen, unsere Feste und Veranstaltungen, unsere Pressemitteilungen und natürlich auch unsere Zeitschrift "Frau" mit ihren bunten Artikeln. Vor allem geht es in der Ausstellung aber um die vielen Beziehungen, die wir zu unterschiedlichsten Frauen aufbauen konnten. Mit diesem ABC der Migrantinnen möchten wir ein Werk erstellen, das unsere Arbeit, unsere Weltanschauung und unsere Kämpfe bündelt, ein weibliches Wörterbuch!

Bilder sagen manchmal mehr als Worte: Was die letzten 10 Jahre für unsere Mitglieder aus ganz Deutschland bedeuten, welche Wörter sie zum Ausdruck bringen, welche Gefühle und Farben sie in ihnen hervorrufen, all das werden sie durch Fotos ausdrücken. Am Ende wird uns eine Ausstellung mit 29 Fotografien erwarten, die von 11 Städten und mehr als 300 Mitgliedern des Bundesverbandes erstellt wurde. Die Fotos und die Dokumentation der Ausstellung werden Teil der Bibliothek der Alten, einem künstlerischen Erinnerungsprojekt im Historischen Museum Frankfurt. Auf diese Weise werden unsere Erinnerungen Teil der Stadtgeschichte und der offiziellen Überlieferung.

Hoch die Solidarität der Frauen! 
Gegen Rassismus und Diskriminierung; für Gleichberechtigung und Freiheit! 


*** 

2005 kamen in Frankfurt Frauen aus verschiedenen Altersgruppen aus der ganzen Bundesrepublik zusammen. Unter ihnen Arbeiterinnen, Arbeitslose, Hausfrauen, Schülerinnen und Studentinnen und Akademikerinnen -  die alle eines verbindet: Ihre Stimme gegen Rassismus und Diskriminierung; für Gleichberechtigung und Freiheit. So wurde der Bundesverband der Migranntinen gegründet und erstreckte sich wenig später auch nach Köln, Berlin, Stuttgart, Hamburg, Düsseldorf und 25 weitere Städte. 

Zum einen ist da der Bundesverband der Migrantinnen, mit dem wir unsere Probleme als Migrantinnen zu Wort bringen können, auf der anderen Seite möchten wir mit Frauen aus Deutschland, die dieselben Forderungen haben wie wir, einen Dialog aufbauen und Vorurteile aus dem Weg räumen. Damit das gemeinschaftliche Leben noch besser funktionieren kann, glauben wir als Bundesverband an gemeinsame Arbeit und Solidarität. Wir rufen auf, gemeinsam in den Kampf zu gehen, um die unterschiedlichen Probleme, die alle Frauen betreffen, zu bekämpfen: Sei es die in Deutschland herrschende Spaltungspolitik, die in unseren Herkunftsländern unsichere politische Lage, soziale und kulturelle Angewohnheiten oder Druck aus der Gesellschaft und der Familie. 

http://www.bda119.de/ausstellung-zum-10-jahrige...

----- *** ----- *** -----

Katılımcı Bir Sergi Projesi

Göçmen Kadınlar Birliği’nin ABC’si  // Dişil Bir Sözlük

Türkiye’nin farklı coğrafyalarından gelen ve yolları Almanya’da kesişen biz Göçmen Kadınlar Birliği (GKB), 28 Kasım Cumartesi günü Köln’de düzenlediğimiz şenlikte 10. yılımızı kutluyoruz ve hem bizi hem de bugüne kadar verdiğimiz mücadeleleri anlatacak bir sergi hazırlıyoruz; Göçmen Kadınlar Birliği’nin ABC’si.

Irkçılık va Ayrımcılığa Karşı; Eşitlik ve Özgürlük İçin

10 yıl boyunca yürüttüğümüz projelerden, gerçekleştirdiğimiz etkinliklerden, hazırladığımız basın açıklamalarından, “Kadın” dergimizde yayınladığımız yazılardan ve en önemlisi kadınlarla kurduğumuz ilişkilerden, birlikte mücadelenin kadınlara hissettirdiklerinden, hareketle hazırlayacağımız bu sergide, GKB’nin çalışmalarını, hayata bakışını ve mücadele alanlarını bir araya getiren Dişil Bir Sözlük oluşturmak istiyoruz.

Almanya’nın farklı kentlerinde yaşayan GKB üyeleri, geride bıraktıkları 10 yılı A’dan Z’ye düşünürken hangi kelimelerin, nesnelerin, duyguların ve hatta renklerin onlar için ne anlama geldiğini listeliyor ve kendi çekecekleri ya da hazır bulunan fotoğraflarla ifadelerini görselleştiriyor. Sonunda 29 fotoğrafın yer alacağı bu sergiyi 11 kentte 300’den fazla GKB üyesi kadın birlikte hazırlıyor.

Umudu Büyüt, Harekete Geç, Mücadeleye Katıl!

Dayanışmanın mücadeleci gücüne inanarak desteğinizi bekliyoruz.

Yaşasın [kadın] dayanışma[sı]!

http://www.bda119.de/10-yil-senligi-icin-sergi-...

***

Almanya’nın farklı şehirlerinden, farklı yaş gruplarından ve kuşaklardan, işçi, işsiz, ev kadını, öğrenci, akademisyen kadınların birleşimiyle bir araya gelen Göçmen Kadınlar Birliği (GKB), ırkçılığa ve ayrımcılığa karşı; eşitlik ve özgürlük için mücadele etmek üzere, 2005 yılında Frankfurt’ta kuruldu ve daha sonra Köln, Berlin, Stuttgart, Hamburg ve Düsseldorf’un da aralarında olduğu 25’ten fazla kente yayıldı. GKB bir taraftan göçmen kadınlar olarak yaşadığımız sorunlardan hareket ederken diğer taraftan yerli ve göçmen kadınlar olarak ortak talepler etrafında buluşmayı, karşılıklı önyargılarımızı birlikte aşmayı hedefliyor. Uyum ve ortak yaşamı daha ileri noktalardan gerçekleştirmek için işbirliği ve dayanışmanın önemine inanan GKB, Almanya’daki ayrımcı yasalar ve uygulamalar, geldiğimiz ülkenin siyasi belirsizliği, sosyal ve kültürel alışkanlıkları, aile ve toplum yapısı nedeniyle yaşadığımız farklı sorunlarla birlikte mücadele etme çağrısı yapıyor. 


----- *** ----- *** -----


A Participatory Exhibition Project

ABC of Migrant Women Association // A Female Vocabulary 

Migrant Women Association in Germany has been struggling against racism and discrimination and fighting for equality and freedom for 10 years. Due our 10th Anniversary festival on the 28th November 2015 in Köln, we are currently working on a participatory exhibition project, which will be presenting our 10 years from A to Z: The ABC of Migrant Women Association. We are developing “a female vocabulary” joined with images to visualize words, feelings, notions and even colors, which talk about us, and our works. This project, which criticizes the reflections of masculine world in our socio-political, cultural and daily lives, aims to engage with more women and inform them about our works. Therefore, we are planning to exhibit our exhibition project in different cities and countries. With a similar objective, we are going to publish an exhibition book. In addition to the texts and the images displayed in the exhibition, we are going to enhance the book including reviews of exhibition visitors. Additionally, some articles published previously in our magazine “KADIN (Woman)” will be included into the book. The magazine has been regularly published since 2007, and contains direct material for a retrospective review of our 10 years history. 

To reach our goal and open the exhibition, in other words to print the texts, the images and the exhibition book, we need your support!

The Migrant Women Association (Germany) is based on volunteering, and the exhibition project is in the same way.

Every support that you can give is an important solidarity for us, and a precious contribution for our struggle. 

Thank you!

story:
Chikara: The Art of Horimitsu

力
Chikara: A Japanese word meaning power, capability or influence. 

Power can mean so many things in life. For tattooer and artist, Horimitsu, power is about inspiration and motivation in his work.

Mitsu has been creating traditional Japanese tattoos for 20 years in Ikebukuro, Tokyo and he gathers inspiration from all around him.

Tokyo is a place like no other and Horimitsu is truly one of a kind! You can see some of his work and life on Instagram.

Art is his passion and he works with clients spanning the globe to give them living pieces of art on their skin.

Although he has been a part of the renowned Horitoshi Family, his work is unmistakably his own.

He is constantly drawing, constantly improving, producing phenomenal pieces on both skin and paper.


The Book

We have collected and presented a wide range of Mitsu's tattoo work and art in a 130-150 page book. 

The layout for the book is almost complete!

The cover will be specially designed by Mitsu when the campaign has finished.

The book is divided into three sections: tattoos, sketches (various media) and tigers. Below are some examples!

Sketches and Artwork:

Tigers:

Mitsu has been working on a series of images called #100tigers. Since the project is ongoing, we decided to include as many of these amazing images as possible.

Tattoos:

There are also more images of  Horimitsu's tattoo work available on his website.

The Perks

We have a number of great perks for our campaign!

We are launching with an initial set and we will be adding some more as we go along so be sure to check back often!

Prints

  • Samurai Print

    

     14x10 unframed print

  • Oni Print

    10x14 unframed print


Original Artwork

    •   Wave Painting



    14 x 10 inch Painting unframed.
      .
    • Tiger & Botan
     


      A5 original sketch unframed.
    • Purple Dragon
     


      A5 original sketch unframed.

    • Drunken Koi
     
      A5 original sketch unframed.
    • Fudo Myoo

           

    A5 original sketch unframed

    • Tiger #1

      A5 original sketch unframed.

    • Tiger #2 (sold)

      A5 original sketch unframed.

    • Tiger #3 (sold)

      A5 original sketch unframed.

    • Tiger Set (sold)

      Two A5 original sketch unframed.

  • Cat Buddah (sold)

    A5 original sketch unframed.

  • Whirlpool oni (sold)

    A5 original sketch unframed.

    • Wave Painting

    Stretch Goals

    We currently have two stretch goals:

    $8500 - More art originals will become available.

    $9000 - We will choose the best quality paper offered by the printer, add printed end sheets and have the title of the book foil embossed onto the cover.

    Shipping and Fulfillment

    When the campaign is over, we will send the book layout off to the printers as soon as possible.

    We will then have to wait for proof copies of the book to arrive to ensure they are of the best quality. Then comes the full printing and the books will be shipped to an Amazon warehouse. All completed books will be shipped from the USA using Amazon Fulfillment Services to backers.

    Bonus! Original artwork will be sent from either Vancouver or Tokyo as soon as the funds are released so you will not have to wait for the book to get your goodies!


    Risks & Challenges

    So, what is the risk with this campaign?

    Basically, printing a hardcover art book is expensive! The campaign represents what it will cost for us to get a run of professionally printed copies of the book.

    If the fundraising goal is not met, a print-to-order soft cover book will still be produced for those who ordered the original book.

    How Else Can I Help?

    We know that not everyone can contribute financially, but please share this campaign on Instagram and other social networks to help us make this book the best it can be! Please post on Instagram with the hashtag #horimitsubook.

$9000 - We will choose the best quality paper offered by the printer, add printed end sheets and have the title of the book foil embossed onto the cover.

Shipping and FulfillmentWhen the campaign is over, we will send the book layout off to the printers as soon as possible. We will then have to wait for proof copies of the book to arrive to ensure they are of the best quality. Then comes the full printing and the books will be shipped to an Amazon warehouse. All completed books will be shipped from the USA using Amazon Fulfillment Services to backers. Bonus! Original artwork will be sent from either Vancouver or Tokyo as soon as the funds are released so you will not have to wait for the book to get your goodies!
  
Risks & Challenges

So, what is the risk with this campaign?Basically, printing a hardcover art book is expensive! The campaign represents what it will cost for us to get a run of professionally printed copies of the book.If the fundraising
goal is not met, a print-to-order soft cover book will still be
produced for those who ordered the original book.How Else Can I Help?


 We know that not everyone can contribute financially, but please share this campaign on Instagram and other social networks to help us make this book the best it can be! Please post on Instagram with the hashtag #horimitsubook.

story:
Who Am I?

I am a teen trying to break out into animation, as well as film in general, and suck at introductions. Lately I have created a large number of drawings, small doodles like the one above, and have developed an art style I enjoy developing. I use sharpies, drawing paper, and pastel to create these doodles then scan them, and sharpen the images in Photoshop. I feel if I expand to a digital art the quality of these drawings could improve tremendously. Reason for my choice in digital art is I have aspirations to create animations, as well as comic strips, of these characters I create in the hopes of building a portfolio to help in the upcoming college years, and hope to incorporate this hobby into a future career.  


Where Does Funding Go Towards?

This campaign is set at $1000 due to the specific drawing tablet I am hoping to acquire, the Wacom Brand Cintiq 13hd. The reason I am aiming for this tablet is due to to its portability as well having a screen to help in animating. Having used Adobe Flash with a mouse this tablet would be a great step up, gaining more control over brush and pen strokes.  

If the goal is not met I would use the acquired funds to put towards the tablet, or try and acquire a tablet that's similar in functionality, but lower in price. Since I am not a professional artist I can offer a small random doodles with notes for contributions, and anything else feel free to contact me to work something out. As far as the doodles are concerned they are in the same style seen in the gallery, can be sent as scanned image or the original, whichever method you would prefer. I greatly appreciate any contributions made, and if none are made well it was great to take a chance.  If by some small chance I exceed funding by a relatively large amount, I will most likely put some money towards a college saving, donate some to charity, and would be open to any suggestions, assuming that even happens.

The Impact

I would improve tremendously in my work if this campaign is successful, as I can finally start to build a portfolio of animation  to branch out to new internships, and colleges in the upcoming months. As with any new medium I would take the time to hone my skills with the tablet, and hope to venture out into new art styles. My dream is to be an animator to incorporate my love for film in a fun way, not only to have fun, but challenge my skills in screenwriting, drawing, and video editing. It seems everyone breaking out into animation would want to become as successful as someone like Don Hertzfeldt, Ralph Bakshi, or Matt Groening, albeit that is something I would love to achieve I would be happy in just having this new hobby, and if I could make a living from my new hobby that would be amazing too. Like any other campaign you are taking a chance on someone you don't know, I understand the need to be hesitant in supporting someone new, and with that said I hope you can take a chance in helping me open new doors in life.

Risks & Challenges

The only challenges would be meeting the funding goal, but as I previously said any contribution is greatly appreciated. If you are curious in knowing whether or not the funds actually went towards acquiring the tablet I would be more than happy to post proof of purchase on the campaign page, along with photos of purchasing the product, as well as the actual product itself when it arrives.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't fund this project that's fine I would greatly appreciate you spreading the word in any way you can. If this campaign does not succeed, whether I acquire not enough funding or none at all, It's great just to put these small sketches out there in the world, and if you spread the designs around to people to generate interest, that's awesome too. If you read through all of this I greatly appreciate the time taken, and thank you so much for any help you offer or simply reading this.

story:
The Monochrome Project

Every day in Tanzania, albino men, women and children are persecuted in the name of witchcraft! With threats of torment, amputated limbs and even death these people with albinism have been forced to live in compounds for their own safety. The Monochrome Project has three aims:

  • To raise awareness of the persecution of persons with albinism and the witchcraft rituals that lead to their torment. 
  • To let these people with albinism tell their story through photography.
  • To publish their photos and raise further money and awareness of the charities trying to support these people.

The plight of these people is often ignored and is certainly underrepresented in the media. You can help by supporting this three-tiered project of awareness, expression and support.

A NOTE ON THE TITLE: The Monochrome Project was chosen as a title to reflect the use of black and white photography and also because monochrome is the opposite of colour, a point of pain for many of these people.  In addition this project is about capturing the stories of these individuals. It is often said that there is no better way to capture emotion than monochrome photography.

The Plan

Here are some more specific details about how the money will be spent:

  • We hope to send at least £100 on disposable black & white cameras to various albino compounds in Tanzania. The camera will be distributed amongst men, women and children of all ages with the brief 'to tell their story'.  
  • We will also submit a form to each person along with the camera, asking them to tell us their story or to write a poem for inclusion in the book.
  • When all the cameras have been used they will be returned to the UK and the photos will be developed. Selection will be made of photos for the book, text will be edited and publishers approached.
  • If publishers do not accept the work a website will be launched to promote the cause. 
  • If the fund raising goal is not reached, all proceeds will be submitted to the Tanzania Albino Charity for use where they see fit. 

The Impact

With 1 in every 1428 Tanzanians is born with albinism. The Monochrome Project would initially one reach a handful of these people, but the raising of awareness has the potential to make a real impact in this area:

  • Raising awareness of the Tanzanian albino situation - human-rights issue - without endangering those affected. 
  • Giving these people a voice, a means of expression to tell their story.
  • To create a book or website that will continue to promote these people, the charities and their cause.

Risks & Challenges

So what are the risks...?

  • If we did not reach our budget then the cameras could not be sent and the funds would be donated to the Tanzania Albino Charity who are always in need of new clothing etc. for the people they care for.
  • Similar projects in the past associated with artistic causes have proved very successful. We would not have to worry about the photographs not being good enough. 
  • If the publishers reject us, again no problem. We will instead launch a website to promote the cause through the stories of these people.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute for whatever reason, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please promote The Monochrome Project through, societies, friends,  social media and any other ways you can think of. 
  • Getting the word out about these people's lives is always important!

If you want to find out more or donate to another Tanzanian Albino Charity visit Tanzania Albino Charity or Under the Same Sun for more information.

story:
Hi there!

Thank you in advance for taking the time to visit my IndieGoGo crowd funding page. If you already know of my recent Drama School success, thank you so much for visiting my page for more info - if you've stumbled across this page by accident... please do bear with me!

I'm Alex, I'm a 22-year-old aspiring actor from Yorkshire, and after a gruelling year of working, travelling and auditioning, and one very tough decision, I am delighted and incredibly proud to say that I have accepted a place at the highly prestigious Guildford School of Acting to start training this September for an MA in Acting!

www.gsauk.org/courses/postgraduate/ma-acting

I am a recent graduate of Lancaster University, graduating in July 2014 with a First Class BA Hons in English Literature and History. Acting is, and always has been, my love and my passion, and it was while studying my degree, performing in every single spare moment, that I was hit with the realisation that a career in acting wasn't just a wild ambition, but an attainable goal I had the drive and ability to achieve. Now I have the opportunity to turn a lifelong passion into my profession.

To be offered a place to study at any UK Drama Accredited School is a great privilege and the very highest of praise, and this MA Acting course at GSA will provide me with the training I both need and desire to prepare me for a career in professional acting. The course offers an intensive year of cross-disciplinary training in acting, physical and vocal techniques, in both contemporary and classical texts. There are also classes in screen acting, contemporary, ballroom and Latin dance, stage combat, and professional preparation seminars.

I've worked tirelessly to get this far, and I'm incredibly pumped to get started... however, there's just one final obstacle remaining; the dreaded 'M' word... Money.

Anyone who has trained at Drama School themselves, or knows somebody who has, will know it's anything but cheap. On top of this, there are NO student loans or grants available for Masters courses at Drama Schools. This means my tuition fees have to be completely self-funded... and at a whopping £13,500, that's quite a challenge.

Having spent the last 12 months since graduating from university working as a bar supervisor, gigging in bars and restaurants, picking up acting work where I can, and being lucky enough to have a wonderfully generous and supportive family, I've managed to save away most of the funds I need for the course, but the very last financial leg is proving the most difficult.

So with a couple of months to go before I start my course in September, I'm still around £3,500 short, and this is where this page, and your kind selves, come in! I'm asking for your generosity to help me reach my target, and while I know funding my actor training is by no means life changing in the grand scheme of things, your hard-earned pennies would mean the world to me, and really will be the difference between me being able to pursue my ambition, and not.

But of course, I would never expect you to part with your hard-earned pennies without being able to offer you a thank you in return. This is why I love IndieGoGo! If you look to the right of this page, you'll see a column of 'Perks'. If you are lovely enough to part with one of the amounts on the right, I have put together some little perks, from thank you cards, to bespoke songs, to theatre tickets, to say a HUGE thank you, and show you how much your generosity is appreciated!

So there we go!

Thank you very much for taking the time to read my story. If you are able to part with any of your hard-earned pennies and pounds, or can take the time to share this page with your friends through FaceTube and TweetBook, I would be endlessly grateful. Your generosity really is very much appreciated, and really will make a massive difference. Every little really does help!

If you’d like to know more about my acting work to-date, below is a selection of my current work, as well as productions I have performed in, on both stage and screen, over the last few years!

Many thanks again for your time,

All the best,

Alex


Current Productions and Projects:

- Currently a registered Street Performer at Edinburgh Festival Fringe 2015.

- Bottom/Romeo/Lysander/Musician, SHAKESPEARE'S YORKSHIRE, The Think:Light Platform, Jervaulx Abbey, North Yorkshire - July 25/26th

       More info at - www.thinklightplatform.co.uk

- I was also one of 24 actors selected from over 1100 applicants to attend IdeasTap ‘Inspires’ residential bootcamp workshops with the Royal Shakespeare Company in January 2015.

Credits 2011-present:

Screen:

2015, Digital Tour, Presenter, QUEEN STREET MILL TEXTILE MUSEUM INTERACTIVE DIGITAL TOUR, BlackBeard Media, Jay Walton

2014, Student Film, Graham, ALL THAT REMAINS, Lancaster University Film Production, Angelo Cupani

2014, Advert, POST OFFICE: #LOVESUNDAYS, The Post Office™

2011, Short (Post Prod.), Mutant, THE WASTELANDER: THE LOST CITY, Dream It/Blue Yonder Productions, Jonathan Bentley

Radio:

2015, Josh, HERE FOR YOU, 87.7 Bailrigg FM, Simon James

Stage:

2014, Stanhope, JOURNEY’S END, Merchants 1688, Lancaster Offshoots

2014, Community Choir, NOT UNTIL WE ARE LOST, Live at LICA & Lancaster Castle, Ockham's Razor Theatre Co., Turtle Key Arts

2014, Lysander, A MIDSUMMER NIGHT’S DREAM, Lancaster Castle (Open-air), Bingo Dragon Theatre Co., David Findlay

2014, Lucentio, THE TAMING OF THE SHREW, A-Wing: Lancaster Prison, Bingo Dragon Theatre Co., David Findlay

2013, Anthony, SWEENEY TODD: THE DEMON BARBER OF FLEET STREET, Nuffield Theatre/Live at LICA, Lancaster Offshoots

2013, The Knight, THE CANTERBURY TALES, Edinburgh Festival Fringe, The Space UK, Lancaster Offshoots
